line: Hey, what are you mumbling about?
Okarin? Earth to Okarin!
You talking to someone?

name: Rintaro
line: ...No, I was just talking to someone. Everything’s fine. I’m about to infiltrate the assembly hall.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, Doctor Nakabachi got the jump on us, but I’ll make sure he tells us everything.

name: Rintaro
line: What!? The Organization is already on the move!?

name: Rintaro
line: I see... so that’s the choice of Steins Gate. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Mayuri
line: Who was that on the phone?

name: Rintaro
line: If I told you, I’d have to kill you.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh, wow. Thanks, Okarin!

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin! Okarin!

name: Rintaro
line: How many times do I have to tell you? Don’t call me Okarin.

name: Mayuri
line: Huh? But I’ve always called you that.

name: Rintaro
line: That was then! I have since become Hououin Kyouma, the insane mad scientist hunted by secret organizations the world over. Muhahaha!

name: Mayuri
line: But that’s too hard to remember.

name: Mayuri
line: And besides, it doesn’t even sound like Okabe Rintaro. You’re weird, ehehe!

name: Mayuri
line: So, Okarin, can I ask you something?

name: Mayuri
line: What are we doing here?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait. You followed me here without knowing why?

name: Mayuri
line: Yup.

name: Rintaro
line: We’re here for Doctor Nakabachi’s press conference.

name: Mayuri
line: Press conference? But where are the reporters?

name: Rintaro
line: Could this be the Organization working its twisted influence?

name: Rintaro
line: I’d prefer not to get wrapped up in his mess.

name: Mayuri
line: You wrapped something? Is it his birthday too? Ehehe!

name: Rintaro
line: Keep your guard up, Mayuri. I suspect this won’t be a normal confer--

name: Mayuri
line: An earthquake? Is it magnitude 2? What does magnitude mean again?

name: Rintaro
line: An explosion!?

name: Rintaro
line: What the...

name: Woman
line: Please stay back, everybody!

name: Woman
line: The press conference will proceed as scheduled!

name: Rintaro
line: I’ve got a nose for conspiracies, and this stinks of a coverup. What are they hiding? What was that explosion?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. I’ve got a bad feeling about this. Something’s happening, and I have no idea what it is.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Yeah, I know. Don’t worry. I won’t do anything to jeopardize the mission. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing?

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm?

name: Mayuri
line: Well... I really want an Upa.

name: Rintaro
line: Then go for it. I can’t guarantee you’ll get an Upa, though.

name: Mayuri
line: But Mayushii’s all out of 100-yen coins.

name: Mayuri
line: So, can I borrow 100 yen? Please?

name: Rintaro
line: Do you think it’s that easy, Mayuri? You’ll get no money from me. Instead, I’ll show you just how harsh life really is.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, ahh...

name: Mayuri
line: It’s an Upa! And it’s metal! A Metal Upa!

name: Rintaro
line: Is it rare?

name: Mayuri
line: Super rare!

name: Boy
line: Aw, a normal Upa...

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph. I give this creature of metal to you, Mayuri.

name: Mayuri
line: Really!? Are you sure, Okarin?

name: Rintaro
line: The name’s Hououin Kyouma!

name: Mayuri
line: Ehehe! Thank you, Okarin.

name: Presenter
line: Thank you all for coming to Doctor Nakabachi’s Time Machine Press Conference.

name: Rintaro
line: Sounds like they’re starting.

name: Rintaro
line: Let’s go, Mayuri.

name: Mayuri
line: Mm... just a sec. I gotta write my name.

name: Presenter
line: Without further ado, I am pleased to introduce the inventor, Doctor Nakabachi! Please welcome him with a big round of applause!

name: Nakabachi
line: I am Doctor Nakabachi. Thank you all for coming.

name: Nakabachi
line: Now then, ladies and gentlemen, allow me to begin with my theory of time travel, the greatest scientific breakthrough of the century.

name: Mayuri
line: Did he really build a time machine?

name: Rintaro
line: DOOOOOCTOOOOOOOORRR!!

name: Rintaro
line: Do you take us for fools!?

name: Nakabachi
line: Who the hell are you?

name: Rintaro
line: Who the hell am I!? Someone who knows you for a fraud, that’s who!

name: Rintaro
line: You stole your theory from John Titor! And you call yourself an inventor!?

name: Nakabachi
line: S-someone throw this man out!

name: Rintaro
line: You’re the one we should throw out, Doctor! Have you no shame!? You have no right to call yourself an inventor!

name: Nakabachi
line: Shut your mouth, you little pest!

name: Rintaro
line: Unhand me, you... huh?

name: Rintaro
line: Ah...

name: Kurisu
line: Could you come with me for a moment?

name: Rintaro
line: Y-you’re with the Organization!?

name: Kurisu
line: Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: If their tendrils have gotten this far, then I’ve made a grave mistake.

name: Kurisu
line: Stop fooling around and come with me.

name: Rintaro
line: Try anything and people are sure to notice. What will your superiors say then?

name: Kurisu
line: What are you talking about?

name: Kurisu
line: I just need to ask you something.

name: Rintaro
line: What makes you think I’ll answer? I know how the Organization operates.

name: Kurisu
line: What’s with this ’Organization’ stuff?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. I’ve been caught by an Organization agent. ...Yes, it’s Makise Kurisu. She’s a dangerous one. ...No, it’s fine. I’ll find a way to--

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing!?

name: Kurisu
line: Huh? Your phone’s off.

name: Kurisu
line: ...Who were you talking to?

name: Rintaro
line: Y-your techniques don’t work on me, but I’ll tell you anyway. That’s no ordinary phone. It’s designed to deactivate the moment it leaves my hand. Muhahaha!

name: Kurisu
line: ...So you talk to yourself.

name: Rintaro
line: Guh!

name: Kurisu
line: What were you trying to tell me earlier?

name: Rintaro
line: What are you talking about?

name: Kurisu
line: About fifteen minutes ago. Before the conference started.

name: Kurisu
line: You were trying to tell me something, right? You looked really upset.

name: Kurisu
line: You looked like you were going to start crying any second.

name: Kurisu
line: Why? Have we met before?

name: Kurisu
line: And how do you know my name?

name: Rintaro
line: My knowledge has no limits.

name: Rintaro
line: Genius girl, our next meeting shall be as enemies!

name: Kurisu
line: Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: Farewell! Muhahaha!

name: Rintaro
line: Damn the Organization! They must be serious if they’re sending in agents like her!

name: Rintaro
line: But I can’t let them capture me yet.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Damn. I left Mayuri behind.

name: Rintaro
line: Hm? An email?

name: Rintaro
line: Dammit, Mayuri. Why won’t you pick up?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait, don’t tell me! Did that femme fatale kidnap Mayuri!?

name: Rintaro
line: Damn you! Is that how the Organization operates!?

name: Rintaro
line: I have to go back for her.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh, looks like I scared her off.

name: Rintaro
line: So be it. I’ll let her go this time.

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri! Why didn’t you pick up? We’re leaving.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin! My Metal Upa ran away.

name: Rintaro
line: Ran away? What, it’s alive? That’s a little hard to believe.

name: Mayuri
line: I think I dropped it...

name: Rintaro
line: Forget about it. You can always get another one.

name: Mayuri
line: No way. Metal Upas sell upwards of 10,000 yen online, you know?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait... what?

name: Rintaro
line: Think, Mayuri! Where did you drop it!?

name: Mayuri
line: I don’t know! That’s why I’m looking. And even if we find it, you can’t sell it, okay?

name: Rintaro
line: Muhahaha! That 10,000 yen will fund my research!

name: Mayuri
line: I said you can’t sell it! It even has Mayushii’s name on it.

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Upa, Upa, come out, come out, wherever you are!

name: Rintaro
line: What kind of man steals a helpless girl’s toy? Is there nothing in his heart but the lust for money!?

name: Mayuri
line: Sounds like you, Okarin!
AHHHHHHHHHHH!

name: Mayuri
line: Was that a scream?

name: Rintaro
line: Stay here, Mayuri!

name: Rintaro
line: Wha...

name: Rintaro
line: No... but... why?

name: Presenter
line: Uwahhh!

name: Presenter
line: Call the police!

name: Mayuri
line: What happened, Okarin?

name: Rintaro
line: W-we’re leaving!

name: Rintaro
line: Haah, haah...

name: Mayuri
line: Hey, what happened? You look really pale...

name: Rintaro
line: Someone... died.

name: Mayuri
line: Eh...

name: Rintaro
line: Wha!?

name: Rintaro
line: They’re gone...

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, you. Can you see us?

name: Rintaro
line: Why won’t you answer? I’m asking you a question. Yes, you on the other side of the monitor.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph. Your silence only strengthens my hypothesis.

name: Rintaro
line: I suppose that, from your perspective, it appears that we are the ones inside the monitor. Heh heh heh, but that’s where you’re wrong!

name: Rintaro
line: For it is you who are inside! Your reality is nothing but lies and shadows. Naturally, that includes you, too.

name: Rintaro
line: True reality is on this side of the screen.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t believe me? I don’t blame you. Few are those who can handle the truth.

name: Rintaro
line: But no matter. I shall speak in simpler terms, easy enough for even you to understand.

name: Rintaro
line: This is the Future Gadget Laboratory, located in the Akihabara district of Tokyo. We call it simply... the lab. Our purpose is to shatter the System and plunge the world into chaos.

name: Mayuri
line: Really? You shouldn’t do bad things, Okarin.

name: Rintaro
line: Quiet. I’m a mad scientist, remember?

name: Rintaro
line: From the station, head down Chuo-dori until you reach Suehirocho Station, then take a left onto Kuramaebashi-dori. In the alley before the traffic light, you’ll find the run-down Ohiyama Building. The lab is on the second floor.

name: Rintaro
line: On the first floor is a store of ill repute called the Braun Tube Workshop. You can’t miss it.

name: Rintaro
line: It deals exclusively in CRT monitors, of all things. Can you imagine? Even in the heart of Akihabara’s Electric Town, the demand for CRTs is practically nonexistent.

name: Rintaro
line: But the proprietor of the Braun Tube Workshop, Tennouji, is also the owner of the building.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s how he can afford to maintain his ridiculously niche hobby shop even as land value continues to rise.

name: Rintaro
line: He may seem a rough sort, but he was no match for my charisma. Now the entire second floor is mine for next to nothing. Muhahaha!

name: Rintaro
line: I digress. The Future Gadget Laboratory is currently experiencing a severe shortage of manpower. We welcome dedicated scientists from all fields to apply. At present, our researchers are--

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin, Okarin. You’ve gotta say ’lab mems’, not researchers.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Our lab mems -- laboratory members -- are three!

name: Rintaro
line: I am the founder of the Future Gadget Lab, Lab Mem Number 001, the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma!

name: Mayuri
line: ’Okarin’ is cuter, though...

name: Rintaro
line: Next, we have our resident cosplayer and only female member, Lab Mem Number 002, Shiina Mayuri.

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Call me Mayushii! I like making costumes more than wearing them.

name: Rintaro
line: And last, we have our resident super hacka, Lab Mem Number 003, Hashida Itaru.

name: Itaru
line: Stop calling me that! It’s super hacker, duh.

name: Rintaro
line: Here at the Future Gadget Laboratory, we devote ourselves to the art of invention!

name: Rintaro
line: For details, see our lab’s homepage.

name: Rintaro
line: Our top priority, of course, is to develop weapons for the war with the Dark Dominion, but that research has spawned a number of offshoot inventions. In fact, that’s all it’s spawned.

name: Rintaro
line: Our arsenal of Future Gadgets is up to eight, but this is just the beginning. I have a total of 108 inventions to create!

name: Itaru
line: Like in that tennis manga, right? I get it.

name: Rintaro
line: No! It’s the number of earthly desires in mortals, you @channel junkie.

name: Rintaro
line: And I thought I told you not interrupt me when I’m talking!

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, wouldn’t want to interrupt you talking to yourself.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m not talking to myself. Can’t you see? I’m talking to the person behind the monitor.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, he just grinned!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you grinning about, damn you!? You don’t even exist outside that monitor!

name: Itaru
line: Just say ’don’t look at me’.

name: Mayuri
line: I don’t think that’s gonna work...

name: Rintaro
line: It appears our attempts to communicate have failed. It’s sad to see someone so deeply in denial of reality.

name: Mayuri
line: Maybe they think we’re in the game?

name: Itaru
line: I doubt it’s even occurred to them.

name: Mayuri
line: But aren’t your 2D girlfriends the same way?

name: Itaru
line: That’s different. Those girls are my wives.

name: Rintaro
line: Nobody cares about your harem.

name: Itaru
line: But Mayushii touched upon a very interesting theme, ya know? What if we’re actually just characters in a game? Any way we can know for sure?

name: Rintaro
line: No.

name: Itaru
line: Come on!

name: Rintaro
line: Such questions are meaningless. Our time is better spent thinking of ways to destroy the System.

name: Itaru
line: Nice chuunibyou, bro.

name: Rintaro
line: Shut it, hacka. I’m no chuunibyou patient.

name: Rintaro
line: I am Hououin... Kyouma!

name: Itaru
line: That’s your character’s name, right?

name: Rintaro
line: Oh Daru... your communication skills are beyond repair.

name: Itaru
line: I’ll have you know I go to a ton of offline meets, and I’m always the life of the party.

name: Mayuri
line: Ow... the needle bit my finger...

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii is Okarin’s hostage! I belong here!

name: Itaru
line: So, did Alpacaman say anything?

name: Rintaro
line: Nope. Nothing.

name: Rintaro
line: Damn antisocial alpaca!

name: Rintaro
line: Hm?

name: Mayuri
line: You made Mr.Alpaca angry!

name: Rintaro
line: Damn. I’ll have to get it repaired later.

name: Rintaro
line: They’re gone...

name: Mayuri
line: What’s wrong?

name: Rintaro
line: E-everyone disappeared just now, right!?

name: Mayuri
line: Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: You saw it too, right!? Just now, before our very eyes!

name: Rintaro
line: Did you see it, Mayuri!? You saw it, right!?

name: Mayuri
line: Hmmm? Huhhhhh?

name: Mayuri
line: IIIII diiiiidn’t seeeee anythiiiiing!

name: Rintaro
line: You... didn’t?

name: Rintaro
line: You saw nothing? Nothing at all!? There were people here a second ago, weren’t there!?

name: Mayuri
line: ...There were?

name: Rintaro
line: Even the store employees are gone! That’s impossible by any measure!

name: Mayuri
line: Of course they are...

name: Mayuri
line: It was like this when we got here. Oh, I know! You’re seeing things, aren’t you?

name: Mayuri
line: I’m sure it’s ’cause of the heat! Tutturu♪

name: Rintaro
line: ...What the hell is that satellite doing there?

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri, about that satellite...

name: Mayuri
line: Yup. What a surprise, huh?

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean? What was a surprise?

name: Mayuri
line: It made a huge ’kaplow’ sound!

name: Rintaro
line: Did that satellite fall out of the sky?

name: Mayuri
line: Did it? Do you think any aliens were on board?

name: Policeman
line: Hey! You two!

name: Policeman
line: What do you think you’re doing here? This area is off-limits. You have to leave.

name: Mayuri
line: We’re sorry!

name: Rintaro
line: First, my good man -- let’s call you ’Officer A’ -- I have one question!

name: Officer A
line: Officer A...?

name: Rintaro
line: Thousands of people just vanished! You saw it too, didn’t you!?

name: Officer A
line: What are you talking about? Get out of here!

name: Officer A
line: Look, I don’t have time for your nonsense.

name: Rintaro
line: I see... so that’s it!

name: Rintaro
line: This is all an elaborate coverup by the Organization! Their influence has corrupted local law enforcement, which means our entire government may already be under their control. My god!

name: Rintaro
line: But they underestimated me, for I am not so easily played. One day, I will expose their deeds and put an end to their reign!

name: Rintaro
line: Ah, elixir intellectualis, a drink fit for a genius!

name: Itaru
line: Cola’s better.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin really loves his Dr P!

name: Rintaro
line: I pity the man who knows not the greatness of this beverage! Muhahaha!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru. Is the plan progressing smoothly?

name: Itaru
line: Uh, what plan?

name: Rintaro
line: The plan, as in the plan. Obviously, I’m talking about perfecting Gadget No. 8.

name: Itaru
line: Oh, that. How was I supposed to know what you meant?

name: Rintaro
line: We’ve known each other for what, three years now?

name: Itaru
line: We were in different classes junior year, and actually we didn’t talk at all. So two years?

name: Rintaro
line: Details. The point is we’ve known each other a long time. I expect you to keep up with me here.

name: Itaru
line: N O P E

name: Rintaro
line: So, are we any closer to figuring out what’s wrong with Gadget No. 8?

name: Itaru
line: Not yet.

name: Itaru
line: We tried copying what Mayu-shi did, but we just can’t reproduce the freezing phenomenon.

name: Itaru
line: And when we tried to freeze a banana, it turned out really weird.

name: Itaru
line: I just don’t get it.

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri! Mayuri! Bring forth the bananas!

name: Mayuri
line: Are you gonna turn them into gelbanas again?

name: Itaru
line: That’s been bugging me, Mayu-shi. Can you stop calling them ’gelbanas’?

name: Mayuri
line: But gelbanas are gelbanas.

name: Mayuri
line: Why do you have to use the whole bunch? It’s a waste of food.

name: Rintaro
line: Your stinginess could cost us the battle with the Organization!

name: Mayuri
line: That’s fine with me. Mayushii always buys the bananas, and now Mayushii can’t eat a single one.

name: Rintaro
line: Next time, we’ll only do one banana.

name: Guidance
line: Hello. This is the PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Mayuri
line: Do you hear Mayushii’s voice?

name: Rintaro
line: Be quiet. I’m trying to listen.

name: Guidance
line: You can operate the timer from this menu.

name: Guidance
line: After pushing the # button, please enter the heating time in seconds.

name: Guidance
line: For example, press ’#60’ for one minute.

name: Guidance
line: For two minutes, press ’#120’.

name: Itaru
line: Won’t this just warm it normally?

name: Itaru
line: Nice turntable, right? It’s even spinning backwards.

name: Rintaro
line: Backwards!?

name: Rintaro
line: That might have serious implications! If we look at quantum critical behavior driven by Hund’s rule--

name: Itaru
line: Yeah! No.

name: Rintaro
line: ...not Hund’s Rule?

name: Itaru
line: No.

name: Rintaro
line: ...okay.

name: Mayuri
line: Gelbanas are ready!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru. You wouldn’t mind eating one of these, would you? Of course you wouldn’t. It’s for science! Your sacrifice will forever be remembered!

name: Itaru
line: ...They look really nasty.

name: Rintaro
line: The taste doesn’t matter. What matters is that you eat it! So come on, Daru, no need to be shy. Break a leg, or a stomach, and go for it!

name: Itaru
line: No way.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Fine. Mayuri! The honor shall be yours.

name: Mayuri
line: But gelbanas are all gloopy, droopy, soft, and squishy.

name: Mayuri
line: It had no flavor and wasn’t tasty at all...

name: Rintaro
line: Gloopy, droopy, soft and squishy... Daru, what do you think?

name: Itaru
line: Soft and squishy bananas, huh... Soft and squishy... banana...

name: Itaru
line: Mayu-shi, say ’your banana’s all soft and squishy’ for me.

name: Mayuri
line: Daru-kun, your nose is bleeding.

name: Itaru
line: Please just say it!

name: Mayuri
line: Your banana’s all soft and--

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t make her say that, you perv!

name: Rintaro
line: They’re gelatinous, a semi-solid state of matter. In other words, there is a possibility that the intermolecular bonds were weakened.

name: Rintaro
line: I’ve got it!

name: Rintaro
line: What we thought was a freezing function is actually something else!

name: Rintaro
line: Now’s the time to shout, ’W-what you say!?’ Come on, don’t be shy!

name: Itaru
line: Uh, we already knew that.

name: Itaru
line: The problem is we don’t know what it is doing, or why it’s doing it.

name: Mayuri
line: If it’s the opposite of freezing, then couldn’t it be thawing them?

name: Rintaro
line: What a silly question, Mayuri. What you’re describing is just a normal microwave!

name: Mayuri
line: Then, what is it?

name: Itaru
line: We don’t know, and that’s the problem.

name: Female Reporter
line: Behind me is the large, unidentified object that crashed into a building near Akihabara Station!

name: Female Reporter
line: The building is under police barricade. No one is allowed to approach, but from a distance, the object appears to be some kind of satellite!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, aren’t you going to check out Radi-Kan?

name: Itaru
line: No point. Can’t get close. I’ve been following the news online, though. There’s already a hundred threads about it on @channel. It’s huge, man.

name: Itaru
line: Man, feel that AC! I’m alive!

name: Rintaro
line: About the PhoneWave (name subject to change). I might have found our answer.

name: Itaru
line: You know, that ’(name subject to change)’ thing is really annoying.

name: Rintaro
line: Now’s not the time.

name: Itaru
line: So, what’s your latest ridiculous theory?

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean, ridiculous? My genius brain considers every possibility, even those a lesser mind would say break the laws of nature. Don’t you dare call that ridiculous.

name: Itaru
line: So basically, you’re just pulling stuff outta your ass. You can’t call that science.

name: Rintaro
line: Daru. I have a hunch that the PhoneWave (name subject to change) may be the key to opening Steins Gate. How’s that?

name: Itaru
line: Steins what? You lost me back at ’ridiculous’, man.
Ah!
I’m sorry!

name: Rintaro
line: You... you...!

name: Kurisu
line: Is there something wrong?

name: Kurisu
line: O-ow!

name: Rintaro
line: Y-you...

name: Rintaro
line: You should be dead! Why are you here!?

name: Rintaro
line: And you’re even...

name: Rintaro
line: Not a scratch...

name: Kurisu
line: Hey, that hurts! Let me go!

name: Kurisu
line: What’s wrong with you?

name: Rintaro
line: You’re okay? But that’s impossible! Someone stabbed you! I saw you lying in a pool of blood!

name: Itaru
line: That again?

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean, ’again’?

name: Itaru
line: I mean, you sent me that email like a week ago, right?

name: Rintaro
line: I sent you an email?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t be ridiculous! I saw her dead just three hours ago!

name: Kurisu
line: Hey! Could you not talk about me like that? I’m perfectly fine.

name: Itaru
line: You know, that message was kinda weird. It was dated a week after I got it, which means it came from the future.

name: Kurisu
line: It came from the future?

name: Rintaro
line: That sounds like something you’d read on the internet, Daru. It’s rare for you to talk about ridiculous theories.

name: Itaru
line: No, the date was definitely a week later. It came from, uh... the 28th. Wait. That’s today!

name: Rintaro
line: This is the email I sent you three hours ago.

name: Kurisu
line: Interesting...

name: Rintaro
line: Substance. She has substance. Of course she’s not a ghost. How silly of me.

name: Itaru
line: O-Okarin, I don’t think that’s a good idea...

name: Kurisu
line: ...Hey.

name: Kurisu
line: Are you trying to get yourself arrested?

name: Rintaro
line: I just want to know the truth.

name: Kurisu

name: Kurisu
line: Okay, Hououin-san. I’d like to hear your story in more detail.

name: Professor
line: Makise-san? It’s almost time.

name: Itaru

name: Kurisu
line: Um, I’d like to thank everyone for coming to hear me speak today.

name: Rintaro
line: She’s the one giving the lecture...

name: Kurisu
line: It’s my first time giving a lecture like this, so please forgive me if I’m a little nervous.

name: Kurisu
line: For today’s lecture, I’ve been asked to speak on the subject of time travel. It’s not really my area of expertise, but I’ll try my best.

name: Rintaro
line: Time travel? Oh-ho...

name: Kurisu
line: Let me start by saying that time travel is an absurd concept.

name: Rintaro
line: OBJECTION!

name: Rintaro
line: It’s presumptuous for you to claim that time travel is absurd!

name: Itaru
line: Okarin, you magnificent fool!

name: Kurisu
line: Um... okay. It’s fine, I guess. It’ll be easier to talk in a discussion format.

name: Kurisu
line: But before that, please listen to my thoughts on the subject.

name: Kurisu
line: Scientists have proposed many theoretical models of time travel, but there are eleven in particular that bear mentioning.

name: Kurisu
line: Neutron Star Theory. Black Hole Theory. Lightspeed Theory.

name: Kurisu
line: Tachyon Theory. Wormhole Theory. Exotic Matter Theory.

name: Kurisu
line: Cosmic String Theory. Quantum Gravity Theory. Cesium Laser Theory.

name: Kurisu
line: Elementary Particle Ring & Laser Theory. Dirac Antiparticle Theory.

name: Kurisu
line: However, all of these models are purely theoretical.

name: Kurisu
line: Some of them even contradict each other.

name: Rintaro
line: Well, what if someone comes up with a 12th model?

name: Kurisu
line: Hm? Ahh, uhh, right, well...

name: Kurisu
line: It could be contradicted by the 13th model, now couldn’t it?

name: Kurisu
line: By the way, time travel to the future is available to us right now, according to Einstein’s special theory of relativity.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, let’s say someone were to go to Haneda Airport and board a plane headed to Okinawa. Upon arrival, that person would be about one hundred millionth of a second farther into the future than I am.

name: Kurisu
line: According to the special theory of relativity, time moves slower for objects as they approach the speed of light.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, if you could run at near the speed of light, you could reach a point where time only moves half as fast for you.

name: Kurisu
line: If you were to keep running at that speed for 24 hours, 48 hours would elapse in the rest of the world, meaning you would ’jump’ one day into the future. Understand, Hououin Kyouma?

name: Rintaro
line: Gah!

name: Professor
line: But that’s not really time travel, is it?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes, you’re right.

name: Professor
line: Then what about going to the past?

name: Kurisu
line: Going to the past is possible right now. Take a look at the sky at night. You can see light from tens of thousands of years ago, can’t you?

name: Student
line: That’s not time travel either!

name: Kurisu
line: Well, I was just getting started.

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s say we wanted to make a machine that could physically transport people through time. What would we need?

name: Kurisu
line: The best candidates for this are cosmic strings and wormholes.

name: Kurisu
line: A cosmic string is a string-shaped ’crevice’ with extreme mass.

name: Kurisu
line: The crevice is about as wide as an elementary particle, and at least as long as the diameter of a galaxy.

name: Kurisu
line: It has immense mass, so it distorts space-time. If you were to travel through that distortion, you could make a full circle around the string in less than 360 degrees.

name: Kurisu
line: In short, you can do something resembling a warp. This is called a space-time angular deficit.

name: Kurisu
line: When you pass through an area of angular deficit, transit time becomes zero.

name: Kurisu
line: Now we apply this to a cosmic string moving at near-light speed.

name: Kurisu
line: According to the special theory of relativity, time will flow slower for the cosmic string in relation to its surroundings.

name: Kurisu
line: Therefore, passing through the area of angular deficit would cause the transit time to become negative instead of zero.

name: Kurisu
line: In other words, you will arrive in the past after transit.

name: Kurisu
line: If you use two cosmic strings, you can do a space deficit jump. If you loop back to your original location, you can return to the same time you started revolving.

name: Kurisu
line: And that, roughly speaking, is time travel by means of cosmic strings.

name: Kurisu
line: By the way, just so nobody misunderstands, cosmic strings are not the same as superstrings.

name: Kurisu
line: Now then, you need three things in order to travel to the past with cosmic strings.

name: Kurisu
line: First. The cosmic strings themselves. Two strings, to be exact. By the way, they are hypothesized to exist only where the universe was first formed, so they might be a little hard to find.

name: Kurisu
line: Second. You would need the energy required to make them move them at near-light speed.

name: Kurisu
line: How much energy do you think you’d need to accelerate something as long as the Milky Way to near the speed of light? I’m pretty sure it’s a little more than 1.21 jigowatts.

name: Kurisu
line: Third. You’d need a spaceship capable of reaching these cosmic strings and returning. With the time traveler alive, of course.

name: Kurisu
line: What do you think, Hououin-san? Care to take on the challenge of cosmic string time travel?

name: Kurisu
line: Hm? Looks like Hououin-san doesn’t want to take the challenge.

name: Kurisu
line: In that case, let’s consider wormholes. They may be a little more realistic than cosmic strings.

name: Kurisu
line: By the way, Hououin-san. Do you know what wormholes are?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s like a shortcut through space... right?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes, that’s correct.

name: Kurisu
line: There are two wormholes joined by a tunnel. No matter how far away the wormholes are, transit time through the tunnel is zero.

name: Kurisu
line: But oh no, there’s a problem. The wormhole tunnel suffers from super gravity, and collapses as soon as it opens.

name: Kurisu
line: So we need something to negate the effect of gravity.

name: Kurisu
line: So-called ’exotic matter’. A substance with negative mass which repulses other matter.

name: Kurisu
line: Say that the wormhole tunnel is being squished by an invisible fist.

name: Kurisu
line: In order to pass through, you need something that could oppose my fist’s ’grasping force’ so that I can’t squish anymore.

name: Kurisu
line: If you stabilize the tunnel with exotic matter injection, instantaneous travel between wormholes becomes possible. To travel through time, however, takes a little more effort.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, let’s say there’s a wormhole entrance here in Akihabara, and the exit is in Los Angeles.

name: Kurisu
line: First, we send the wormhole in LA all the way to the end of the universe at near the speed of light. And once it’s there, we yank it back to LA.

name: Kurisu
line: According to the special theory of relativity, time slows down for objects moving at the speed of light. Meaning the hole that returned to LA would be further in the past than the Akihabara hole.

name: Kurisu
line: So now, if Hououin-san jumped into the wormhole, he’d arrive in LA several years before he left.

name: Kurisu
line: However, this still can’t be called true time travel. It only seems that way. This is called the Urashima effect.

name: Kurisu
line: The important part is to return to Akihabara from LA through the wormhole once more. Since the transit time is zero...

name: Kurisu
line: Hououin-san will return to Akihabara several years in the past. Time travel complete.

name: Kurisu
line: The prerequisites for wormhole travel are simpler than the ones for cosmic string travel.

name: Kurisu
line: First. The wormhole itself. They may exist somewhere in the universe. But nobody has ever seen one.

name: Kurisu
line: Second. The energy required to move a wormhole to the end of the universe and back at near-light speed.

name: Kurisu
line: Third. Exotic matter, which, by the way, has not been confirmed to exist.

name: Kurisu
line: Now do you see what I meant when I said that time travel is an absurd concept?

name: Kurisu
line: Time travel theories are all just thought experiments. Not one of them can create a viable time machine. That is my answer.

name: Student
line: Isn’t there anything simpler? Like something you can pull out of a drawer and just use, or something.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m afraid not.

name: Kurisu
line: This is the limit of modern physics. I can’t say how it might change in ten years, though.

name: Kurisu
line: Besides, even if someone did overcome the logistical requirements, there may be other factors that prevent time travel from working.

name: Kurisu
line: And that’s because fundamental problems concerning the principle of causality have not yet been solved.

name: Rintaro
line: You mean time paradoxes... and conservation of mass?

name: Kurisu
line: If you think that conservation of mass applies to macro-systems like the universe or micro-systems like atoms or elementary particles, you’re mistaken.

name: Kurisu
line: Heh.

name: Kurisu
line: Conservation of mass only applies to chemical reactions. It doesn’t hold in modern physics at all.

name: Kurisu
line: Something can come from nothing.

name: Professor
line: Then what is the problem?

name: Kurisu
line: The time paradox of time paradoxes. In other words, the Grandfather Paradox.

name: Kurisu
line: As long as this paradox goes unsolved, time travel can never be realized. Never.

name: Student
line: What if you just don’t kill them?

name: Kurisu
line: You can’t think of it like a sci-fi movie. It’s not just about your family tree. There are far greater dangers than that.

name: Kurisu
line: Any paradox, no matter how small, would cause the total collapse of causality, relativity, and every other physical law in existence.

name: Kurisu
line: Paradoxes are nothing more than thought experiments. They cannot occur in reality, and they should not.

name: Kurisu
line: Nothing that has even a 0.000001% chance of causing a paradox can happen. The universe won’t allow it. Wouldn’t you say this is the logical conclusion?

name: Kurisu
line: There may be loopholes, like parallel worlds or the self-consistency principle, but those seem too much like fantasy for me to accept.

line: An editorial company... here in Akihabara.

name: Rintaro
line: Wait! You plan on publishing my picture without permission, don’t you!?

name: Rintaro
line: Very well. I accept your terms.

name: Rintaro
line: Of course... this woman is an esper.

name: Moeka
line: ...Name?

name: Rintaro
line: Hououin Kyouma, Mad Scientist.

name: Moeka
line: How... is it spelled?

name: Rintaro
line: First ’Houou’ for ’phoenix’, then ’in’, and finally ’Kyouma’ which means a ’horrible truth’ that must never be revealed.

name: Moeka
line: ...Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: ’Houou’ for ’phoenix’, then ’in’, and finally ’Kyouma’ which means a ’horrible truth’ that must never be revealed.

name: Moeka
line: Like this?

name: Rintaro
line: What the hell is this!? Are you mocking me!?

name: Rintaro
line: Just hand me your phone! I’ll enter it!

name: Rintaro
line: Woah!

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. What is it?

name: Itaru
line: What do you mean, ’what is it’? I’ve been waiting, you know? And what’s with that blank email?

name: Rintaro
line: Blank email? It went to you?

name: Itaru
line: It sure did.

name: Rintaro
line: That was a mistake. Don’t worry. The email will self-destruct in 10 minutes.

name: Itaru
line: Hey, just what are--

name: Moeka
line: Okabe... Rintaro?

name: Rintaro
line: What!? How do you know that name!?

name: Moeka
line: From the blank email...

name: Rintaro
line: That’s just my alias. I’ll send another one with my true--

name: Moeka
line: No... this is fine.

name: Rintaro
line: Nonsense! I am not Okabe Rintaro, but Hououin Kyou--

name: Rintaro
line: Did you delete the picture?

name: Rintaro
line: If you deleted it, then prove it.

name: Moeka
line: I’ll email you... later.

name: Moeka
line: So ask... okay?

name: Rintaro
line: About what?

name: Moeka
line: ...The urban legend.

name: Maids
line: Welcome back, Myaster!

name: Mayuri
line: It’s Okarin!

name: Mayuri
line: Welcome back, Okarin.

name: Mayuri
line: Hey, Okarin! Mayushii just noticed something.

name: Mayuri
line: ’Welcome back’ and ’Okarin’ go really well together!

name: Faris
line: Kyouma! It’s great that you came, nya!

name: Faris
line: Daru-nyan’s here too. He’s been waiting, nya.

name: Faris
line: Are you holding another secret meeting to overthrow the evil Organization, nya?

name: Rintaro
line: Uh, yeah, something like that.

name: Faris
line: Faris wants to join too, nya!

name: Rintaro
line: No chance. The Organization isn’t threatened by cat-eared maids.

name: Faris
line: Not true, nya. Faris has the purrfect secret technique to help take them down.

name: Rintaro
line: What!? You’ve finally mastered that secret technique!?

name: Faris
line: Yes, nya... After completing my pilgrimage to the Guiana Highlands and overcoming my mentor’s death, I finally mastered it.

name: Faris
line: So Faris wants to participate in the Spirit Conference like you promised, nya!

name: Rintaro
line: You’re not suggesting we venture to the Sanctuary!?

name: Rintaro
line: The answer is no. Although you may understand the Hidden Secrets, you’re still too inexperienced.

name: Faris
line: But... but you promised, nya! Are you going to betray me!?

name: Faris
line: My brother is waiting for me there...

name: Mayuri
line: Umm, I don’t quite get it, but can Mayushii go to the Sanctuary too?

name: Rintaro
line: You can’t come. This discussion is over.

name: Mayuri
line: Ehhh?

name: Faris
line: No fair, Kyouma!

name: Mayuri
line: That’s right! Leaving Mayushii and Feris-chan behind is mean!

name: Rintaro
line: ...Who’s is ’Feris’?

name: Mayuri
line: Feris-chan is Feris-chan. Right?

name: Faris
line: Right!

name: Mayuri
line: Well, Mayushii has a hard time saying Faris, so I call her Feris-chan instead!

name: Rintaro
line: Oh, so that’s it.

name: Faris
line: It’s like we’re in a girl’s school. That’s not too... tabby.

name: Rintaro
line: Show me to the table already. How long do you want me to stand here waiting?

name: Faris
line: Nyahaha! Sorry, nya. Table for two, this way, nyan♪

name: Faris
line: Mayushii, I’ll leave it to you, nyan nyan.

name: Mayuri
line: Leave it to me, nyan nyan♪

name: Mayuri
line: Daru-kun, Okarin is here, nyan.

name: Itaru
line: You’re way late. Seriously, man.

name: Itaru
line: So, what were you just talking about with Faris? I want details.

name: Rintaro
line: ...You really want to know? I don’t think you’d understand it.

name: Itaru
line: Ah, the usual...

name: Itaru
line: Your conversations are too much for regular otaku. You guys exude an aura or something, you know?

name: Itaru
line: It’s like you too have your own Reality Marble! You know I can’t forgive you!

name: Mayuri
line: I think Feris-chan likes Okarin, nya.

name: Mayuri
line: Of all the maids and masters here, nya, the only one who can keep up with Feris-chan is you, Okarin.

name: Itaru
line: I’m so jealous! You lucky bastard!

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph, I have no interest in women who dress themselves in lies.

name: Itaru
line: Like you’re one to talk.

name: Rintaro
line: Silence, you unfaithful bastard! All your 2D wives are crying.

name: Itaru
line: Gwahh, you struck a nerve, man...

name: Mayuri
line: Master, may I take your order, nya?

name: Rintaro
line: Omelet rice. And hot coffee. Black.

name: Mayuri
line: Coming right up, nyan nyan♪

name: Itaru
line: So, what did you need?

name: Itaru
line: I was gonna head to the lab in about an hour.

name: Rintaro
line: I have an urgent matter to discuss. Top secret.

name: Rintaro
line: You remember John Titor?

name: Itaru
line: ...John Titor? Who’s that?

name: Rintaro
line: The self-proclaimed time traveler who appeared on the internet about 10 years ago. I thought we talked about him before.

name: Itaru
line: Is this a new addition to your made-up backstory?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s nothing like that! Everything I say is the truth!

name: Itaru
line: What a pain. Well, I guess I can play along.

name: Itaru
line: So, what’s the source on this Titor guy being from the future?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait, you’ve seriously never heard about him before?

name: Itaru
line: Seriously, bro, I haven’t.

name: Rintaro
line: Sure you didn’t just forget?

name: Itaru
line: I can’t say for sure.

name: Rintaro
line: There are even books about him.

name: Itaru
line: I might remember if you show me one.

name: Rintaro
line: You really don’t remember?

name: Itaru
line: Memories fade. We’re not computers, man.

name: Rintaro
line: Then what about the IBN 5100?

name: Itaru
line: Woah, you know about that? Cool.

name: Rintaro
line: So you know about it?

name: Itaru
line: It’s the model IBN released back in 1975.

name: Rintaro
line: What kind of computer is it?

name: Itaru
line: The stupidly expensive kind.

name: Itaru
line: Back when it came out, computers were so expensive that average people couldn’t get their hands on them.

name: Itaru
line: It was full of proprietary IBN technology, and was a pretty powerful computer for its time.

name: Itaru
line: Then six years later, in 1981, IBN launched the popular IBN PC series. Now that’s more famous.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, it’s not like I’m an expert. This is just stuff I read on a wiki.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you heard the urban legend that there’s one in Akiba?

name: Itaru
line: You bet I have. Just last month there was big talk about it on the net.

name: Itaru
line: Some @channelers heard the rumors and went searching for it. My friend on FrePara, Sister Centipede, was the main person behind that.

name: Itaru
line: Even the legendary ’Neidhardt der Blitzschnelle’ joined the fray, but they still couldn’t find it.

name: Rintaro
line: So it was just a hoax?

name: Itaru
line: Who knows? There are tons of underground shops in Akiba. It wouldn’t be strange if an IBN 5100 suddenly turned up in some hole in the wall.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmm. I see.

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry for the wait, Daru.

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry for the wait, Daru.

name: Rintaro
line: So, there’s one thing I need to know.

name: Rintaro
line: The IBN 5100 has the power to destroy the world, right?

name: Itaru
line: What? It doesn’t have the power to do anything, let alone destroy the damn world.

name: Faris
line: What this, nya? The world’s gonna be destroyed, nya?

name: Faris
line: Master, thanks for waiting nyan nyan♪ Omelet rice, nyan!

name: Faris
line: Please enjoy your meal before the world ends♪

name: Itaru
line: Woah, ’The World is Doomed!!’ for the win! Faris’s handwriting is so cute it puts my ’omelet’ in danger too!

name: Itaru
line: Ahh... what a waste...

name: Faris
line: Daru-nyan, Daru-nyan, have you considered participating in the Faris Cup, nya?

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, of course I’m participating!

name: Rintaro
line: Faris Cup? What’s that?

name: Faris
line: Next Sunday, we’re hosting a RaiNet tournament at the cafe, nya!

name: Faris
line: Faris is the event organizer. It’s all my idea, nyan!

name: Faris
line: You can participate too if you want, Kyouma! Entrance fee is 1000 yen and includes a drink. Whoever beats Faris gets to enjoy some of Faris’ home-cooking, nya.

name: Itaru
line: It’ll never happen. Okarin sucks at RaiNet.

name: Faris
line: Nya? But it’s so fun.

name: Rintaro
line: No, I’m fine...

name: Rintaro
line: RaiNet AccessBattlers, huh... Whenever I hear that name, I remember the former champion... Has it already been two years?

name: Rintaro
line: No, it’s nothing. Forget what I said.

name: Faris
line: NyaNya? That sounded so serious, nya! Who was the former champion, nya?

name: Itaru
line: He probably doesn’t exist. I mean, RaiNet didn’t even have official tournaments until about a year ago.

name: Faris
line: Kyouma... you still can’t forget him, can you, nya?

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Faris
line: I remember that you and the champion -- my brother -- were such good friends, Kyouma. You were so close it made me jealous, nya.

name: Faris
line: But it’s time to let go of the past! Seize the day with your own paws!

name: Faris
line: Even though it’s painful... no, because it’s painful, I succeeded my brother’s dying wish and purrfected my skills as a RaiNetter, nya!

name: Faris
line: Do you remember, nya? He always used to say, ’Some day, let’s bring peace to the world with RaiNet--’

name: Rintaro
line: Faris, bring me my coffee.

name: Faris
line: NyaNya?

name: Faris
line: Sure thing, Master! Just a moment, nya♪

name: Itaru
line: Faris is one of the most skilled Rainetters I know.

name: Itaru
line: She’s gone undefeated in over 400 unofficial matches.

name: Rintaro
line: Is she Rickson Gracie?

name: Itaru
line: It’s so disappointing that Faris doesn’t go to official tournaments. She’d win if she did, no doubt.

name: Rintaro
line: Why doesn’t she?

name: Itaru
line: I’m sure it’s for the customers! She probably doesn’t want to inconvenience the store. Truly a model maid.

name: Itaru
line: Also, she’s Mayushii’s age, so she probably has school too.

name: Rintaro
line: She doesn’t want to inconvenience the store, yet she’s holding the Faris Cup here?

name: Itaru
line: That doesn’t matter at all!

name: Itaru
line: The point is, Faris is cute, and cuteness is justice. Cute cat-eared maids are sweet, if you know what I mean. And that’s all that matters, right?

name: Rintaro
line: So in the end, do you bat for the 2D team, or the 3D team?

name: Itaru
line: I dare say I’m bi!

name: Rintaro
line: You’re an inspiration, Daru.

name: Itaru
line: I know. I’m just too awesome.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, Daru. What’s with the X68000?

name: Itaru
line: It’s cool. Duh.

name: Rintaro
line: So, it’s like the reason why some protagonists are odd-eyed even though they’re Japanese?

name: Itaru
line: Not getting you, bro.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s cool.

name: Itaru
line: If it’s cool, then it’s cool.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, there wasn’t much of an option. This was the only PC we weren’t using.

name: Rintaro
line: What about your new one?

name: Itaru
line: No way. We don’t know what could happen when it’s connected to your crazy machine. It could kill the performance.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, did you do any research on the gelification?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, at the university this morning.

name: Rintaro
line: I examined a sample under a microscope and found it was shredded at the molecular level.

name: Itaru
line: Shredded?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s not a mere phase transition. The banana became something entirely different.

name: Itaru
line: Could it have rotted? ...Nah. There’s no way 2 minutes in the microwave could do that.

name: Rintaro
line: Then I remembered about fractal structures.

name: Itaru
line: The Menger sponge thing?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. It looked like something drilled holes into the banana. An infinite number of holes in a fractal pattern, right down to the nano level.

name: Itaru
line: Whoa. What could do something like that?

name: Rintaro
line: I have one hypothesis...

name: Rintaro
line: It’s the result of the microwave’s electromagnetic waves.

name: Itaru
line: W-what does that mean?

name: Rintaro
line: If my guess is correct, then our PhoneWave (name subject to change) has the potential to become a weapon of unprecedented destructive power, one that could change the face of war as we know it. Hehehe.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. We’re proceeding to stage two of the plan. Soon they will learn... that Judgment Day is near.

name: Rintaro
line: All shall be as Steins Gate wills. Resistance is futile. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Itaru
line: Quit talking to your imaginary friend. I’m done with the wiring.

name: Itaru
line: Well? What’s next?

name: Rintaro
line: We have bananas.

name: Itaru
line: You know Mayu-shi’s gonna cry if you use them all, right? Wasn’t it her money?

name: Rintaro
line: She donated that money to our research efforts.

name: Itaru
line: You don’t have to use the whole thing. One is enough. One.

name: Rintaro
line: We’ll never reshape the fabric of society as long as money dictates the limits of our science.

name: Itaru
line: You’re the only one who wants to reshape society, Okarin.

name: Itaru
line: C’mon, start the timer already.

name: Guidance
line: Hello. This is the PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Guidance
line: You can operate the timer from this menu.

name: Guidance
line: After pushing the # button, please enter the heating time in seconds.

name: Rintaro
line: In hindsight, we should’ve made the Mayushii Guidance skippable. Having to wait each time is quite annoying.

name: Guidance
line: For example, press ’#60’ for one minute.

name: Guidance
line: For two minutes, press ’#120’.

name: Itaru
line: You messed up.

name: Rintaro
line: Two minutes sure is long...

name: Itaru
line: You know, if the microwave’s emissions are doing it, then shouldn’t our cells be getting gelified too?

name: Rintaro
line: Well, have you ever nuked yourself inside the PhoneWave (name subject to change)?

name: Itaru
line: I can’t even fit in there.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, what’s your source on the electromagnetic waves?

name: Rintaro
line: If you must know... it’s my mad scientist’s intuition.

name: Itaru
line: Oh, so no facts.

name: Rintaro
line: Edison once said, ’Without one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent of perspiration is wasted. So, inventors of the world... be inspired!’ End quote.

name: Itaru
line: Wasn’t it ’Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration’?

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry to disappoint, but in recent years it’s become common knowledge that that is a misquote. Muhahaha!

name: Itaru
line: Edison said that? ’Be inspired!’...?

name: Rintaro
line: Yes. ’Be inspired!’ he said.

name: Rintaro
line: Therefore, as a genius mad scientist, I am always insp--

name: Rintaro
line: This is just going to gelify the banana like usual, isn’t it? We need a new experiment.

name: Itaru
line: What? What!?

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing?

name: Itaru
line: Well... uh... it’s...

name: Itaru
line: ...gone.

name: Rintaro
line: Gone? What’s gone?

name: Itaru
line: The banana.

name: Rintaro
line: ...It’s gone.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. Slight problem. We may have awakened something... terrible.

name: Itaru
line: Wh-what do you mean something terrible!?

name: Rintaro
line: I’m invoking Emergency Order 666. Activate the Coldheart Protocol!

name: Rintaro
line: What!? What do you mean we need congressional approval!? There’s no time, you fool! Tokyo will be blasted to atoms!

name: Itaru
line: Y-you should be an actor.

name: Rintaro
line: S-shut up, you Faris stalker! Where’d you hide the banana?

name: Itaru
line: Who’s a stalker!?

name: Rintaro
line: The banana. Where is it? Are you planning on become a street magician or something?

name: Itaru
line: You’re the one who hid it, aren’t you?

name: Rintaro
line: Where the hell did it go!?

name: Itaru
line: How should I know!?

name: Rintaro
line: Where did you go? Banaana! BANAAANA!

name: Rintaro
line: W-wait... I think I get it now! It’s not an electromagnetic weapon, it’s a teleportation device!

name: Itaru
line: Wh-what!?

name: Itaru
line: Wait, that’s absurd.

name: Rintaro
line: How else could it have vanished? The microwave was closed!

name: Itaru
line: Um, maybe we should just calm down.

name: Rintaro
line: Y-yeah. You’re right...

name: Rintaro
line: What... the...!?

name: Itaru
line: Oh shit! What the hell’s going on?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait! How many bananas are in the lab right now!?

name: Itaru
line: J-just these, I think...

name: Rintaro
line: Is this gelbana attached to the same stem as the banana you just picked?

name: Itaru
line: I dunno, man... I wasn’t paying attention.

name: Itaru
line: It doesn’t look like it was ever plucked...

name: Rintaro
line: H-hey, Daru... could this possibly be...

name: Rintaro
line: A teleporter... we’ve invented a teleporter!
Oh?
That looks like an interesting experiment.

name: Rintaro
line: Who’s there!?

name: Rintaro
line: Impossible! What are you doing here!?

name: Rintaro
line: The 18-year-old genius girl! A sadist who humiliates men in public! Also known as The Zombie!

name: Rintaro
line: Makise... Kurisu!

name: Itaru
line: Nice exposition, bro.

name: Kurisu
line: Who are you calling a zombie?

name: Rintaro
line: What is the meaning of this!? What is your purpose here?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m here to see you, Okabe Rintaro-san. Or is it Hououin Kyouma-san?

name: Rintaro
line: I was right! You’re one of the Organization’s top agents, an esper with superhuman powers!

name: Rintaro
line: No wonder you rose from the dead!

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not dead, alright? Please stop killing me off.

name: Kurisu
line: Hashida-san, can you do something about this guy?

name: Itaru
line: You came at a bad time, Makise-shi, with Okarin freaking out like this.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you betrayed me, Daru!?

name: Itaru
line: Calm down, man.

name: Rintaro
line: Are you being blackmailed? Or did she seduce you?

name: Rintaro
line: YOU’VE CROSSED THE LINE, BIIITTCH!

name: Kurisu
line: Get ahold of yourself.

name: Kurisu
line: Hashida-san gave me the address after yesterday’s lecture. He also told me your name.

name: Rintaro
line: So you’re here to see me, is that it?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes. You claimed to have seen me die. I came to see if that was the truth, or just a pathetic excuse to grope me. I came for the answer.

name: Kurisu
line: But your current behavior is all the answer I need. It was all an act to grope me. My initial hypothesis was correct.

name: Rintaro
line: Not so fast. There’s more to this than you know.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, let’s put that aside for now.

name: Rintaro
line: R-really?

name: Kurisu
line: I haven’t properly introduced myself yet, have I? I’m Makise Kurisu. Pleased to meet you.

name: Kurisu
line: You can’t even shake hands? Are all Japanese men this difficult?

name: Rintaro
line: You’re not Japanese!?

name: Kurisu
line: I’ve lived in America for seven years. What about it?

name: Rintaro
line: America...

name: Kurisu
line: What’s your problem?

name: Rintaro
line: I can feel your aura of malice. You must be a powerful kung-fu master.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t be ridiculous.

name: Rintaro
line: Then you’re a NINJA--

name: Kurisu
line: Give it a rest.

name: Rintaro
line: If you grew up in America, shouldn’t you say ’HAHAHA! NICE TO MEET YOU!’ with a smile across your whole face when asking for a handshake?

name: Rintaro
line: No, wait, you should be asking for a hug, right?

name: Kurisu
line: What kind of stereotype is that?

name: Kurisu
line: ...Fascinating.

name: Kurisu
line: Have any forceps?

name: Rintaro
line: No!

name: Kurisu
line: Oh.

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing!? That’s precious data!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s squishy.

name: Kurisu
line: ...No taste. Gross.

name: Rintaro
line: You have quite the appetite, I see. A side-effect of the resurrection, perhaps? If you’re that hungry, I guess I could give you a banana or two!

name: Kurisu
line: No thanks.

name: Itaru
line: Either way, those bananas are Mayushii’s.

name: Rintaro
line: Come, don’t be shy. This is an offering. Take it!

name: Kurisu
line: As if. Who would eat some perv’s banana?

name: Itaru
line: A perv’s banana...!

name: Itaru
line: Eat... a perv’s banana... squishy... finger in mouth... ’Gross!’ with a sour expression...

name: Itaru
line: Um, can you say that one more time? With a more humiliated expression, if you please.

name: Kurisu
line: Huh?

name: Itaru
line: Come on. Say, ’Who would eat some perv’s banana?’ but if you could add an, ’Ahh, but it’s so...’ after that, it would be extra delicious!

name: Kurisu
line: Huh? ...huh?

name: Rintaro
line: Muhaha! Oh, Daru. You may be a worthless, disgusting perv, but let me say, well done, sir!

name: Rintaro
line: So, Makise Kurisu. You just imagined something, didn’t you? By all means, tell us what. Don’t be shy. Muhahaha!

name: Kurisu
line: Why you...

name: Rintaro
line: Come on! Say it, genius girl! What’s the imagination of a genius like? I’d love to hear from you!

name: Kurisu
line: You... ass!

name: Kurisu
line: I get it. You’re both pervs.

name: Itaru
line: Well... you could say that.

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t want to hear that from you.

name: Kurisu
line: Okay! If I came off as a little rude, I apologize.

name: Kurisu
line: I was only acting that way because you molested me, but I’ll ignore that for now.

name: Kurisu
line: Please tell me what happened to this banana. I’d also like to hear about that...

name: Kurisu
line: That microwave thing.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s top secret. The one thing I’m cleared to share with unauthorized individuals is that its name is the PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Kurisu
line: Name subject to change? What’s that about?

name: Rintaro
line: PhoneWave is weak. It needs a better name.

name: Kurisu
line: I couldn’t care less about its name.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m afraid that’s the only information you’re cleared for.

name: Itaru
line: Hold on, Okarin. Makise-shi might be able to explain what’s going on.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmm... well...

name: Kurisu
line: That creepy grin... are you thinking perverted thoughts again?

name: Rintaro
line: You said your name’s Christina, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Who the hell’s Christina!? I never said that!

name: Rintaro
line: If you wish to learn the secrets of this microwave, then you must meet my conditions.

name: Kurisu
line: ...Which are?

name: Rintaro
line: Condition One: You must become a lab mem.

name: Kurisu
line: Ramen?

name: Rintaro
line: No! Lab mem, stupid! Short for laboratory member!

name: Kurisu
line: You mean you want me to join your research team? I’m supposed to return to America in August.

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll have you sign a non-disclosure agreement so you won’t betray our secrets. Break the agreement, and I’ll report your steamy, perverted acts to Science Magazine.

name: Kurisu
line: Gh...

name: Itaru
line: You’re a monster, Okarin. I’ll take five copies.

name: Rintaro
line: From the moment you become a lab mem to the moment of your departure, your brain shall be used for the benefit of our lab.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re so full of it. Let’s see the contract, then.

name: Rintaro
line: What contract? This is a lab, not a corporation!

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t mind lending you my knowledge, but if there is more pervy nonsense involved, the answer is NO.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t worry, we don’t bite.

name: Kurisu
line: No more molestation?

name: Rintaro
line: No, alright!?

name: Kurisu
line: You said that was condition one. So there’s gotta be a second one, right? It better not be--

name: Rintaro
line: The second condition is...

name: Rintaro
line: That you’ll overlook all past acts of molestation I may or may not have committed!

name: Itaru
line: Okarin, you’re so petty! You’re the pettiest person I’ve ever met! That’s why we love you! That’s why we admire you!

name: Rintaro
line: Shut up, Daru. You have no right to talk. By the way, Daru’s perverted acts aren’t included. You two can work it out yourselves.

name: Itaru
line: What the hell, man!

name: Rintaro
line: Those are the conditions! If you can’t accept them, then you must leave at once!

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh. So what’ll it be? I don’t think it’s a bad deal at all.

name: Kurisu
line: You mean for you.

name: Kurisu
line: Geez... I feel like I’m hypersecreting noradrenaline. Let me pick my jaw up off the floor.

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t care about your dislocated jaw! Do you accept the conditions or not? Answer me, Christina!

name: Kurisu
line: Stop adding -tina! My name’s Kurisu!

name: Kurisu
line: ...Okay. I accept.

name: Rintaro
line: Hehehe, good answer. From this moment forth, you are Lab Mem Number 004.

name: Rintaro
line: Welcome, Christina -- codename, The Zombie!

name: Kurisu
line: I won’t answer to either. Use my real name, Hououin.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re such a child.

name: Rintaro
line: You say something? Genius perv girl?

name: Kurisu
line: Come on! No more saying ’perv’! I won’t treat you like a perv either! So let’s drop it already!

name: Rintaro
line: As long as you understand. Now for the issue at hand. Daru, give Christina--

name: Kurisu
line: No ’-tina’ either.

name: Rintaro
line: Give Kurisu-kun an explanation on our experiments so far.

name: Itaru
line: But I refuse.

name: Kurisu
line: Fascinating.

name: Rintaro
line: Let’s hear your opinion.

name: Kurisu
line: I think we can at least throw out completely worthless theories like electromagnetic weaponry and teleportation.

name: Kurisu
line: Can we run the experiment one more time? I want to see it for myself.

name: Kurisu
line: Okabe-san, Hashida-san, please watch the bananas.

name: Rintaro
line: Who are you to give me orders? I am the mad scientist, Houou--

name: Kurisu
line: Whatever. Just keep your eye on the bananas!

name: Kurisu
line: Sixty seconds have passed. Any change?

name: Itaru
line: Nope.

name: Kurisu
line: 100 seconds.

name: Itaru
line: Ah!

name: Itaru
line: It appeared!

name: Rintaro
line: How does it look?

name: Kurisu
line: Huh? Oh... uh...

name: Kurisu
line: A-at 104 seconds, it d-disappeared. Abruptly. Yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: So it is a teleporter! The first in human history!

name: Kurisu
line: Teleportation... is that even possible?

name: Kurisu
line: It did move... No matter how unbelievable that may be...

name: Kurisu
line: Could it be quantum teleportation... no, that only occurs on the quantum level...

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t avert your eyes from the truth! What you’ve seen with your own eyes is everything!

name: Kurisu
line: Did it really teleport? It’s dangerous to reason from the conclusion.

name: Rintaro
line: Well then, genius girl, what do you call this phenomenon?

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s sort this out.

name: Kurisu
line: Neither the banana bunch nor the frozen chicken teleported. Correct?

name: Rintaro
line: ...So, maybe there’s a size limit for objects that can teleport.

name: Kurisu
line: But aren’t those chicken pieces smaller than bananas?

name: Rintaro
line: We used the same chicken for each experiment. They come in 12-packs.

name: Itaru
line: That’s quite a lot, then.

name: Kurisu
line: What about salt? You experimented with salt too, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Maybe the plate was in the way.

name: Rintaro
line: Of course we tried it without the plate, but that didn’t change anything.

name: Kurisu
line: Then, maybe each individual grain of salt was too small... or something?

name: Kurisu
line: Hmm... I need a clue...

name: Kurisu
line: Anything else? Have you noticed anything else about the PhoneWave?

name: Rintaro
line: Not PhoneWave. PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Kurisu
line: Forget about that.

name: Kurisu
line: So? Have you noticed anything or not?

name: Itaru
line: Oh, right!

name: Itaru
line: One time, it shot off a huge electrical discharge.

name: Rintaro
line: What!? I don’t know anything about that!

name: Itaru
line: That’s because you weren’t around when it happened.

name: Kurisu
line: Discharge? How much?

name: Itaru
line: It was like a fluorescent light lit up the development room. It lasted about two seconds, I guess.

name: Kurisu
line: What were the circumstances?

name: Itaru
line: I was adjusting the cellphone attached to it. I unhooked it and put my own in.

name: Itaru
line: A little bit later, sparky sparky.

name: Rintaro
line: When was that?

name: Itaru
line: Around noon yesterday. When you went to see Doctor Nakabachi’s presentation.

name: Kurisu
line: Doctor Nakabachi...

name: Rintaro
line: But wait, Daru. Didn’t you say that Doctor Nakabachi’s presentation was cancelled?

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, but you went with Mayu-shi anyway, remember?

name: Rintaro
line: That reminds me. I sent you an email back then. Did you get it?

name: Itaru
line: An email?

name: Kurisu
line: That email you showed me at ATF yesterday?

name: Kurisu
line: It said someone stabbed me at the presentation, didn’t it?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. But for some reason, Daru’s phone received it a week ago...

name: Itaru
line: Huh? Wasn’t that one of your stories? If it wasn’t, then that would make the timestamp weird.

name: Rintaro
line: I always speak the truth! If you don’t trust me, I’ll show you my send history.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s gone...

name: Rintaro
line: Where did it go? I could’ve sworn I sent it just before 1 PM.

name: Itaru
line: Oh yeah! That’s when the discharge phenomenon happened! The show I was watching was about to end.

name: Rintaro
line: I get it... So that’s what happened.

name: Kurisu
line: Uh, what?

name: Itaru
line: Oh, this is one of Okarin’s usual habits, so don’t mind it. Seriously.

name: Rintaro
line: Silence! I’ve reached the answer, and now the world will tremble!

name: Rintaro
line: The disappearance of my mail, the strange timestamp, and the sudden electrical discharge must be...

name: Rintaro
line: Related somehow!

name: Kurisu
line: ...And?

name: Rintaro
line: Huh?

name: Kurisu
line: I understand that they’re related somehow. But how?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s your job to figure that out, Christina.

name: Kurisu
line: Hashida-san, talking to this guy’s so tiring.

name: Itaru
line: Everyone’s like that at first. The trick is to not take him seriously.

name: Rintaro
line: And you call yourself my right-hand man!?

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, describe the PhoneWave (name subject to change)’s status when the discharge phenomenon occurred.

name: Itaru
line: It was kind of a mess. I’d connected my phone to the PhoneWave, and I was testing to see if I could control it with the X68000.

name: Mayuri
line: I’m home! So hungry...

name: Mayuri
line: Time to eat some chicken! Juicy Chicken Number One♪

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin, did you buy the bananas? Okarin?

name: Mayuri
line: Huh? We have a guest?

name: Mayuri
line: I’m Mayushii. Nice to meet you!

name: Kurisu
line: I’m Makise. Apparently, I’m a lab mem now.

name: Mayuri
line: Really? That’s great! Another girl lab mem!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, what were you doing with the X68000?

name: Itaru
line: Like I said, I was adjusting the incoming mail settings. I was monitoring the moment it received mail for remote control.

name: Itaru
line: That’s why I put it on ’freezing mode’ for 120 seconds too.

name: Itaru
line: I made it so that you can start freezing mode by computer. I tested that out yesterday too.

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri! Insert the Juicy Chicken Number One into the PhoneWave (name subject to change)!

name: Mayuri
line: You all want some? I can give you one each.

name: Rintaro
line: So, we’ve reproduced the conditions that existed when the discharge phenomenon occurred. Right?

name: Itaru
line: Uhh, how was it again...

name: Rintaro
line: You there. Assistant!

name: Kurisu
line: Huh? Me?

name: Rintaro
line: Who else!?

name: Kurisu
line: When did I become your assistant!?

name: Rintaro
line: Just send something to my phone!

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t even know your email address.

name: Rintaro
line: What a useless assistant.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t call me your assistant!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, send an email from your phone!

name: Itaru
line: Uh, sure... but what?

name: Rintaro
line: Anything!

name: Itaru
line: Uhh, umm...

name: Rintaro
line: Send ’Christina’s a perv’!

name: Kurisu
line: I thought we agreed to stop saying that!

name: Itaru
line: Well, let’s compromise and go with ’Okarin’s a perv’.

name: Rintaro
line: You traitor!

name: Kurisu
line: Good job, Hashida-san!

name: Mayuri
line: Oh no! Mayushii’s bananas!

name: Mayuri
line: They became gelbanas...

name: Kurisu
line: We experimented on them.

name: Mayuri
line: But they were Mayushii’s...

name: Itaru
line: Want me to send the mail now?

name: Kurisu
line: You’ll be reimbursed later. By Hououin-san, that is.

name: Rintaro
line: Why me!?

name: Mayuri
line: Geez! Why do you always have to experiment on Mayushii’s food?

name: Mayuri
line: Ah! Don’t tell me you’re experimenting on the chicken too?

name: Rintaro
line: We are.

name: Itaru
line: ’Kay, sending it now. Sending, sending, click.

name: Rintaro
line: Wait! Don’t open that!

name: Mayuri
line: Huh?

name: Mayuri
line: Wawah!

name: Kurisu
line: An electrical discharge!

name: Itaru
line: Are we gonna die!?

name: Rintaro
line: E-everyone okay?

name: Itaru
line: S-somehow.

name: Kurisu
line: That was definitely more than two seconds.

name: Mayuri
line: O-Okarin? Umm, what just happened?

name: Rintaro
line: Are you okay? No burns or anything?

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm... It doesn’t hurt anywhere, so I think I’m okay...

name: Kurisu
line: H-hey! Look at this!

name: Itaru
line: What the hell? How did that... Yeah, it’s a microwave, but it’s not heavy enough to make a hole in the floor...

name: Kurisu
line: This can’t be caused by electrical discharge. Some other phenomenon?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh... heh heh heh... MUHAHAHA! Just as my calculations predicted!

name: Itaru
line: ...So, about Mayu-shi’s chicken.

name: Mayuri
line: Eh?

name: Mayuri
line: Ahh! M-Mayushii’s chicken is all burnt black...

name: Rintaro
line: Juicy Chicken Number One made a noble sacrifice for the progress of science. Let us pray for his happiness in the next life.

name: Kurisu
line: The chicken doesn’t matter! Right now, we need to determine what happened with the Phonewa--

name: Mayuri
line: It doesn’t matter? That’s so mean, uh, Christina-chan...

name: Kurisu
line: Hey, Hououin Kyouma! Do something about this! Mayushii-san learned my name wrong!

name: Itaru
line: More importantly, we need ventilation. *cough cough*

name: Rintaro
line: Silence, all of you!

name: Rintaro
line: Muhaha! Muhahaha! MUHAHAHAHA!

name: Rintaro
line: It all connects. There’s a meaning behind this series of events, and only one true answer.

name: Rintaro
line: I’ve discovered the PhoneWave (name subject to change)’s true hidden function!

name: Rintaro
line: This isn’t intuition. That’s right. This is conviction!

name: Kurisu
line: Just spit it out. What do you think it is?

name: Rintaro
line: First, let me say one thing. The greatest inventions are created by accident. This we call serendipity.

name: Kurisu
line: Get on with it.

name: Rintaro
line: The mail was sent to the past.

name: Rintaro
line: The chicken returned to its frozen state.

name: Rintaro
line: The plucked banana returned to the bunch.

name: Kurisu
line: ...No way.

name: Rintaro
line: Yes way!

name: Rintaro
line: The PhoneWave (name subject to change)...

name: Rintaro
line: Is a time machine!

name: Kurisu
line: A time machine? A time machine!? It can’t be!!

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, wanna go to Sanbo for some beef bowl?

name: Itaru
line: Nah, too much trouble...

name: Rintaro
line: Aren’t you hungry?

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, but...

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph. You’re such a bum.

name: Itaru
line: Haa...

name: Itaru
line: The Large Hadron Collider sure is cute...

name: Rintaro
line: W-what!? What did you just say!?

name: Itaru
line: Large Hadron Collider. You don’t know about it?

name: Itaru
line: Owowowowowow, what are you doing!?

name: Rintaro
line: Are you conscious?

name: Itaru
line: Of course, man.

name: Rintaro
line: What is this Large Hadron Collider thing?

name: Itaru
line: You know. It’s what SERN uses to do their experiments. LHC for short.

name: Itaru
line: It’s seriously moe. Recommended.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re lusting for something that’s not even humanoid?

name: Itaru
line: Of course not. But there’s something about it that gets me excited, you know? It makes me smile, you know? Don’t you feel that?

name: Rintaro
line: Come to think of it, I remember you said that you found factories and the undersides of highways irresistible or something.

name: Itaru
line: Yeah. Same thing.

name: Rintaro
line: Where does it end?

name: Itaru
line: Life’s too short. I don’t want to limit my interests, you know?

name: Rintaro
line: SERN...

name: Rintaro
line: John Titor!

name: Itaru
line: Oh yeah. That guy you mentioned earlier. He’s the guy @channel’s going crazy about, isn’t he?

name: Rintaro
line: That one might be an impostor. I was talking about the John Titor who appeared ten years ago.

name: Itaru
line: He appeared ten years ago? The same guy?

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, John Titor mentioned SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: Titor made a prediction. Namely, that before the year 2034, SERN will develop a time machine!

name: Itaru
line: A time machine? That’s a timely topic.

name: Itaru
line: But that wasn’t just ten years ago. This new Titor said the same thing.

name: Rintaro
line: It doesn’t matter if it was ten years ago or ten seconds ago. That’s not the point, Daru.

name: Rintaro
line: This coincidence could very well be the choice of Steins Gate!

name: Itaru
line: Can we trust this Titor guy?

name: Rintaro
line: It doesn’t matter if we trust him or not! Now we have something in common -- a time machine.

name: Rintaro
line: We should investigate SERN! We’ve got nothing to lose!

name: Rintaro
line: Tell me everything you know about SERN.

name: Itaru
line: Sure thing. My SERN folder is smoking hot!

name: Itaru
line: SERN is the world’s largest particle physics research institution. It’s popularly called the ’European Laboratory for Particle Physics’, or the ’European Organization for Nuclear Research’.

name: Itaru
line: It’s close to the border of Switzerland and France, on the outskirts of Geneva. It’s famous as the birthplace of HTML, HTTP, and the World Wide Web.

name: Rintaro
line: The World Wide Web? You mean the internet?

name: Itaru
line: Bingo. That thing at the beginning of most URLs.

name: Itaru
line: Most people aren’t aware, but there’s a Japanese research team working at SERN too.

name: Rintaro
line: What sort of research does SERN do?

name: Itaru
line: Particle physics, mostly.

name: Itaru
line: SERN can do experiments no one else can, because they have the biggest particle accelerators in the world.

name: Itaru
line: The Low Energy Antiproton Ring, the Proton Synchrotron Booster, the Large Electron-Positron Collider.

name: Itaru
line: And the big boss is the largest accelerator in the world, the LHC... Large Hadron Collider-tan.

name: Itaru
line: The LHC is a 27km-long circular tunnel built underneath SERN’s headquarters.

name: Itaru
line: Its purpose is to smash protons together in the hope of creating unknown elementary particle reactions. They started experimenting last year.

name: Itaru
line: Before they started, there were rumors that the experiments might create mini black holes.

name: Itaru
line: Oh no! Those mini black holes will swallow the earth! The universe is in danger! etc.

name: Rintaro
line: What’s the possibility of that actually happening?

name: Itaru
line: 100% that it... won’t. SERN officially denies it.

name: Itaru
line: Let’s say a mini black hole was formed. The amount of energy would be so tiny that it would disappear instantly upon formation. It would be impossible for it to swallow the world.

name: Rintaro
line: But where there’s smoke, there’s fire.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. Hehehe, don’t be surprised. I’ve sniffed out an evil conspiracy.

name: Rintaro
line: ...John Titor. SERN. You see where I’m going with this? ...Yeah, that’s right. They’re likely connected to the Organization.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph, coincidence? Come now, don’t disappoint me. ...What? Evidence? Well, if you must know... whispers. Whispers of my mad scientist intuition.

name: Rintaro
line: Those bastards are trying to destroy the world. ...Yeah, with mini black holes. But what if we were to steal that technology? What then?

name: Rintaro
line: ...Heh heh heh. Of course. Who do you think I am? Everything is the choice of Steins Gate. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Itaru
line: Just who the hell are you fighting with?

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, I know what we must do.

name: Itaru
line: Whuzzat?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t you ’whuzzat’ me! You’re supposed to grin like you know exactly what I’m talking about! What kind of super hacka are you!?

name: Itaru
line: You always give such half-baked explanations. Try to sound intelligible before you try to sound intelligent.

name: Rintaro
line: You are a super hacka.

name: Itaru
line: Stop saying hacka. At least say hacker.

name: Rintaro
line: See where I’m going with this?

name: Itaru
line: No, not at all.

name: Rintaro
line: Hack into SERN.

name: Itaru
line: ...Is that some kind of joke?

name: Rintaro
line: I know you can do it, Daru. Expose their dastardly deeds and find any hints you can about the time machine.

name: Itaru
line: Dastardly deeds? You’re just imagining that stuff, Okarin.

name: Rintaro
line: We stand at a crossroads. Will the PhoneWave (name subject to change) become a functional time machine, or will it die as garbage in lab storage?

name: Itaru
line: You serious?

name: Rintaro
line: I’m always serious!

name: Itaru
line: I’m not responsible for the consequences, got it?

name: Rintaro
line: Deal. Get started.

name: Itaru
line: Let’s do this!

name: Rintaro
line: For your payment, I’ll deposit a week’s supply of potato chips into your Swiss bank account.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, I’m gonna sleep. It’s all yours.
Anyone home?

name: Girl
line: Hi! I’m from the Braun Tube Workshop.

name: Girl
line: The TV you sent in for repairs has been fixed. Mind picking it up?

name: Girl
line: Why do we have to be sneaky?

name: Rintaro
line: Currently, my genius partner in crime is executing an important mission. I don’t want to bother him.

name: Suzuha
line: Hmmm. What exactly do you guys do?

name: Rintaro
line: I told you before that learning our secrets could put you and everyone you know in grave danger.

name: Suzuha
line: You’re called the Future Gadget Laboratory, right?

name: Rintaro
line: How did you know that!? I never told you. Wait, are you an Organization spy!?

name: Suzuha
line: That’s what it said on your mailbox.

name: Rintaro
line: N-now that you know, it’s not like you can un-know. I’ll give you the short explanation. But you must not tell a soul.

name: Rintaro
line: We are the Future Gadget Laboratory, dedicated to defeating the evil organization that rules the world from the shadows. Muhahaha!

name: Suzuha
line: Wow...

name: Suzuha
line: Is the evil organization SERN?

name: Rintaro
line: Y-yeah, but...

name: Suzuha
line: Oh! So I was right? Those guys really are a contemptible lot, aren’t they?

name: Rintaro
line: How did you know we were hacking into SERN!?

name: Suzuha
line: What? You’re hacking them? Right now?

name: Rintaro
line: Just answer my question! How did you know about our business with SERN!?

name: Suzuha
line: Ah, umm, well...

name: Suzuha
line: Weeell, ahahah, actually, I overheard you this afternoon. If you stand here, you can hear stuff from the window.

name: Suzuha
line: I’ve only been working here for a day, but...

name: Suzuha
line: I’ve got a lot more free time than I expected. I’ve gone out four or five times today. Figured I’d reconnoiter the front of the store, see if I couldn’t spot any customers.
