line: Who’re you calling an assistant? You wouldn’t pick up your phone, so I’ve been waiting here an hour for you.

name: Mayuri
line: Hi, Okarin! Huh? Luka-kun’s with you!

name: Suzuha
line: Hey, Okabe Rintaro. The boss says to quiet down. You’re disturbing the neighbors.

name: Rintaro
line: Assemble, servants! We have a mission of the utmost secrecy! Come!

name: Mayuri
line: What’s this?

name: Suzuha
line: Wait... you got one?

name: Rintaro
line: Indeed I did.

name: Suzuha
line: No way! Amazing! Way to go, Okabe Rintaro! Where did you find it?

name: Rintaro
line: Yanabayashi Shrine.

name: Suzuha
line: Yanbayashi Shrine? You mean, like a Shinto shrine?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah.

name: Suzuha
line: What was it doing there...

name: Mayuri
line: Oh! So that’s why Luka-kun’s with you.

name: Luka
line: Y-yeah...

name: Kurisu
line: What’s this? What’re you talking about?

name: Luka
line: Um, the IBN... two thousand... five thousand... what was it?

name: Rintaro
line: I got an IBN 5100.

name: Kurisu
line: Oh, that thing you were talking about yesterday.

name: Kurisu
line: Y-yes?

name: Suzuha
line: Makise Kurisu?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes...?

name: Kurisu
line: What is it? Have I done something to you?

name: Suzuha
line: ...Hmph.

name: Kurisu
line: Who was that?

name: Mayuri
line: Oh, she works part-time at the Braun Tube Workshop. Her name’s Suzu-san!

name: Rintaro
line: I know.

name: Mayuri
line: You do?

name: Kurisu
line: Why was she glaring at me like that?

name: Rintaro
line: How should I know? Did you do something to make her angry?

name: Kurisu
line: I’ve never seen her before in my life. How rude.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, help me out here. We’re taking this thing into the lab.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey! Why didn’t you help!?

name: Itaru
line: Well, you didn’t call me.

name: Rintaro
line: I said all members assemble, didn’t I!?

name: Kurisu
line: Haah, haah... why do I... have to...

name: Mayuri
line: So tired...

name: Luka
line: I can’t walk any more...

name: Rintaro
line: Good work, you three.

name: Rintaro
line: This is my thanks for helping. Eat up.

name: Luka
line: Thank you! I’m so happy!

name: Mayuri
line: But those are Mayushii’s bananas...

name: Rintaro
line: That reminds me, Mayuri. It’s thanks to you that I got this IBN 5100. If it weren’t for your information, it would’ve taken forever to find it.

name: Mayuri
line: Ehehe! Really? I’m glad I was useful.

name: Kurisu
line: What are you going to use the IBN 5100 for? Yesterday you said something about SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: You interested, Christina?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not Christina, and I’m not interested. If you don’t want to tell me, then I don’t really care.

name: Rintaro
line: This artifact is needed for the war against SERN.

name: Kurisu
line: War? SERN’s a research institution.

name: Rintaro
line: Ostensibly, yes.

name: Kurisu
line: ...What are you trying to do? Depending on the situation, I could turn you over to the police, you know?

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph, the police? Do you really think a mad scientist like me is afraid of the police? I’ve spent my life on the run from the Organization, a more fearsome enemy than you can possibly imagine.

name: Kurisu
line: You can’t be serious. Tell me what you’re trying to do.

name: Rintaro
line: We’ll have plenty of time to talk about that later. More importantly, Daru, when do you think we can use the IBN 5100 to hack SERN?

name: Itaru
line: Hmm... well...

name: Itaru
line: Wow, it actually turned on.

name: Itaru
line: First I need to learn how to use this thing. It looks like hooking it up is gonna be a pain.

name: Itaru
line: It might take a while. I can’t play with this thing and search for the server admin’s ID at the same time.

name: Rintaro
line: Alright. Prioritize the ID search.

name: Rintaro
line: If possible, I’d like you to get the IBN 5100 ready to use this month, though.

name: Itaru
line: There’s still 30 days left this month. It’s not gonna take that long.

name: Mayuri
line: We’re gonna take off now, okay?

name: Luka
line: Um, pardon the intrusion.

name: Rintaro
line: You two did well today. Be proud.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re so full of yourself.

name: Mayuri
line: Chris-chan, you not going home? You can walk with us to the station if you want.

name: Kurisu
line: Thanks. But I’m going to stay here a little longer.

name: Mayuri
line: Okay. See you later! Tutturu♪

name: Luka
line: Excuse me.

name: Kurisu
line: Well?

name: Rintaro
line: Well, what?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m asking for an explanation. What’s this about the IBN 5100 and SERN?

name: Kurisu
line: Hey, Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: ...What?

name: Rintaro
line: What did you just call me?

name: Kurisu
line: I called you O-Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: You called me Okabe?

name: Itaru
line: Time out, time out!

name: Rintaro
line: Did you just call me Okabe?

name: Kurisu
line: ...I did. Problem?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes, I’m younger than you, but you insist on calling me by ridiculous names like Christina and Zombie, so I don’t think I need to show you any respect by adding ’-san’, and besides--

name: Rintaro
line: That’s not the problem!

name: Rintaro
line: I am not Okabe! I am HOUOUIN KYOUMA! How many times do I have to tell you, Christina!?

name: Kurisu
line: ...God, you’re so full of yourself.

name: Rintaro
line: From now on, call me Hououin. That or Kyouma.

name: Kurisu
line: No.

name: Rintaro
line: Are you... crying?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not crying! It’s not like I was scared of you for a second there or anything, and I definitely wasn’t relieved when you started talking like an idiot again, okay!?

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, why is my assistant crying?

name: Itaru
line: Uh, she said so herself just now.

name: Rintaro
line: All I did was correct her on my name.

name: Itaru
line: Maybe she only acts strong but is actually weak on the inside. That would be pretty moe.

name: Kurisu
line: Hey, aren’t you going to tell me what’s going on?

name: Kurisu
line: Kya!

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll explain in a second. Drink that while you wait.

name: Kurisu
line: ...Gee, thanks.

name: Rintaro
line: Now then...

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry for the wait, Christina.

name: Rintaro
line: Oh? You’re a fan of the Doc, I see.

name: Kurisu
line: I’ve lived seven years at its birthplace, after all.

name: Rintaro
line: Excellent. We’ll make great drinking buddies.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m a minor.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s not what I meant. I meant Dr P drinking buddies.

name: Kurisu
line: Is that all you drink?

name: Kurisu
line: SERN certainly is acting strange... but how’s the IBN 5100 involved?

name: Rintaro
line: SERN’s database uses an IBN 5100.

name: Kurisu
line: So?

name: Rintaro
line: Allow me to explain. My trusted Super Hacka, Mister Daru--

name: Itaru
line: It’s not super hacka. How many times do I have to tell you?

name: Rintaro
line: Super Hacker Mister Daru, has hacked into SERN.

name: Kurisu
line: Is that okay? Won’t they catch you?

name: Itaru
line: I wouldn’t make a blunder like that.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s not what I meant.

name: Rintaro
line: As a result, we found evidence that those bastards are researching time travel with the LHC.

name: Kurisu
line: The LHC?

name: Itaru
line: Seriously. We have the evidence. And guess what? The LHC has been in operation for nine years.

name: Kurisu
line: What? Really!?

name: Rintaro
line: And they’ve successfully generated mini black holes.

name: Kurisu
line: No way... Then why haven’t they made an official announcement!?

name: Rintaro
line: That’s just it. For some reason, those bastards won’t announce any of it.

name: Rintaro
line: That the LHC has been operating for nine years. That they’ve successfully created mini black holes. That they’re researching time travel.

name: Rintaro
line: Basically, it’s proof that SERN has--

name: Rintaro
line: Basically, it’s proof that SERN has something to hide. Can’t you just smell the conspiracy?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t believe in conspiracies, but...

name: Kurisu
line: If you can prove what you said is real, then I might be surprised. SERN doing time travel research...

name: Kurisu
line: Ah, but what about the IBN 5100? How is that involved?

name: Rintaro
line: SERN’s database uses--

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry. Daru, please continue the explanation.

name: Rintaro
line: So, how far did you get?

name: Itaru
line: Up to the point where SERN’s using IBN 5100 code for their database.

name: Rintaro
line: So basically, what that means is--

name: Rintaro
line: The only way to decrypt that database is to use an IBN 5100 of our own.

name: Kurisu
line: How do you know that?

name: Rintaro
line: I have my sources.

name: Kurisu
line: Setting the IBN 5100 and such aside...

name: Kurisu
line: I want to see proof that SERN’s really doing that sort of research.

name: Rintaro
line: Daru. Will it take much longer to find the server admin’s account?

name: Itaru
line: Actually, I was just thinking about doing that. It shouldn’t take more than half a day, I guess.

name: Rintaro
line: There you go.

name: Kurisu
line: ...I’ll wait until then.

name: Itaru
line: You’ll wait? It’s already getting dark. Why not go home for tonight and come back tomorrow morning?

name: Kurisu
line: No thanks. I’ll wait. I want to know as soon as possible, even if it’s just a microsecond sooner.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh, that’s the spirit. You’re already fascinated by the conspiracy. You can’t help but want to know what lies at the heart of SERN.

name: Kurisu
line: If what you guys are saying is true... then this isn’t something to joke about.

name: Kurisu
line: SERN is the world’s top research institution. If they’re doing secret experiments without publishing their results...

name: Kurisu
line: They’re making fools of scientists the world over.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s only if it’s true, though.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, Daru. I’ll leave it to you.

name: Kurisu
line: Can you show me the PhoneWave?

name: Rintaro
line: Indeed I can. Want to experiment?

name: Kurisu
line: You haven’t been able to send another email to the past yet, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Do you know why?

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s run some tests.

name: Kurisu
line: Man. You have a ton of junk.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s not junk!

name: Rintaro
line: Since you’re new to the Future Gadget Laboratory, I’ll explain. These are the glorious fruits of our science: the Future Gadgets!

name: Rintaro
line: Future Gadgets 1-7 are stored here. The PhoneWave, with which you are already familiar, is Gadget Number 8.

name: Kurisu
line: Future Gadgets, huh...

name: Kurisu
line: Hey. Isn’t this... a weapon?

name: Rintaro
line: Future Gadget No. 4: Moad Snake, designed after a claymore landmine, is an instant humidifier.

name: Kurisu
line: How confusing.

name: Rintaro
line: Insert water and turn the power on, and in mere seconds, it generates a thick cloud of steam.

name: Kurisu
line: So it’s junk. I thought so.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m borrowing this.

name: Rintaro
line: Whoa!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s just not right without a lab coat.

name: Kurisu
line: Hey!

name: Rintaro
line: Assistant! You get it, don’t you!?

name: Kurisu
line: G-get what? Let go!

name: Rintaro
line: If you’re gonna do science, you need a lab coat! Right!?

name: Rintaro
line: I knew you were meant for this, Christina! You’re the best assistant a mad scientist could ask for!

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know if that’s supposed to be a compliment, but it’s coming off as an insult. Now let go!

name: Rintaro
line: I’m giving you that lab coat to commemorate your joining the lab. Don’t worry. It’s never been worn.

name: Rintaro
line: Or maybe this fateful encounter between you and that lab coat was decided by destiny long ago. Daru not wearing it was just another inevitability. This is the choice of Steins--

name: Kurisu
line: Shut up so we can start the experiment.

name: Kurisu
line: ...So you haven’t tampered with the microwave at all?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s in terminal mode now. We can change the factory settings like this, make the microwave do things its manufacturer never intended.

name: Kurisu
line: How was it set when the discharge phenomenon occurred?

name: Rintaro
line: Nothing out of the ordinary. It was at factory settings.

name: Kurisu
line: Hmm.

name: Kurisu
line: I’ll take a banana.

name: Rintaro
line: Those are Mayuri’s.

name: Kurisu
line: Oh, so I don’t need your permission, then. I’ll go buy new bananas tomorrow.

name: Kurisu
line: ...Nothing happened.

name: Kurisu
line: Ow!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s hot.

name: Rintaro
line: Meaning the microwave functioned normally.

name: Rintaro
line: What does this mean...

name: Kurisu
line: I guess what happened earlier was an irregularity after all.

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t know if it’s an irregularity or not, but we ought to investigate the cause.

name: Kurisu
line: I agree.

name: Rintaro
line: In the previous experiment...

name: Rintaro
line: After spending 120 seconds in the PhoneWave (name subject to change), the banana teleported back to the bunch gelified. We should consider that it returned to its state 120 seconds before.

name: Kurisu
line: Wrong. If it returned to its state 120 seconds before, it wouldn’t be gelified.

name: Rintaro
line: The chicken returned to its frozen state without gelifying.

name: Kurisu
line: That logic is dubious. Sure it ended up frozen, but did you examine the possibility that it might have gelified first?

name: Rintaro
line: Salt didn’t gelify.

name: Kurisu
line: You mean nothing changed.

name: Rintaro
line: After the discharge phenomenon occurred last time, we spent all night experimenting with cabbage, radishes, rice, konjac, melon bread, Crunchy-kun, and cup noodles. Nothing happened.

name: Rintaro
line: The same thing with liquids. On that day, our success rate took a 180 degree turn.

name: Rintaro
line: Before the discharge phenomenon, everything succeeded. After the discharge phenomenon, everything failed.

name: Kurisu
line: Is the microwave storing electricity?

name: Kurisu
line: You said that gelified objects became fractal structured, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Salt has a simple structure by nature, so maybe that had an effect. But how could electricity be related...

name: Rintaro
line: Here, we should think under the assumptions of time travel theory.

name: Kurisu
line: No. It’s not good to start thinking from the conclusion.

name: Rintaro
line: We’ve already had several successful experiments. You can’t deny that.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not especially concerned whether this thing is a time machine or not.

name: Kurisu
line: To begin with, it’s physically impossible for this tiny little microwave to produce energy equivalent to the big bang.

name: Kurisu
line: We can’t reproduce the discharge phenomenon, nor the fractalization. There should be a reason why.

name: Kurisu
line: We haven’t changed our methods. We haven’t changed the settings. We haven’t changed the experimental subjects either. There must be some other variable.

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe it’s the one who observes it.

name: Kurisu
line: What do you mean by that?

name: Rintaro
line: Quantum theory. The observer is an important element to the experiment.

name: Kurisu
line: There were four of us here when the discharge phenomenon occurred last time. But before that, it occurred when Hashida-san was alone.

name: Kurisu
line: Each time fractalization occurred, there were either two or three people observing.

name: Kurisu
line: You and I each saw both phenomena.

name: Kurisu
line: In other words, the conditions haven’t changed.

name: Rintaro
line: In that case...

name: Kurisu
line: Hmmm...

name: Rintaro
line: Hungry?

name: Kurisu
line: Sh-shut up! I haven’t eaten anything since lunch.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s already 8?

name: Rintaro
line: Just eat a banana. But only one of the two we just warmed. They are, after all, the fruit of our experiments.

name: Rintaro
line: Or you could take something from our stock of cup noodles.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t want any? Well, since you have lived in America for so long, I guess you’d prefer fast food instead--

name: Kurisu
line: Cup noodles.

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Kurisu
line: I’ll have cup noodles.

name: Rintaro
line: Cup noodles!?

name: Kurisu
line: What flavors?

name: Rintaro
line: There’s soy sauce flavor and chicken flavor.

name: Kurisu
line: Chicken.

name: Kurisu
line: Also... do you have a fork?

name: Rintaro
line: Christina, is it okay to stay here this late? Perhaps you should contact your family.

name: Kurisu
line: No need.

name: Rintaro
line: What? Do your parents let you do whatever you want?

name: Kurisu
line: I haven’t seen my father in seven years. My mother is in America. I’m living in a hotel right now. Understand?

name: Rintaro
line: Wha...!

name: Rintaro
line: You damn celebrity! If you’re American, then you should at least use a motel instead of a hotel, right!?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not American, and there aren’t any motels in the heart of Tokyo.

name: Rintaro
line: What sort of hotel?

name: Kurisu
line: What do you mean? It’s a normal hotel in Ochanomizu.

name: Rintaro
line: Ochanomizu? Then you can walk there from here, can’t you?

name: Kurisu
line: Sure.

name: Rintaro
line: So, tell me about your father.

name: Kurisu
line: Sorry?

name: Rintaro
line: You said you haven’t seen him in seven years?

name: Kurisu
line: Why do you care about my father?

name: Rintaro
line: You’re the one who mentioned him. Isn’t that basically a hidden message saying ’please give me some advice about my father, please’?

name: Kurisu
line: You’re crazy.

name: Rintaro
line: You are my assistant! And I can’t let my assistant have any worries. So tell me everything that’s on your mind!

name: Rintaro
line: What’s wrong?

name: Kurisu
line: I have nothing to say to you.

name: Rintaro

line: Thanks.

name: Female Reporter
line: Five days have passed since the satellite crash, and with the start of summer vacation season, crowds are gathering to get a glimpse of the satellite, which still has not been removed.

name: Teenage Girl
line: I came from Nagoya. I wanted to see it.

name: Middle-aged Man
line: I drove all the way from Saitama. It’s amazing! Where did that thing come from?

name: Teenage Girl 2
line: Yay! I’m a high school girl from Chiba♪

name: Female Reporter
line: Tourists from all over Japan are flocking to this location.

name: Female Reporter
line: In an interview earlier today, Michael Byrne, spokesman for NASA, stated...

name: Female Reporter
line: That no satellite had crashed in Japan, and that the crashed object was, in fact, not even a satellite.

name: Female Reporter
line: The satellite is currently under police investigation. No date for removal has been set.

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Good morning! Oh wait, should I say, good afternoon?

name: Mayuri
line: Whoo! The air in here is sooo thick.

name: Mayuri
line: I’ll refresh the air!

name: Rintaro
line: Since all lab mems are present and accounted for, this is the perfect opportunity to hold another Round Table Conference.

name: Mayuri
line: Roundabout confluence?

name: Itaru
line: ...What’s that?

name: Rintaro
line: A meeting of lab mems.

name: Itaru
line: Have we ever done that before?

name: Kurisu
line: Do you even have a round table?

name: Rintaro
line: Not physically. However, it exists in the hearts of all lab mems. Am I mistaken?

name: Kurisu
line: Yes, you’re mistaken. Don’t go sticking things in people’s hearts.

name: Mayuri
line: Is there one in Mayushii too?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course there is.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh, that’s good. But what’s a roundable?

name: Itaru
line: And why a round table? You King Arthur?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m only a temporary lab mem anyway.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, it’s a Round Table Conference! Mayuri wasn’t here last night, so first, let’s explain the situation to her.

name: Mayuri
line: I told you you shouldn’t do bad things.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph, ’bad’ you say? We are bad? Absurd.

name: Rintaro
line: If we’re bad, then SERN is even worse. They aren’t satisfied with ruling the world. Now they want to get their hands on space-time itself!

name: Kurisu
line: I agree.

name: Kurisu
line: What SERN is doing is unforgivable. They’re traitors to humanity, to society, and to science.

name: Mayuri
line: I guess...

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, Ragnarok can no longer be averted. The final battle with SERN is near.

name: Mayuri
line: Rag in a rock?

name: Kurisu
line: Norse mythology again?

name: Rintaro
line: Christina! I ordered you to investigate SERN! What have you learned?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t remember being ordered, but whatever.

name: Kurisu
line: There are two problems SERN faces with time travel.

name: Kurisu
line: First is the electron injection device, also known as a ’lifter’.

name: Kurisu
line: Unless they get it to function properly, they can’t make the Kerr black hole singularites naked.

name: Kurisu
line: If you send a test subject through the singularity in its current state, the supergravity compresses them to the micro level. Naturally, there’s no way to survive.

name: Kurisu
line: The second problem is that they can’t specify a physical destination. They can’t choose where they end up after traveling to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s why I’d say the 14 found jellymen were the lucky ones.

name: Kurisu
line: Over a hundred human experiments have been performed since 2001. The remaining 80 or so people ended up somewhere they can’t be found.

name: Mayuri
line: Why can’t they be found?

name: Itaru
line: Didn’t you know, Mayu-shi? The world is constantly moving. Its rotational speed is 1500 kph, and its orbital speed is 114,000 kph--

name: Kurisu
line: SERN has been looking for solutions, but it’s not going well.

name: Rintaro
line: Now then. Have you learned anything that could help us complete the PhoneWave (name subject to change)?

name: Kurisu
line: Hmm...

name: Kurisu
line: Well, I suppose you could call the LHC the world’s largest microwave oven.

name: Rintaro
line: Of course! In other words, the PhoneWave (name subject to change) is a miniature LHC!

name: Kurisu
line: You might be on to something there.

name: Kurisu
line: However, there are too many things we don’t know about the PhoneWave. Why do the same phenomena that occur in SERN’s time machine also occur in that tiny little microwave?

name: Kurisu
line: Unlike the LHC, this thing wasn’t made for time travel.

name: Mayuri
line: It was made to warm Mayushii’s chicken!

name: Kurisu
line: W-well, yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: Since the jellyman phenomenon occurs with the PhoneWave (name subject to change), Mayuri’s bananas must be reaching the Kerr black hole’s ring singularity.

name: Mayuri
line: It makes a black hole? Here?

name: Mayuri
line: It won’t suck us in, will it?

name: Kurisu
line: But we still haven’t figured out the electric discharge phenomenon, or the conditions required to cause it.

name: Itaru
line: During our experiments earlier, we were only able to send emails to the past during the discharge.

name: Rintaro
line: Although it hasn’t happened again, that discharge phenomenon could very well signify the injection of charge -- that is, electrons.

name: Rintaro
line: And only when it occurs does the path to the singularity open.

name: Kurisu
line: We don’t know the cause of the discharge phenomenon.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s what we need to find out.

name: Kurisu
line: In the first place, the emails we’re sending to the past are digital data, not physical objects. That’s a definite difference from SERN’s time machine.

name: Rintaro
line: No, we’re doing the same thing. Who’s to say that digital data can’t go through a singularity? I think it would be easier than sending something human-sized.

name: Kurisu
line: Well... I suppose that’s true.

name: Mayuri
line: You know, the way you guys talk about email...

name: Mayuri
line: It makes me think of folding a letter into a paper airplane and making it go zoom, you know?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s more like a beam of light. Like optical digital data.

name: Rintaro
line: By the way, it’s a pain to keep saying ’email sent to the past’. Let’s give it a proper name.

name: Kurisu
line: I’ve got a bad feeling about this.

name: Rintaro
line: What’s that supposed to mean? You dare mock Hououin Kyouma!?

name: Kurisu
line: You just want to give it some oddball name, don’t you?

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph! How rude. Heed me! I shall name the phenomenon of ’email sent to the past’ as follows. The name shall be...

name: Rintaro
line: Nostalgia Drive!

name: Kurisu
line: Confusing. Rejected.

name: Rintaro
line: Why you! Who gave you the authority to reject my ideas!? You’re just an assistant!

name: Kurisu
line: Then why don’t we take a vote? All in favor of Nostalgia Drive.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you forsaken me, Daru!? Mayuri!?

name: Mayuri
line: Chris-chan’s right. It’s too hard for Mayushii to remember.

name: Itaru
line: It’s way too chuuni, man.

name: Rintaro
line: Fine! Then let’s hear alternatives! Don’t tell me you rejected my idea without having any bright ideas of your own!?

name: Kurisu
line: I think it needs to be something easy to understand. It’s an email that regresses through time, so how about Retromail?

name: Mayuri
line: What does ’retro’ mean?

name: Rintaro
line: Sounds like you have your answer, Christina. You said it should be easy to understand, but it wasn’t easy to understand at all, was it!?

name: Kurisu
line: B-but that’s because Mayuri-san is...

name: Kurisu
line: Uh, n-never mind...

name: Rintaro
line: Were you about to say ’because Mayuri’s dumb’?

name: Kurisu
line: N-no!

name: Mayuri
line: Eh? Chris-chan, do you think Mayushii’s dumb?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t! I promise I don’t! Okay?

name: Itaru
line: I vote ’The Mail Who Leapt through Time’.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s too stiff. It’s hard to say.

name: Itaru
line: It’s better than your ’Nostalagisticexpialidocious’ nonsense! And mine makes a movie title referen--

name: Rintaro
line: That’s not cool. It needs to be cool.

name: Itaru
line: You’re rejecting it for that?

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Mayushii has an idea!

name: Mayuri
line: How about ’Back to the Mail’? I took a movie title, and changed a word to mail!

name: Itaru
line: I already did the movie joke, Mayu-shi.

name: Kurisu
line: Besides, I think the meaning is a little off.

name: Mayuri
line: It’s not about the meaning... I took a movie title and changed a word to mail...

name: Rintaro
line: Either way, it’s too long!

name: Itaru
line: Then how about DeLorean Mail?

name: Rintaro
line: That doesn’t even say what kind of email it is!

name: Kurisu
line: Hey. We don’t have time for this nonsense. Let’s just abbreviate it to ’D-Mail’ and move on.

name: Rintaro
line: But that’s boring.

name: Kurisu
line: It don’t care if it’s boring.

name: Mayuri
line: D-Mail it is!

name: Itaru
line: So why does the D-Mail phenomenon occur?

name: Rintaro
line: Because the path through the ring singularity is open. We’ve been over this already.

name: Kurisu
line: We don’t know if there’s actually a black hole at work here. It could be an entirely different phenomenon that just happens to resemble SERN’s experiments.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s dangerous to jump to conclusions.

name: Rintaro
line: Why so timid? Don’t you want our time travel experiments to succeed? That’s why we put our lives on the line to hack SERN!

name: Rintaro
line: What we need to figure out is how to turn the PhoneWave (name subject to change) into a usable time machine.

name: Itaru
line: Do you really think that’s possible?

name: Rintaro
line: There is no think. Only do!

name: Kurisu
line: What, did you read that off a motivational poster? You’re like the classic incompetent boss.

name: Rintaro
line: Damn you! You dare insult the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma!?

name: Itaru
line: Well, it’s not like Okarin’s the boss anyway.

name: Rintaro
line: Indeed. I am the symbol of this lab, not the boss.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know what you mean by symbol, but how do you plan to turn the PhoneWave into a time machine? Let’s have details.

name: Rintaro
line: My plan... alright, there is one thing.

name: Rintaro
line: We’ve been thinking that the electrical discharge happens at random, but I have a hypothesis.

name: Kurisu
line: Which is?

name: Rintaro
line: Recall the conditions when it occurred, Christina. We experimented through the night with no results, but there’s one variable we overlooked. The simplest, most definitive variable of all.

name: Rintaro
line: That is, the time of the occurrence.

name: Rintaro
line: I checked the times of the two previous occurrences.

name: Rintaro
line: When I accidentally sent the first D-Mail to Daru’s phone, it happened between noon and one PM.

name: Rintaro
line: The second time, when all four of us observed the D-Mail, it was six PM.

name: Rintaro
line: So if we perform the experiment within that timeframe, we might be able to reproduce the effect.

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s try it right now!

name: Itaru
line: Well, I’m glad to see she has her priorities straight.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii’s banana supply is getting low... gotta buy more.

name: Kurisu
line: Sorry, Mayuri-san. I’ll go buy you some new bananas later.

name: Mayuri
line: Really? Yay♪

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin and Daru-kun eat my bananas, but they never buy new ones...

name: Kurisu
line: First, let’s see if it’ll become a jellyman.

name: Kurisu
line: Agh!

name: Rintaro
line: Trying for the clumsy girl appeal?

name: Kurisu
line: It was an accident!

name: Kurisu
line: Put the microwave somewhere else! It’s dangerous and hard to reach like this.

name: Rintaro
line: It’ll punch through the floor if we put it on the table.

name: Mayuri
line: Chris-chan, Chris-chan! Pain, pain, go away♪

name: Kurisu
line: Thanks, Mayuri-san.

name: Kurisu
line: Ah!

name: Itaru
line: Whoa!

name: Mayuri
line: It became a gelbana...

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh... muhahaha... MUHAHAHAHA! Just as I suspected, the critical variable was time!

name: Kurisu
line: W-way to go, Okabe. It was so simple, I didn’t notice it.

name: Rintaro
line: Your praise does you credit, Christina, but I know you’re frustrated you didn’t think of it first. Muhahahaha!

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, let’s see if we can send another D-Mail.

name: Rintaro
line: Guh... I feel like my authority has been on the decline since that girl showed up.

name: Itaru
line: It’s cool, man. You never had any to begin with.

name: Kurisu
line: Help me, you two! Okabe, I’m sending an email to your phone.

name: Mayuri
line: What are you gonna send, Chris-chan?

name: Kurisu
line: It doesn’t matter what it says. What matters is whether we can send it or not.

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm? Lemme see... Okabe is an airhe...?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait! You there, assistant! What are you typing?

name: Kurisu
line: You’ll see. Ready? I’m sending it.

name: Itaru
line: Starting the countdown!

name: Kurisu
line: Kya!

name: Rintaro
line: MUHAHAHAHA! It’s working! It’s working, you guys!

name: Kurisu
line: ...Did it arrive?

name: Kurisu
line: Pfft...

name: Rintaro
line: Christina. Did you send two mails?

name: Kurisu
line: Eh? No. I only sent one.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii saw it too. She really only sent one.

name: Rintaro
line: But I received two.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re right... I even sent it in one sentence, but it got divided.

name: Rintaro
line: By the way, what does this word mean?

name: Kurisu
line: Why don’t you look it up?

name: Itaru
line: That reminds me. The D-Mail from before was cut up mid-sentence too.

name: Rintaro
line: Was it?

name: Itaru
line: Yeah. Look at your history. I’m pretty sure I sent ’Okarin’s a perv’.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re right. This one got split too.

name: Kurisu
line: I wonder what’s causing it.

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe it’s related to the jellymen.

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Mayushii wants to know why it arrived five days ago.

name: Kurisu
line: Good point. Didn’t the last one also arrive five days before we sent it?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. It did.

name: Itaru
line: Is there some kind of rule for when it arrives?

name: Mayuri
line: Let’s try sending more!

name: Rintaro
line: Alright, lab mems! Battle stations!

name: Kurisu
line: He’s at it again...

name: Rintaro
line: Our mission: to send as many D-Mails as possible!

name: Rintaro
line: Daru, man the X68000. Your job is to observe, adjust, and gather information on the PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Rintaro
line: Assistant, keep those mails coming! Try various patterns of text. Japanese, English, full-width, half-width, emoticons. The actual messages don’t matter.

name: Mayuri
line: What about Mayushii?

name: Rintaro
line: Your mission is to go shopping. Just buy some bananas for now. I, Hououin Kyouma, shall fund you!

name: Mayuri
line: Wow! You’re so generous♪

name: Kurisu
line: So I guess your job is opening the microwave.

name: Itaru
line: Whoa! You saved the easiest job for yourself?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. No, my assistant’s judgment is sound. The key to a successful D-Mail is most likely the correct timing of opening the microwave door!

name: Kurisu
line: Uh, I was just kidding.

name: Rintaro
line: MUHAHAHAHA! Leave this task to Hououin Kyouma! I shall open this door with precision, boldness, and delicacy, as if it were the flesh of a beautiful woman!

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin, that’s naughty!

name: Rintaro
line: Furthermore, the current operation is top secret. You must not leak it to anyone. Got it?

name: Rintaro
line: Now I shall give this operation a name! It shall be known as Op--

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t need one. Let’s start.

name: Rintaro
line: Wha... but...

name: Kurisu
line: Go ahead and rest. I’m gonna have a go at it a little longer.

name: Suzuha
line: Sup!

name: Suzuha
line: What shenanigans are you up to this early in the morning?

name: Rintaro
line: The kind you wouldn’t believe. We’re building the first time machine in human history.

name: Suzuha
line: Huh. Cool.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, shouldn’t you be more surprised!?

name: Itaru
line: Can’t blame her for being skeptical. I didn’t think it was possible either.

name: Itaru
line: And isn’t that top secret? I thought you didn’t want anyone to know.

name: Rintaro
line: Crap! Part-Time Warrior, please keep what I just said a secret.

name: Suzuha
line: Sure. By the way...

name: Suzuha
line: The boss is really pissed.

name: Rintaro
line: Why?

name: Suzuha
line: The noise. Whatever you’re doing up there, it’s got the whole building shaking. Dust everywhere. Kinda like an air raid.

name: Suzuha
line: He was saying stuff like ’What’s that nutcase doing? I’mma raise his damn rent!’

name: Suzuha
line: Maybe you should go apologize.

name: Itaru
line: Oh boy. What if he kicks us out?

name: Rintaro
line: Alright, leave it to me. Daru, go tell my assistant to lay off the experiments for now.

name: Itaru
line: Roger that... I won’t forget you, soldier.

name: Suzuha
line: ...By the way, is Makise Kurisu here too?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you met before?

name: Suzuha
line: Um... no. Yesterday was first contact.

name: Rintaro
line: First contact?

name: Rintaro
line: Oh. Really?

name: Rintaro
line: Weren’t you a little hostile for a first contact?

name: Suzuha
line: She’s... my enemy.

name: Rintaro
line: How can she be your enemy? You just met, right?

name: Suzuha
line: Yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: Did she do something to you?

name: Suzuha
line: Not to me.

name: Rintaro
line: What does that mean? She did something to someone else?

name: Rintaro
line: If you want, I can go talk things over with Christina.

name: Suzuha
line: It doesn’t really matter.

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe you’re blaming the wrong person?

name: Suzuha
line: Geez! Give it a rest!

name: Suzuha
line: Anyway! Shouldn’t you apologize to the boss instead of talking to me?

name: Rintaro
line: I have come!

name: Tennouji
line: Hey, Okabe. The hell are you doing up there?

name: Rintaro
line: We’re currently conducting experiments that will change the course of human history. The discoveries we make today will shape the world for centur--

name: Tennouji
line: I don’t care what games you guys play. I’m the owner of this building. Got it?

name: Tennouji
line: And the building’s really worn out. You keep shaking it like that, you could bring the whole damn thing down on our heads.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh... Veeery interesting, Mister Braun. Don’t tell me you forged this building’s earthquake safety certificate?

name: Tennouji
line: What if I did?

name: Tennouji
line: It’s been properly reinforced. But regardless, you guys are still shaking it too much.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph! So what if a few buildings collapse?

name: Tennouji
line: What’s that?

name: Rintaro
line: As I’ve said countless times before, our current experiment is of vital importance to the history of science -- no, to the history of human civilization itself!

name: Rintaro
line: It’s more important than prolonging this building’s lifetime for another ten or so measly years!

name: Tennouji
line: Okabe!

name: Tennouji
line: The ceiling is falling, you dumbass! Some got into my ramen! What are you gonna do about it, huh!? No more shaking!

name: Tennouji
line: Or I’ll raise your rent by 10,000!

name: Rintaro
line: Leave it to me, Mister Braun! On my honor, I swear there won’t be any more shaking today!

name: Rintaro
line: Christina! Stop the experiments at once!

name: Mayuri
line: Sorry, Okarin. Mayushii tried to warm up some chicken.

name: Mayuri
line: I accidentally put it through reverse rotation, and then it started sparking.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I see.

name: Kurisu
line: I sent you an email. Didn’t you get it?

name: Rintaro
line: Stop screwing around! I’m the one who has to deal with Mister Braun!

name: Kurisu
line: But I gave you five days advance notice.

name: Itaru
line: Was he mad?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah... I could feel his Killing Aura.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, no more experiments today.

name: Kurisu
line: Well, at least we got some good data.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m dead tired, and my hair’s dried out. I want to take a shower and go sleep.

name: Mayuri
line: If you want a shower, there’s one here. It doesn’t have a bath, though. Okarin always uses it.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s probably filthy...

name: Rintaro
line: I’d be lying if I called it clean. This entire building is in shambles.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, I refuse to use the same shower as Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: I understand. Nobody will blame you if you don’t use it. Of course, since the three of us stayed up all night, we’re all pretty smelly. Heh heh heh.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s why I’m going back to my hotel once I finish eating.

name: Rintaro
line: Celebrity bath time at a high class hotel? I want to come too.

name: Kurisu
line: Not a chance.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii wants to come too!

name: Kurisu
line: You can come any time, Mayuri-san.

name: Mayuri
line: Really? Thank you♪

name: Mayuri
line: Hey, Okarin, I’ve been wondering, but why do you drink soda while you eat? Does it make it taste better?

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t really see a problem.

name: Itaru
line: Me neither.

name: Kurisu
line: Same. I didn’t give it a second thought.

name: Mayuri
line: Ehh?

name: Rintaro
line: You’re acting weird, Mayuri. It’s normal to drink soda while eating.

name: Itaru
line: It’s normal, duh.

name: Kurisu
line: No objections.

name: Mayuri
line: No way! You guys are the weird ones!

name: Rintaro
line: Now, let’s discuss Operation Urd’s progress.

name: Itaru
line: Operation Urd?

name: Rintaro
line: Oh, right. Thanks to a certain assistant, I didn’t get a chance to present the operation’s codename yesterday. Heed me! These D-Mail experiments are all part of Operation Ur--

name: Kurisu
line: The experiments have been fruitful.

name: Kurisu
line: At the very least, we’ve learned what we can do with D-Mail.

name: Kurisu
line: That about sums it up. Anything to add?

name: Rintaro
line: A D-Mail can be at most 36 English characters or 18 Japanese characters long. That makes experimentation difficult, so we’ll want to improve that first.

name: Itaru
line: But we figured out how to control when it arrives. That’s pretty good, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Observation isn’t enough. We need to find the underlying principle. What I’ve written here is nothing but verified phenomena.

name: Rintaro
line: The underlying principle... you’re right. It’s not a complete time machine until we understand how it works.

name: Rintaro
line: What could be the reason for the character limit?

name: Mayuri
line: Um...

name: Mayuri
line: Chicken and bananas become ’gelchicken’ and ’gelbanas’, but salt doesn’t turn into ’gelsalt’, right?

name: Itaru
line: So much gel...

name: Mayuri
line: And you can send 36 letters in a D-Mail, but everything past that disappears, right-?

name: Mayuri
line: So I think maybe you can’t send big things, or a lot of small things.

name: Mayuri
line: Maybe the Curb black hole--

name: Kurisu
line: Uh, it’s Kerr black hole.

name: Mayuri
line: The Curb black hole--

name: Kurisu
line: Kerr black hole.

name: Mayuri
line: ...the black hole’s hole is too tight.

name: Itaru
line: Mayu-shi... say that one more time. Starting from ’hole’.

name: Mayuri
line: The hole is too tight!

name: Itaru
line: Outrageous!

name: Rintaro
line: Stop making her say stuff like that!

name: Kurisu
line: The hole is tight... huh. That might not be entirely wrong.

name: Kurisu
line: Maybe we have the same problem SERN has with their time machine. Since they can’t fully control the lifter, they can’t make the singularities perfectly naked, which limits how much they can send.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, 6 Japanese or 12 English characters comes out to 12 bytes.

name: Kurisu
line: Bytes? Not kilobytes?

name: Itaru
line: Oh? So Makise-shi’s bad with computers?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. Is that so, assistant?

name: Kurisu
line: Sh-shut up! You don’t see things measured in bytes nowadays, so I was just making sure...

name: Itaru
line: Well, email isn’t just comprised of text. There’s more to it, like the sender and receiver’s email addresses, the header, and various other things.

name: Itaru
line: So roughly speaking, we can send data in three batches of 12 bytes, then? By the way, I don’t know if using a subject changes anything.

name: Rintaro
line: But I’m pretty sure that chicken and bananas have to be larger than 12 bytes.

name: Rintaro
line: Since each grain of salt is tiny, it’s possible they could be converted to less than 12 bytes.

name: Kurisu
line: So larger masses get crushed by supergravity?

name: Rintaro
line: Mass might not be the issue here. Data doesn’t have mass.

name: Kurisu
line: In any case, since the singularity isn’t naked, the object is forced to pass through the event horizon.

name: Kurisu
line: Inside the event horizon, space and time switch places, causing the subject that arrived at the ring singularity to reach ultra high speed...

name: Kurisu
line: The data, crushed and destroyed by super gravity, is shot out of the black hole...

name: Rintaro
line: As a jellyman.

name: Kurisu
line: But even a small mass has to pass through supergravity. How does it emerge unscathed?

name: Rintaro
line: If the hole is too tight, then just inject more electrons.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t think it’s that simple. I mean, I’m sure SERN’s tried that already. And yet they haven’t gotten any results after nine years of experiments.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s not as simple as increasing the flow of electrons.

name: Rintaro
line: I see...

name: Kurisu
line: SERN has a lifter, but we don’t know what in the PhoneWave is filling the same role, much less how to adjust it.

name: Rintaro
line: We don’t know what acts as the lifter...

name: Rintaro
line: But we do know that it has successfully created a path wide enough to send approximately 36 bytes of data through the ring singularity.

name: Mayuri
line: I don’t get it...

name: Rintaro
line: Think of it like an RPG. The ring singularity, the entrance to the event horizon, is the gate to the Demon Lord’s castle.

name: Kurisu
line: D-demon Lord...?

name: Mayuri
line: So the soldiers who went home as slimes are jellymen?

name: Rintaro
line: But there’s an exception.

name: Itaru
line: Combining soldiers? That’s just silly.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s to illustrate that the object can’t be too big.

name: Mayuri
line: I get it! That’s really easy to understand.

name: Kurisu
line: It is?

name: Itaru
line: It’s a dumb metaphor, but I guess it works? At least as an explanation for why things get gelified.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. It’s all thanks to Mayuri’s hint.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii was helpful?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. Great insight, Mayuri.

name: Mayuri
line: Ehehe! Yay!

name: Kurisu
line: But it’s still a hypothesis. It hasn’t been proven.

name: Itaru
line: How would you prove it? With human experiments like SERN?

name: Kurisu
line: If Okabe and Hashida-san volunteer as test subjects, I’ll happily experiment on you.

name: Itaru
line: Human experimentation sounds kinda dirty. If you know what I mean.

name: Itaru
line: But I refuse. I’d rather play the doctor than the subject.

name: Rintaro
line: Same here. No, not in the way he’s implying.

name: Kurisu
line: Idiots.

name: Kurisu
line: As I keep saying, the real problem is what the PhoneWave uses as a lifter.

name: Rintaro
line: That and one other thing. How come the discharge phenomenon and gelification only happen during a certain timeframe?

name: Itaru
line: We may not understand everything, but we’ve perfected the art of D-Mailing. Isn’t that our Final Answer?

name: Mayuri
line: Sending mail to the past is amazing, isn’t it?

name: Itaru
line: Though I guess it’s not a real time machine unless we can send people to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: Even SERN has failed to send humans through. If you believe what Titor says, it won’t be another, what, 24 years before there’s a true time machine?

name: Rintaro
line: Physical time travel is impossible for us at the moment. We lack the funds and facilities available to SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: And yet we have realized a form of time travel. We’ve sent data to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: We should investigate the PhoneWave further. We need to understand what’s going on.

name: Itaru
line: I have some fun ideas for how to use D-Mail.

name: Rintaro
line: I know how you feel, but we can’t today. If we shake the building again, Mister Braun is sure to blow a gasket.

name: Rintaro
line: We can start experimenting again tomorrow. But this, I will declare now.

name: Mayuri
line: You have to take off your shoes. It’s dirty!

name: Rintaro
line: Today -- uhh, what day is it?

name: Itaru
line: August 2nd.

name: Rintaro
line: August 2nd, 2010 is a date which will live in infamy!

name: Rintaro
line: For on this day, we, the Future Gadget Laboratory, have developed--

name: Rintaro
line: The first successful time machine in the history of mankind!

name: Itaru
line: It’s not the first. SERN beat us.

name: Kurisu
line: And you can’t even say we developed it. It happened by accident.

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph! It seems that my assistant doesn’t know the meaning of the word ’serendipity’. Penicillin, X-ray machines, dynamite -- these inventions and more were all born from coincidence!

name: Kurisu
line: I guess...

name: Mayuri
line: But Chris-chan, you said before that time machines don’t exist, right? But now you admit they do!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s just that I have to admit it for now. If we investigate how the PhoneWave works, it might turn out to be something that only seems like time travel.

name: Rintaro
line: Does nobody have any respect for my grand declaration!?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t complain if I take all the credit for inventing the first -- second, whatever -- time machine in human history!

name: Rintaro
line: The 66th Round Table Conference ends here. Dismissed!

name: Itaru
line: Wait, that was a Round Table Conference? I didn’t know that. And it’s even the 66th.

name: Kurisu
line: Who cares what kind of table it is?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m gonna go back to my hotel, take a shower, and sleep.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii has to go to work soon.

name: Rintaro
line: Nn... ugh...?

name: Moeka
line: Ah...

name: Rintaro
line: I was asleep.

name: Moeka
line: ...You’re covered in sweat.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. I just had a little taste of what it’s like to be a particle drifting through space.

name: Rintaro
line: So you came to see the IBN 5100?

name: Rintaro
line: I can show you... but did you have to come so early?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait... I get it! Your true intention is to do an article on me, isn’t it!?

name: Rintaro
line: I’m not reading it.

name: Rintaro
line: I’d feel like an idiot exchanging emails when you’re standing right in front of me.

name: Rintaro
line: Speak.

name: Moeka
line: ...Is it okay?

name: Rintaro
line: Is what okay?

name: Moeka
line: Please show me... the IBN 5100.

name: Rintaro
line: Fine. But just look. After you look, you leave. Okay?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s in that cardboard box over there.

name: Rintaro
line: No unauthorized photographs. First, show me the camera you’re going to use.

name: Rintaro
line: Just place the camera you’re going to use on that shelf so I can see it. Okay? No funny business.

name: Rintaro
line: ...That’s it? You’re going to use your phone camera?

name: Moeka
line: ...Mail.

name: Rintaro
line: Speak.

name: Rintaro
line: H-hey! What are you doing!?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t move! Do as I say. Place your phone slowly on the shelf inside. Do it now! Any sudden movements and you’re dead!

name: Rintaro
line: Why did you take a picture?

name: Moeka
line: ...I wanted to.

name: Rintaro
line: You could’ve asked for permission. Why didn’t you?

name: Moeka
line: I asked... by mail.

name: Rintaro
line: Oh... You really need to learn to talk.

name: Rintaro
line: Alright. You can take as many pictures as you want, but on one condition. No face shots. If you take a picture of me, I’ll have no choice but to silence you.

name: Moeka
line: I don’t want your picture.

name: Rintaro
line: I already said no.

name: Rintaro
line: Besides, that thing weighs a ton. You can’t carry it by yourself.

name: Rintaro
line: Wait a minute!

name: Rintaro
line: Why are you assuming I’ll lend it to you!? I already said I wouldn’t!

name: Moeka
line: ...Really?

name: Rintaro
line: Really.

name: Moeka
line: ...No matter what?

name: Rintaro
line: No matter what.

name: Moeka
line: ...Ugh!

name: Rintaro
line: Hey! Hold it right there!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing!?

name: Moeka
line: ...Taking it home.

name: Rintaro
line: Like hell you are! Who said you could!?

name: Moeka
line: You... didn’t reply to my mail.

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: No! That argument’s just irrational!

name: Rintaro
line: Step away from the machine.

name: Rintaro
line: Now listen well.

name: Rintaro
line: The phantom retro PC, the IBN 5100, has chosen me, Hououin Kyouma, as its contractual master.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s the undeniable truth. Not even God can change this decision. For it is the choice of Steins Gate!

name: Rintaro
line: Besides, I’m only borrowing the IBN 5100’s power. When I’m done with it, I’m returning it to its original owner.

name: Rintaro
line: I can’t tell you. I swore a blood oath to maintain secrecy and protect the original owner from those who desire the IBN 5100.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I am not without sympathy for your plight.

name: Rintaro
line: I formed a contract with the IBN 5100 for my own goals. After I achieve those goals, you can negotiate with the original owner to form a contract of your own.

name: Rintaro
line: And when Ragnarok is over, whether it ends in victory or defeat, my life as Hououin Kyouma will be...

name: Rintaro
line: No, forget what I said. This is no time to be thinking about the future. After all, my future is already...

name: Moeka
line: Anyway... where was it?

name: Rintaro
line: The IBN 5100 was at Yanabayashi Shrine.

name: Itaru
line: ...Guten Morgen.

name: Rintaro
line: You sure are early.

name: Itaru
line: I went to bed early. Woke up at five this morning.

name: Itaru
line: Man, it’s hot! It’s not supposed to be this hot in the morning.

name: Itaru
line: Oh? Oh? Okarin, who’s this erot... sexy 3D woman?

name: Rintaro
line: Ah, let me introduce you. This is Shining Finger, Kiryu Moeka.

name: Itaru
line: Shining... Finger? Does her hand glow with an awesome power?

name: Rintaro
line: No, but she’s definitely an esper.

name: Itaru
line: An esper? That’s stupid.

name: Rintaro
line: Watch her type. You’ll see.

name: Itaru
line: Well, whatever. Welcome to the lab, Kiryu-shi.

name: Itaru
line: Wh-what magnificent ignore skill. Are you looking down on me because I’m a fatass ota? You’re a mainstream woman, aren’t you!?

name: Rintaro
line: Um, Moeka, this is my Favorite Right Arm, Super Hacka Daru--

name: Itaru
line: Hey, Okarin. Did you... do something to her?

name: Rintaro
line: Like what? We were just taking pictures.

name: Itaru
line: Pictures... pictures? So you’re going to blackmail her and force her to be our sex toy...

name: Rintaro
line: Stop applying eroge logic to reality.

name: Itaru
line: My bad.

name: Itaru
line: Oh, right. I thought up some upgrades we could make to the PhoneWave.

name: Rintaro
line: Like what?

name: Itaru
line: You know how it’s a huge pain in the ass to send D-Mails to the past?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah.

name: Itaru
line: I want to simplify that process. Oh, and also make it possible to forward from the PhoneWave’s dedicated phone.

name: Rintaro
line: Forward? What do you mean?

name: Itaru
line: Right now, you can only send a D-Mail to the phone attached to the PhoneWave, right?

name: Itaru
line: That’s pretty inconvenient. If we give the PhoneWave’s dedicated phone a forwarding function, we can use it to send D-Mails to any number we want.

name: Rintaro
line: How long will that upgrade take?

name: Itaru
line: Two or three hours? That’s if you help me, though.

name: Rintaro
line: Understood. I’ll help.

name: Itaru
line: OK.

name: Rintaro
line: If you want to say something, then say it to my--

name: Moeka
line: ...Read the email.

name: Rintaro
line: Say it to my--

name: Moeka
line: Sending email to the past.

name: Moeka
line: That’s what he said.

name: Moeka
line: ...Tell me.

name: Rintaro
line: You misheard us.

name: Moeka
line: No.

name: Moeka
line: I know what I heard.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. There’s a problem. ...No, not that. Information on Number 8 got leaked to a third party. ...Yeah, I know. I need to do something.

name: Rintaro
line: Depending on the situation, I may have to silence her. ...Yeah, I know. We can’t let the Organization know about this.

name: Rintaro
line: Steins Gate seems to enjoy sending trouble my way. ...Heh, don’t worry. My seat in hell can wait until Ragnarok is over.

name: Rintaro
line: El Psy Kongroo.

name: Moeka
line: ...Who was that?

name: Rintaro
line: It doesn’t concern you.

name: Rintaro
line: Kiryu Moeka. You must swear to protect our secret... or die.

name: Rintaro
line: Choose now. No time to think it over. No alternatives either.

name: Rintaro
line: You have learned our secret, and now you must pay the price.

name: Moeka
line: ...You’ll kill me?

name: Rintaro
line: Only if you try to go public. Underestimate the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma, at your per--

name: Itaru
line: Are you at it again, Okarin?

name: Itaru
line: Kiryu-shi, was it? Okarin’s kind of crazy, so it’s ok to ignore him when he talks like this.

name: Rintaro
line: Imbecile! Because of your careless tongue, she found out that the PhoneWave (name subject to change) is a time machine!

name: Moeka
line: A... time machine!

name: Itaru
line: Uh, that was pretty careless too.

name: Rintaro
line: Guh...

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Good morning!

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin! Mayushii wants to warm up some chicken before you start the time travel experiments.

name: Rintaro
line: Kiryu Moeka. I’ll tell you everything... and I have a favor to ask.

name: Rintaro
line: Tremble, right arm of mine! By the covenant I command thee. Come forth, hellfire of darkest black! Fulfill my desire for ultimate destruction. Ashes to ashes, dust to dust!

name: Rintaro
line: Hrraahm!!

name: Mayuri
line: Ahhh! Now I can’t warm up any more chicken...

name: Rintaro
line: This isn’t a microwave anymore. It’s a time machine.

name: Mayuri
line: That’s not fair! Go buy a new microwave, Okarin!

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t have that kind of money!

name: Rintaro
line: I told you no pictures.

name: Moeka
line: ...In commemoration.

name: Rintaro
line: Of what? Anyway, no pictures.

name: Rintaro
line: Kuh... I’ve gone soft. The old me would have killed her without a second thought.

name: Rintaro
line: What is it?

name: Moeka
line: ...Is it really a time machine?

name: Rintaro
line: Yes. You’ll see. But you can’t tell anyone. Okay?

name: Itaru
line: Alright, program complete.

name: Kurisu
line: Then lets resume the experiments.

name: Mayuri
line: But won’t the manager scold us again?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh, don’t worry. Yesterday, I made this promise with Mister Braun. ’I swear there won’t be any more shaking today.’

name: Rintaro
line: In other words, the no-shaking promise only applied yesterday, so since today is yesterday’s tomorrow, we can shake it all we want!

name: Kurisu
line: That doesn’t settle anything. Why you’re so confident is a mystery to me.

name: Rintaro
line: In other words, Christina, you want me to erase Mister Braun.

name: Kurisu
line: No!

name: Kurisu
line: Besides, I don’t think a wimp like you stands a chance against him.

name: Mayuri
line: He’s so muscley!

name: Rintaro
line: Is this the choice of Steins Gate? But how do I...

name: Rintaro
line: Hm?

name: Rintaro
line: Hey you! Part-Time Warrior!

name: Suzuha
line: Sup!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing there?

name: Suzuha
line: Can’t you tell? I’m polishing my bicycle!

name: Rintaro
line: Aren’t you working today?

name: Suzuha
line: Of course I am. Why else would I be here?

name: Kurisu
line: What, is she still tinkering with that bike of hers?

name: Kurisu
line: She was there when I came in, glaring at me.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, Part-Time Warrior! Where’s Mister Braun?

name: Suzuha
line: Mister Braun? Who’s that?

name: Rintaro
line: The manager of that junk shop you work at.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s not a junk shop. It’s a CRT specialty shop.

name: Suzuha
line: Oh, so that’s who you meant. Ahaha.

name: Nae
line: Daddy’s name isn’t Mister Braun.

name: Suzuha
line: The boss is on a service trip! I don’t think he’ll be back for a while!

name: Rintaro
line: Wh-what!? Is that true!?

name: Suzuha
line: It’s true! I wouldn’t be slacking off like this otherwise!

name: Suzuha
line: Ah, Nae, don’t tell the boss I said that, okay?

name: Nae
line: Then let me ride your bicycle.

name: Rintaro
line: You heard her. This must be the choice of Steins Gate.

name: Rintaro
line: Mister Braun is currently absent. In other words, we can experiment to our heart’s content!

name: Kurisu
line: That doesn’t solve the problem, you know.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m telling you, it’s the choice of Steins Gate.

name: Itaru
line: Whatever. I want to try out the PhoneWave 2nd Edition v1.03.

name: Mayuri
line: Second attention verse erosion?

name: Itaru
line: 2nd Edition v1.03.

name: Rintaro
line: Enough of your unsophisticated names. The upgraded version shall be known as Heavenly Merry-Go-Round.

name: Kurisu
line: The name doesn’t matter. Let’s just start the experi--

name: Moeka
line: ...You looked like you were having fun.

name: Kurisu
line: Hardly. I’m fed up with these people and their fooling around.

name: Itaru
line: This assistant is such a tsundere.

name: Kurisu
line: Who are you calling a tsundere!?

name: Itaru
line: Oh? Makise-shi, you know what tsundere means?

name: Rintaro
line: I think you do. It’s written all over your face.

name: Kurisu
line: Mmmgh...

name: Moeka
line: ...Experiment please.

name: Itaru
line: I’m setting it up so it forwards to Okarin’s phone.

name: Moeka
line: It really...

name: Rintaro
line: What do you think? This proves that the PhoneWave (name subject to change) is an honest-to-goodness time machine.

name: Suzuha
line: Hey!

name: Suzuha
line: It’s shaking again! And there’s a strange light, too! What are you doing up there!?

name: Rintaro
line: Now then, lab mems.

name: Rintaro
line: The 73rd Round Table Conference will come to order.

name: Kurisu
line: Yesterday was the 66th. Where’d the other six go?

name: Rintaro
line: Only anal retentive bastards care about the minor details. That’s why you’ll never be more than an assistant, Christina!

name: Kurisu
line: Like I keep saying, I’m neither your assistant nor Christina.

name: Rintaro
line: In the first stage of Operation Urd, we tested the limits of D-Mail technology.

name: Rintaro
line: Today, we advance to the second stage. Practical applications of D-Mail.

name: Mayuri
line: Practical applications? I’ll send one to this morning so I can say ’Good morning, Okarin♪’

name: Rintaro
line: Like hell you will. Write that on the back of a leaflet or something.

name: Mayuri
line: But if it’s on the back of a leaflet, you won’t get it.

name: Rintaro
line: When I say practical applications, what I mean is...

name: Rintaro
line: Changing the past.

name: Kurisu
line: Now hold on! It’s too dangerous! Are you trying to play god!?

name: Rintaro
line: Oh? What’s so dangerous about it?

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s say you create a time paradox and blow up the world. What do you plan to do then?

name: Rintaro
line: Well, I guess we’d be dead.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re going to change the past so recklessly? Are you kidding me?

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t tell me... you’re not seriously trying to bring chaos to the world or whatever, are you?

name: Itaru
line: Nah, he’s all talk. It’s fine to ignore him, Makise-shi.

name: Kurisu
line: R-really?

name: Mayuri
line: Don’t worry! Okarin’s actually a very nice person. You’ll see!

name: Rintaro
line: I don’t remember asking for an appraisal, but I’ll answer Christina’s question.

name: Rintaro
line: My dream is to plunge the world into chaos. However, it is still far too early to bring that dream to fruition.

name: Rintaro
line: We can only send 36-byte emails. That’s not enough for my purposes.

name: Rintaro
line: Therefore, I shall set my ambition -- Project Chaotic -- aside for now.

name: Moeka
line: Project... Chaotic?

name: Kurisu
line: Did you just come up with that?

name: Itaru
line: Correct, Makise-shi!

name: Kurisu
line: YES.

name: Itaru
line: Okarin just says the first thing that comes to mind. He’s always like that.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t analyze me, Daru! And you, assistant! Stop that fist pumping! You making fun of me!?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, so what are we going to do?

name: Itaru
line: Yeah. How do you want to change the past, anyway?

name: Rintaro
line: First of all, the purpose of this experiment is to verify whether or not we can actually change the past. So it doesn’t matter how trivial the change is.

name: Kurisu
line: Have you heard of the Butterfly Effect?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course.

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, it’s like that saying. ’When the wind blows, the bucket maker gains.’

name: Kurisu
line: Eh? No, it’s kinda like that, but kinda not...

name: Rintaro
line: A butterfly flaps its wings in Beijing and a storm happens in New York, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Yeah, that. Part of Chaos Theory.

name: Kurisu
line: Basically, any change, no matter how small, could have a significant effect on the future.

name: Kurisu
line: How do you plan to take responsibility for that?

name: Rintaro
line: Titor said that the many-worlds interpretation holds true.

name: Kurisu
line: And that makes it okay to change the past? You’re going to believe that self-proclaimed time traveler’s delusions?

name: Rintaro
line: Can you prove they’re delusions?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m asking what you’re going to do if they are. How are you going to deal with the consequences?

name: Rintaro
line: Christina, you said this before, did you not?

name: Rintaro
line: When hypotheses pile up, and theories are verified, they become reality. That’s how modern physics comes to understand the truth of the universe.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re contradicting yourself.

name: Kurisu
line: No, I’m not.

name: Kurisu
line: We don’t even have a hypothesis for how the PhoneWave works.

name: Kurisu
line: We’re just fumbling around in the dark here. There are still too many risks to try changing the past.

name: Kurisu
line: We should wait until we know more.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re actually itching to try it out, aren’t you?

name: Kurisu
line: W-well...

name: Rintaro
line: Besides, didn’t you want to prove that the PhoneWave (name subject to change) isn’t a time machine?

name: Rintaro
line: If it’s not a time machine, then it can’t change the past. You could prove yourself right, so why are you against it?

name: Kurisu
line: Oh shut up...

name: Rintaro
line: And if you’re going to talk about time paradoxes, then what about SERN?

name: Rintaro
line: They’ve already sent more than 100 people to the past. Surely a few paradoxes have happened by now.

name: Kurisu
line: So you want to stoop to the same level as the guys that did those inhumane experiments?

name: Rintaro
line: We’re not doing human testing or anything, so relax.

name: Mayuri
line: Um...

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Okarin? Mayushii doesn’t really get it, but what are you going to change?

name: Rintaro
line: My goal for this operation is simple. We, my friends...

name: Rintaro
line: Are going to win the lottery!

name: Itaru
line: I’m for it. If we win the lottery, I can buy all the computer parts I want and go to MayQueen for every meal of the day. We’d be stupid not to try it.

name: Mayuri
line: Money? Okarin... that makes Mayushii sad.

name: Mayuri
line: We should do something that will bring peace to the world!

name: Mayuri
line: Like what if we give everybody in the whole wide world an Upa cushion?

name: Rintaro
line: Hmph. Peace, you say? Don’t be ridiculous.

name: Rintaro
line: I am the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyo--

name: Kurisu
line: And here I thought you had ambition.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t get me wrong.

name: Rintaro
line: This isn’t about world peace and it isn’t about ambition. It’s about discovering whether or not we can change the past.

name: Rintaro
line: The easiest way to do that is to see if we can win the lottery, right?

name: Kurisu
line: But your primary goal is the money, isn’t it?

name: Rintaro
line: With that kind of money, I could say goodbye to this rickety old building! Muhahaha! I could get an office in Daibiru or UPX!

name: Kurisu
line: See? Just like I thought.

name: Rintaro
line: I won’t whitewash it. If we moved, we could experiment as much as we want without fear of Mister Braun. If we had money, we could build the Future Gadgets of our dreams.

name: Rintaro
line: And of course, we could buy a truckload of Mayuri’s favorite bananas.

name: Mayuri
line: A t-truckload?

name: Kurisu
line: No, Mayuri-san! Don’t let him tempt you!

name: Rintaro
line: Shut it, Celeb Seventeen!

name: Kurisu
line: S-se...? Serendipity?

name: Rintaro
line: Celeb. Seventeen.

name: Kurisu
line: What the hell is that supposed to mean!?

name: Rintaro
line: You live in a hotel off of your parents’ money. You could never understand the plight of poor students like us.

name: Kurisu
line: What do you think, Moeka-san?

name: Rintaro
line: If you’re going to complain, then suggest an alternative. A change to the past that would be both trivial and easy to understand. Got anything?

name: Kurisu
line: Um...

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm?

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s try changing the hotel I’m staying at.

name: Rintaro
line: How are we supposed to know the difference? If you want to stay in Uguisudani, do it on your own. That should be easy for a Celeb Seventeen like you.

name: Kurisu
line: Do you have to say it like that?

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, why Uguisudani?

name: Rintaro
line: Because that’s where all the love hotels ar--

name: Kurisu
line: One more word out of you and I excise your frontal lobe with a rusty scalpel.

name: Mayuri
line: Then how about we change my fried chicken to a different brand?

name: Rintaro
line: Nobody cares what brand of chicken you eat.

name: Mayuri
line: Aw...

name: Rintaro
line: Even with a time machine before you all, this is all you can think of. You guys sure lack imagination.

name: Rintaro
line: If there are no other suggestions, we’ll use my plan.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. We’re beginning stage two of Operation Urd.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, no problem. I, Hououin Kyouma, shall take all responsibility. Heh, don’t worry. Nothing will come back to you.

name: Rintaro
line: Correct. This is my choice, and the choice of Steins Gate. Ragnarok is near. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Rintaro
line: Now, begin the operation!

name: Itaru
line: Uh, what do you want us to do?

name: Rintaro
line: Are you incapable of doing anything without my instructions?

name: Mayuri
line: First, we need to buy a lottery ticket.

name: Kurisu
line: No, first we need a winning number.

name: Rintaro
line: Exactly, Celeb Seventeen! Now you’re talking.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t call me Celeb Seventeen.

name: Itaru
line: First, we have to decide which lottery to go for. Think we should go for Dream Summer Jumbo?

name: Mayuri
line: I saw a TV commercial for that the other day!

name: Rintaro
line: Did they announce the winners?

name: Itaru
line: Should be next week or the week after.

name: Rintaro
line: Then there’s no point! We can only send D-Mails to the past!

name: Itaru
line: Oh, right.

name: Itaru
line: We could wait until the Summer Jumbo drawing date.

name: Rintaro
line: You’ve got your priorities backwards. Don’t get fixated on Summer Jumbo. Let’s look at the last lottery that announced its winners.

name: Itaru
line: Hmmm, I’ll google it.

name: Kurisu
line: If someone sent me the winning numbers from the future, would I believe it?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Mayushii doesn’t even know how to buy a lottery ticket...

name: Kurisu
line: That’s okay. I don’t think teenage girls buy lottery tickets.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you ever bought one, Moeka?

name: Mayuri
line: How about you, Okarin?

name: Rintaro
line: ...I tried the LOTO SIX once.

name: Itaru
line: Hey, LOTO SIX might work. I’m pretty sure they announce winning numbers every week.

name: Mayuri
line: Are you going to send this winning number in a D-Mail?

name: Rintaro
line: Exactly. Though of course, we have to mention it’s for LOTO SIX.

name: Itaru
line: Hmm, last week’s 1st prize was... woah, 200 million!

name: Rintaro
line: W-wait! 1st prize is too much!

name: Itaru
line: Why?

name: Kurisu
line: That is an awful lot of money... hahaha...

name: Rintaro
line: No, not that. 1st place would be... too conspicuous.

name: Kurisu
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t you get it!? I’m being chased by the Organization. If we win 1st prize, the media will cover the event and my cover will be blown!

name: Kurisu
line: That’s stupid.

name: Mayuri
line: What if Mayushii wins?

name: Rintaro
line: No. Stage Two of Operation Urd does have its risks, just like Celeb Sev said.

name: Kurisu
line: Celeb... Sev? Don’t abbreviate it.

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll be the winner. That way, I shoulder all of the risk.

name: Kurisu
line: And all of the money, right? I see your plan.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, we should aim a little lower. Daru, how much is 2nd prize?

name: Itaru
line: Umm, looks like it was... 23 million yen.

name: Rintaro
line: ...L-let’s try 3rd prize.

name: Itaru
line: That was only 700,000 yen.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, that’s good. That should be about right.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re such a chicken.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh, heh heh heh! That’s rich, coming from the one who was so worried about the risk of time paradoxes. Eh, Celeb Sev!?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m begging you, stop calling me that. I’ll settle for assistant.

name: Kurisu
line: And don’t misunderstand. I’m still worried about what could go wrong.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m trying to minimize our risk by choosing an amount that’s just right. Stop being so stubborn.

name: Kurisu
line: ...No, you.

name: Mayuri
line: Um, could we fill a truckload of bananas with 700,000 yen?

name: Itaru
line: For 3rd prize, you need to get five matching numbers.

name: Rintaro
line: Moeka. I assign to you your first duty as a new lab mem.

name: Rintaro
line: Figure out what to put in the D-Mail. It needs to convince an unknowing me one week ago to buy into the LOTO SIX.

name: Rintaro
line: You are the mail demon, so this should be right up your alley.

name: Kurisu
line: Thursday last week... so about five days. Is that okay?

name: Itaru
line: The drawing was five days ago. It needs to arrive before that, right?

name: Kurisu
line: We’ll send it to one week ago. 7 days is 168 hours, so let’s round up a bit and enter 170#.

name: Rintaro
line: It’ll have to do.

name: Mayuri
line: This mail’s kinda shady, huh? Ehehe!

name: Moeka
line: ...I’ll redo it.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s fine. I don’t think there’s any other way. Though it is kind of shady.

name: Mayuri
line: Don’t worry! Okarin loves shady things, so it’s perfect!

name: Rintaro
line: The time has come. Prepare to open Steins Gate!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s been bugging me, but what is that Steins Gate thing?

name: Mayuri
line: It’s Okarin’s catch phrase♪

name: Rintaro
line: Steins Gate is Steins Gate. Nothing more, nothing less.

name: Kurisu
line: That doesn’t explain anything.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t complain about every little thing. That’s not important right now.

name: Itaru
line: Starting up the microwave!

name: Rintaro
line: El Psy Kongroo!

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin? Are you okay?

name: Mayuri
line: Are you okay?

name: Itaru
line: Hmm...

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri, how long have I been standing here?

name: Mayuri
line: Eh? What do you mean?

name: Rintaro
line: Just tell me.

name: Mayuri
line: Hm... maybe 30 seconds?

name: Rintaro
line: 30 seconds? Really?

name: Mayuri
line: Yup. You suddenly ran over to the PhoneWave, then you took out your phone and started going ’haaah haaah!

name: Itaru
line: Say that again, Mayushii.

name: Mayuri
line: Huh? You started going haah haah?

name: Itaru
line: The haah haah part!

name: Mayuri
line: Haah haah!

name: Itaru
line: More sexy this time!

name: Kurisu
line: Stop it, perv.

name: Rintaro
line: Th-that’s right, the mail!

name: Rintaro
line: The mail arrived a week ago.

name: Mayuri
line: Hm? What’s going on?

name: Rintaro
line: The money! Did I win the LOTO SIX?

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, Celeb Sev, did I win 3rd place?

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t call me Celeb Sev! And 3rd place of what?

name: Rintaro
line: ...what?

name: Rintaro
line: What did you say just now?

name: Kurisu
line: Wh-what?

name: Rintaro
line: What the hell did you say just now!?

name: Kurisu
line: Got a problem? I asked what, and then you just--

name: Rintaro
line: Not that! You said ’3rd place of what’, right!? I mean 3rd place of LOTO SIX!

name: Kurisu
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: Daru! I sent myself the winning LOTO SIX numbers just now. Didn’t I?

name: Itaru
line: Holy crap!

name: Itaru
line: That’s brilliant, man! We can use D-Mails to make ourselves billionaires!

name: Itaru
line: I could buy all the computer parts I want and go to MayQueen for every meal of the day! I AM SO PUMPED UP!

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri, you were gonna buy a truckload of bananas... right?

name: Mayuri
line: A truckload? Who’s gonna fill it up?

name: Rintaro
line: Wait! What happened to stage two of Operation Urd!?

name: Kurisu
line: By stage two, you mean an experiment to see if we can change the past, right?

name: Rintaro
line: R-right! That’s it!

name: Itaru
line: Yeah, that’s why we’re all thinking.

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Mayuri
line: About what to send, so we can tell if the past has changed.

name: Itaru
line: I think we should definitely go with Okarin’s LOTO SIX idea.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii thinks we shouldn’t be so greedy for dough.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, but when I say dough, I don’t mean like for baking.

name: Kurisu
line: I think we all know what you mean.

name: Mayuri
line: Really? That’s great! So, instead of being greedy, we should do something that will bring peace to the world!

name: Mayuri
line: Like, if we gave everybody in the whole wide world an Upa cushion, I think everyone would be happy♪

name: Itaru
line: The only ones who’d be happy are little kids and Mayu-shi.

name: Luka
line: Um... hello?

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, it’s Luka-kun! Welcome♪

name: Luka
line: Pardon the sudden intrusion...

name: Mayuri
line: Did you decide to wear one of Mayushii’s costumes? That would make me happy♪

name: Luka
line: Ah, no, that’s not why I came...

name: Rintaro
line: ...What is it?

name: Luka
line: Actually, Okabe-san... I mean, Kyouma-san, there’s something I need to apologize for...

name: Rintaro
line: Where did you get this!?

name: Luka
line: T-that hurts...

name: Mayuri
line: Don’t pick on Luka-kun!

name: Kurisu
line: What’s wrong with you, Okabe? You’re acting weird.

name: Itaru
line: Is the heat getting to him?

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry, Lukako, but I need to know. Where did you get that LOTO SIX ticket?

name: Luka
line: Um... you told me the numbers.

name: Rintaro
line: I... did?

name: Luka
line: You told me to buy them because they might win...

name: Rintaro
line: R-really? When was that!?

name: Luka
line: A week ago...

name: Itaru
line: Wait, did Luka-shi win the LOTO SIX?

name: Mayuri
line: Wow! Okarin’s a psychic!

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t tell me... you sent the winning numbers with the PhoneWave?

name: Rintaro
line: Why are you asking me that? You saw me send them.

name: Kurisu
line: I did? What are you talking about?

name: Rintaro
line: I sent the winning numbers in a D-Mail just now. We discussed it and decided that’s what we would do. You all watched it happen.

name: Rintaro
line: Then the past changed. It actually changed.

name: Itaru
line: Hold on, Luka-shi! How much did you win!?

name: Rintaro
line: 700,000, right? 3rd place.

name: Luka
line: Um...

name: Luka
line: I’m really sorry, Kyouma-san. Even though you told me exactly what to do, I...

name: Luka
line: Filled one of the numbers in wrong...

name: Luka
line: Um... if that ’18’ had been a ’19’, then it would’ve been 3rd place... just like Kyouma-san said.

name: Itaru
line: Nooo! So close! And yet so far!

name: Rintaro
line: ...Huh? It’s gone! Why!?

name: Suzuha
line: Hey there, Okabe Rintaro.

name: Suzuha
line: You look like you’ve been brainwashed. You okay?

name: Rintaro
line: Brainwashed? Me?

name: Suzuha
line: Well, there’s nobody else here.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I suppose you’re right.

name: Suzuha
line: Which part?

name: Suzuha
line: Being brainwashed? Or nobody else being here?

name: Rintaro
line: Being brainwashed.

name: Suzuha
line: You... were?

name: Rintaro
