line: It’s an offline meet for this sci-fi BBS I post on.

name: Itaru
line: Some famous writers are going to be there. I won’t forgive you, Okarin. Ever.

name: Rintaro
line: What? Why didn’t you say so? I would’ve gone too!

name: Rintaro
line: ...Does anyone else smell that?

name: Kurisu
line: Smell what?

name: Rintaro
line: Did we blow a fuse somewhere?

name: Luka
line: S-sorry...

name: Luka
line: That’s probably the smell of... Mayuri’s cooking...

name: Kurisu
line: I’ll help too.

name: Luka
line: Okay, then warm these eggs please.

name: Kurisu
line: Hm. Should I use the PhoneWave?

name: Luka
line: N-no! If you put raw eggs in a microwave, they’ll explode!

name: Kurisu
line: We took the door off. It should be fine, right?

name: Mayuri
line: Chop, chop, choppity chop, chop, chop, choppity...

name: Luka
line: M-Mayuri-chan! Don’t hold your knife like that!

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe we should help too. Or at least kick them out of the kitchen?

name: Itaru
line: Won’t it end up the same either way?

name: Rintaro
line: I’m getting dizzy. This isn’t the future I was hoping for.

name: Itaru
line: You’re telling me. I’ll never forget this, Okarin. Never.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m sorry. Truly. But please, Daru, stay with me to the end.

name: Itaru
line: I’ll order pizza as insurance.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. Looks like the Evil One is free. If you haven’t heard from me in an hour... tell my parents I love them.

name: Itaru
line: Okarin, that’s a death flag...

name: Rintaro
line: Is this the choice of Steins Gate? El Psy Kongroo...

name: Itaru
line: Hwahhhh...

name: Rintaro
line: ...She’s late.

name: Rintaro
line: Hououin Kyouma will never accept that! She will be my guinea pig whether she likes it or not!

name: Rintaro
line: You there! Part-Time Warrior!

name: Rintaro
line: Wait!

name: Suzuha
line: ...You’re a nice guy. You know that?

name: Suzuha
line: I think talking to you really did help.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin! Did you find Suzu-san?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s late. Go home, everyone.

name: Luka
line: But...

name: Kurisu
line: Tell us what happened.

name: Itaru
line: Yeah. Keep us in the loop, man.

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha ran away from me. I guess she couldn’t find her father.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh...

name: Rintaro
line: Heh... heh heh heh...

name: Rintaro
line: MUHAHAHAHA!

name: Luka
line: O-Okabe-san? What’s wrong? Are you okay?

name: Kurisu
line: His brain is probably oxygen-starved from too much running.

name: Itaru
line: Okarin... chill.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh, look at you all!

name: Rintaro
line: Why the long faces, friends!?

name: Rintaro
line: Have you forgotten? We have just the thing for moments like these!

name: Kurisu
line: You’re going to send a D-Mail?

name: Itaru
line: But the discharge phenomenon won’t occur this late, will it?

name: Rintaro
line: Then we’ll send it tomorrow.

name: Mayuri
line: Who are you sending it to?

name: Rintaro
line: To myself this afternoon. The message...

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t listen to Christina. Pursue Suzuha!’

name: Rintaro
line: ...Good morning, Part-Time Warrior.

name: Suzuha
line: Sup.

name: Rintaro
line: Slacking off?

name: Suzuha
line: It’s not like anyone’s gonna come.

name: Suzuha
line: And besides, I was up all night partying.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m really tired.

name: Rintaro
line: You were partying? With who?

name: Suzuha
line: Were you drinking, Okabe Rintaro?

name: Suzuha
line: Big no-no. You’re only eighteen.

name: Rintaro
line: You couldn’t find your father, so we held the ’Last Supper’ to make you a test subject. Correct?

name: Suzuha
line: Ahaha! Yeah, I remember you saying something like that.

name: Suzuha
line: Thanks for all your help yesterday.

name: Rintaro
line: ...My memory’s a bit fuzzy. Remind me again how we captured you.

name: Suzuha
line: Wait, were you really drinking last night?

name: Rintaro
line: Just tell me.

name: Suzuha
line: Well, I was on my way home from the time machine meet when--

name: Rintaro
line: Woah, wait a second. Time machine meet!?

name: Suzuha
line: Yup.

name: Rintaro
line: Was that where your father was supposed to appear?

name: Suzuha
line: I said so yesterday, didn’t I?

name: Rintaro
line: So you were going home, and then?

name: Suzuha
line: You, Hashida Itaru, and Shiina Mayuri appeared out of nowhere.

name: Suzuha
line: You brought me to the lab, and we partied all night long.

name: Suzuha
line: Yesterday sure was fun...

name: Suzuha
line: It would’ve been more fun if not for Makise Kurisu. The apple pie she made was deadly.

name: Suzuha
line: But Urushibara Luka’s curry was awesome.

name: Suzuha
line: Your lab seems kinda like... umm... like a clubhouse? It’s nice.

name: Suzuha
line: Everyone gets along, and you’re always smiling...

name: Suzuha
line: I’ve never had so much fun in my life.

name: Rintaro
line: Part-Time Warrior. As promised, you are now my test subject.

name: Suzuha
line: But I already told you. I don’t know his email address.

name: Rintaro
line: Then we’ll have to postpone the experiment until you find out.

name: Rintaro
line: By the way, the PhoneWave (name subject to change) used in the experiment is our lab’s greatest secret. You must become a lab mem to guarantee your silence.

name: Suzuha
line: Lab mem?

name: Rintaro
line: Short for laboratory member. When you become a lab mem, you become one of us.

name: Suzuha
line: ...Can I really join?

name: Rintaro
line: You don’t have a choice in the matter! From this day forth, you are Lab Mem 008!

name: Suzuha
line: I guess I don’t have a choice, huh? I’m all yours.

name: Rintaro
line: ...You’re not going to leave?

name: Suzuha
line: Nope. Maybe there’s still a chance to find my dad.

name: Rintaro
line: You are a lab mem now. If there’s anything we can do, you need only ask.

name: Rintaro
line: By the way, do you have any leads?

name: Suzuha
line: My father calls himself Titor.

name: Rintaro
line: Wait, Titor? As in that Titor!?

name: Suzuha
line: You know about him? He might be using a different codename, though.

name: Rintaro
line: Look! There’s someone posting named John Titor!

name: Rintaro
line: This solves the puzzle! Your father is on @channel!

name: Suzuha
line: Huh... you’re right.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey. Shouldn’t you be more surprised?

name: Suzuha
line: Well... it’s not him.

name: Rintaro
line: How do you know? You just said your father calls himself Titor!

name: Suzuha
line: I can tell. This Titor isn’t my dad.

name: Suzuha
line: His name’s not John. The name my father used was...

name: Suzuha
line: Barrel Titor.

name: Mayuri
line: This is the Earth, you know? 70 million years ago.

name: Mayuri
line: Some scary people sent you here in a time machine.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii went looking for you, and found Okarins from many, maaaany worldlines.

name: Mayuri
line: You’re one of many Okarins, and also the original.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii is one of many Mayushiis, and also the original.

name: Mayuri
line: And now, Okarin and Mayushii are going to die here.

name: Mayuri
line: But...

name: Mayuri
line: I know that another Okarin and Mayushii will pick up where we left off, 70 million years in the future.

name: Mayuri
line: So everything’s A-OK♪

name: Rintaro
line: This... is a dream!

name: Rintaro
line: Guh!

name: Rintaro
line: ...It was a dream.

name: Mayuri
line: I wish I had an Upa...

name: Rintaro
line: This is Hououin Kyouma.

name: Faris
line: Nyaon♪ It’s Faris, nyan.

name: Rintaro
line: Oh, it’s you, Akiha Rumiho.

name: Faris
line: Nya? Who’s that, nya?

name: Faris
line: Faris is Faris, nya. I don’t have any other names, nya.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, right. Your True Name is Faris. My apologies.

name: Rintaro
line: Well, what is it?

name: Faris
line: You’ve been too conspicuous, nya. The cat’s outta the bag, and now you’re trapped, nya.

name: Rintaro
line: Hah?

name: Faris
line: The Four Guardian Kings have awakened, nya. There’s no escape, nyan.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. Is that so? If you think the Four Guardian Kings can stop me, just wait and see. Akiba will be drowning in blood before nightfall.

name: Faris
line: After the Four Guardian Kings are the Four Guardian Queens, nya. After that, it’s the Eight Devils, and then the Black Angel Twelve, nya.

name: Rintaro
line: Th-that many!? What’s going on in this town...

name: Faris
line: You’ve really stirred up a hornet’s nest, nya. I’m sorry, Kyouma, but this is checkmate, nyan.

name: Rintaro
line: No, it’s not over yet. If I can just acquire the item, I can turn the tide!

name: Rintaro
line: Have you still not located an IBN 5100!?

name: Faris
line: Sorry, nya. I have agents looking all over the world, but still no luck, nya.

name: Rintaro
line: Please hurry. I’m running out of time.

name: Faris
line: Okay, nya! I’ll tell you as soon as I find one, Kyouma. Until then... hold on to your nine lives, nyan.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, I can’t die yet... El Psy Ko--

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Mayushii here.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, Feris-chan. Good mornyan♪

name: Mayuri
line: Kyouma? Oh, you mean Okarin? Yup, he’s here. Wanna talk to him?

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm? Um, it looks like he can’t talk.

name: Mayuri
line: ...yup. ...mmhmm.

name: Mayuri
line: Ok, I’ll tell him. Byebye♪

name: Rintaro
line: Well done, Mayuri. You’ll make a fine assistant yet. What did Faris want?

name: Mayuri
line: Well, she said that the Four Guardian Kings have assembled in Akiba, so be careful.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t tell me that’s all she said?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, she also hasn’t found an IBN 5100 yet. She said if she does find one, she’ll contact you nyan.

name: Itaru
line: Guess that’s why they call it the phantom PC.

name: Itaru
line: I read on @channel that some collectors will pay millions of yen to buy one.

name: Itaru
line: IBN 5100s are serious business, man.

name: Rintaro
line: If they have that high a premium...

name: Itaru
line: I don’t get it. How come they’re so expensive?

name: Itaru
line: I mean, I guess they were pretty expensive to begin with. Looks like one cost about $20,000 back in the day.

name: Itaru
line: Anyway, I can’t believe it’s so hard to find one. Sure it was a nice machine for its time, but only for its time. You’d have to be crazy to want one now.

name: Itaru
line: Maybe it’s one guy buying them all up.

name: Itaru
line: Woah, what’s this?

name: Rintaro
line: What’s wrong?

name: Itaru
line: But... there’s no way that’s right!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you talking about? Explain.

name: Itaru
line: Well, I’m pulling data off the server, looking for a way to gain root access...

name: Itaru
line: And these files are downloading crazy fast. I mean, we’re talking light speed here.

name: Itaru
line: It’s hard to believe, but for some reason, this area has a direct fiber optic line to SERN. Several lines, even.

name: Rintaro
line: Direct? What do you mean?

name: Itaru
line: I mean there’s literally a fiber optic cable running from underneath this building to SERN’s headquarters in France.

name: Rintaro
line: Is that strange?

name: Itaru
line: Uh, yeah?

name: Itaru
line: Have a look. This is the route we used to visit the National Assembly of France’s site.

name: Itaru
line: It starts from our IP address. From there, it passes through various relays in Japan, jumps to France, then bounces around there for a while before finally reaching the National Assembly’s site.

name: Itaru
line: It takes 16 steps total to get there.

name: Itaru
line: The average transfer rate is about 300 milliseconds. That’s normal for an overseas connection.

name: Itaru
line: In other words, there’s a route we have to take to get to France from Japan. Everyone takes the same route.

name: Itaru
line: Other countries are the same. Even browsing domestically takes about 10 steps.

name: Itaru
line: Now let’s try SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: There’s only one step...

name: Itaru
line: And the transfer rate is hundreds of times better than usual. Crazy fast! You can’t even get these numbers domestically, man.

name: Rintaro
line: Why do we have a direct line? Is this even possible?

name: Itaru
line: It was like this when we found it. I didn’t do anything.

name: Rintaro
line: So the building already had a hotline to SERN?

name: Rintaro
line: This can’t be a coincidence. It might just be the choice of Stei--

name: Itaru
line: It doesn’t make sense. Why would there be an independent line running from here all the way to SERN?

name: Itaru
line: No Japanese or French telecommunication company would set up something like this. Which means...

name: Rintaro
line: SERN did it themselves.

name: Itaru
line: But thanks to this direct line, we can now control the LHC remotely.

name: Rintaro
line: You figured out how!?

name: Mayuri
line: Wow! That’s amazing, Daru-kun.

name: Itaru
line: With a connection this fast, we can control the LHC practically in real-time. I haven’t actually tried it yet, though.

name: Mayuri
line: The LHC is that 20-kilometer-long tunnel thing, right? Um, what does it do again?

name: Rintaro
line: It accelerates protons and smashes them together.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh yeah. Mini black holes, right?

name: Itaru
line: The official line is that mini black holes might manifest as a byproduct of the particle collision, but that’s not the truth.

name: Rintaro
line: According to the top secret documents we found, the LHC was intended to create black holes from the very beginning.

name: Kurisu
line: Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: What’s wrong?

name: Kurisu
line: I figured it out.

name: Kurisu
line: I think I know how the PhoneWave works.

name: Rintaro
line: Really!?

name: Kurisu
line: Keep in mind that this is just a hypothesis based on what we’ve observed.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s closely related to what you guys were just talking about -- the LHC.

name: Rintaro
line: I believe it was you, Christina, who called the LHC the world’s largest microwave.

name: Kurisu
line: Yes. Exactly. My hunch was right.

name: Kurisu
line: You’ve created a monster, Okabe.

name: Kurisu
line: It doesn’t belong in some amateur lab. And before you take that as an endorsement of your abilities, I mean it in a bad way.

name: Rintaro
line: Give me details.

name: Kurisu
line: Did you know that the microwave oven was invented as a byproduct of radar research?

name: Kurisu
line: Microwaves are electromagnetic waves with a frequency of 2.45 gigahertz. The PhoneWave is commercial grade, so its output is around 1500-2000 watts.

name: Kurisu
line: Here’s the important part.

name: Rintaro
line: According to Daru’s blueprints, the microwave and the phone are made to send out shared electromagnetic waves by taking their leads...

name: Rintaro
line: And hardwiring each of them to the magnetron’s cathode and anode.

name: Kurisu
line: Both devices use electromagnetic waves. I’m not a specialist, though, so I can’t examine the extent or magnitude of the influence that fusion has...

name: Kurisu
line: But hypothetically, if the cellphone were to become a stepping stone, scattering the military-grade electromagnetic waves over a vast range of hundreds of kilometers--

name: Kurisu
line: Then not just Akihabara, but all of Tokyo would turn into the inside of a microwave oven.

name: Kurisu
line: Taking into account slight variance due to body weight, the average time until death for the people inside would be--

name: Kurisu
line: Three minutes.

name: Mayuri
line: Ehh!?

name: Itaru
line: Seriously? Then the PhoneWave’s a weapon of mass destruction, isn’t it!?

name: Kurisu
line: Let me tell you what happens inside the PhoneWave.

name: Kurisu
line: The air inside the oven is full of invisible hydrogen atoms. First, it bombards the atoms with microwaves to increase their energy potential. This is the normal function of a microwave oven.

name: Kurisu
line: But when you add the electromagnetic waves from the phone...

name: Kurisu
line: The harmonics trigger a chain reaction. The particles collide repeatedly at near light-speed, gaining mass and energy each time.

name: Kurisu
line: In other words, it becomes a sort of particle accelerator.

name: Rintaro
line: A particle accelerator!?

name: Rintaro
line: So, if the LHC was created to generate mini black holes--

name: Rintaro
line: Then the PhoneWave (name subject to change) must also produce mini black holes!

name: Kurisu
line: It’s a miracle that thing has been so stable.

name: Kurisu
line: But there’s still one thing I don’t understand.

name: Kurisu
line: Even if it does produce mini black holes, they should evaporate instantly.

name: Kurisu
line: But that’s not what happens in the PhoneWave. The gelification phenomenon proves that.

name: Kurisu
line: Just like in the LHC, our mini black holes are turning into Kerr black holes.

name: Rintaro
line: According to Titor, you have to inject electrons to produce the Kerr black hole effect.

name: Kurisu
line: Where do the injected electrons come from? That’s what I don’t understand.

name: Kurisu
line: The LHC uses something called a lifter to inject electrons into the black hole and control the gravitational field.

name: Kurisu
line: Something is filling that role inside the PhoneWave.

name: Itaru
line: S-something?

name: Kurisu
line: Like I said, I don’t know what.

name: Rintaro
line: Looks like we need to review what the LHC is.

name: Itaru
line: LHC stands for Large Hadron Collider.

name: Mayuri
line: Had drawn?

name: Kurisu
line: It’s the name of an elementary particle.

name: Itaru
line: The LHC is basically a huge circular tunnel underneath Switzerland and France.

name: Itaru
line: It sits about 100 meters below ground, and has a total length of 27 kilometers.

name: Itaru
line: There are two rings that run through the tunnel. Inside the rings is a super-low-temperature vacuum -- an environment like outer space, basically. Seriously moe.

name: Itaru
line: In an adjacent facility, protons are gradually accelerated by the linear accelerator, the Proton Synchrotron Booster, and the Super Proton Synchrotron.

name: Itaru
line: Finally, they’re injected into the LHC, where they undergo their final acceleration via a series of superconducting magnets installed in the tunnel.

name: Itaru
line: By now, they’re traveling at up to 99.9999991% the speed of light. That’s enough to melt your brain. Not as dangerous as the PhoneWave, though.

name: Itaru
line: Finally, the accelerated protons collide approximately 1 to 10 billion times per second.

name: Itaru
line: The purpose of the LHC project is to study the high energy reactions that result... or so they say. We know they’re a bunch of stinking liars.

name: Rintaro
line: And that, my fellow lab members, brings us to the question. Can the PhoneWave (name subject to change) beat SERN to true physical time travel?

name: Kurisu
line: Two problems. One, setting the destination. Two, the lifter.

name: Rintaro
line: We’ve already established that the D-Mail arrives precisely when and where it’s supposed to.

name: Kurisu
line: ...It’s dangerous to accept that without verification.

name: Rintaro
line: As for the lifter, we already know it exists. We just need to figure out what it is.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t think we’re going to find it. The PhoneWave’s not exactly big, you know, and we’ve been poking at it for days without turning up a clue.

name: Kurisu
line: Even if we do find it, it’ll take forever to learn how to tune the electron feed properly.

name: Itaru
line: How long is forever?

name: Kurisu
line: SERN’s been working on it for nine years and they still haven’t solved it.

name: Rintaro
line: Let’s look at it from a different angle.

name: Rintaro
line: SERN tried to send people back in time, but they couldn’t get the electron feed right. The singularities were not naked.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s the same with the PhoneWave (name subject to change). You can only send 36 bytes of data safely. Otherwise, you get a Jellyman.

name: Rintaro
line: Let’s consider the problem in reverse.

name: Rintaro
line: What if we could convert a human to data, then compress that data into just 36 bytes?

name: Rintaro
line: We could send that person through the ring singularity just like a D-Mail, couldn’t we!?

name: Itaru
line: Convert a human to data? That’s not even possible, man.

name: Itaru
line: And even if it were, there’d be like exabytes of data or something! You want to compress that into 36 bytes? Are you high?

name: Rintaro
line: Hmm... I thought it was a good idea...

name: Kurisu
line: Of course... If it works, then maybe...

name: Kurisu
line: Maybe we can do it!

name: Rintaro
line: Are you serious?

name: Kurisu
line: The data compression part, at least, is easy.

name: Kurisu
line: We can just use the black holes created by the LHC, since black holes compress everything they swallow.

name: Kurisu
line: Compression won’t harm data like it would harm a human. As long as we’re just sending data, there’s nothing to worry about.

name: Rintaro
line: How do you plan to convert humans into data?

name: Kurisu
line: You know that my thesis got published, right?

name: Rintaro
line: This is no time to flaunt your accomplishments.

name: Kurisu
line: Have you read it?

name: Itaru
line: I’ve got scans if you want to read it.

name: Kurisu
line: The title of my thesis is...

name: Kurisu
line: ’Analysis of Memory-Related Nerve Impulses in the Temporal Lobe’

name: Rintaro
line: ...Temporal lobe? Nerve impulses?

name: Itaru
line: What, you didn’t know?

name: Rintaro
line: No, wait. This can’t be right. This title sounds like, um, neuroscience, not physics.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m a neuroscientist. Got a problem?

name: Rintaro
line: No, forget about that. How is this related to time travel?

name: Kurisu
line: Converting an entire human to data is impossible.

name: Kurisu
line: But converting a human’s memories may be possible!

name: Kurisu
line: Imagine a chest of drawers. Each drawer is filled with tiny boxes, and inside each box is another bunch of tiny boxes. You keep opening boxes until you find the memory you’re looking for.

name: Kurisu
line: Now, before you ask how this relates to time travel, there’s one more thing I need to explain.

name: Kurisu
line: Several years ago, my lab -- the Neurophysiology Lab at Victor Condoria University -- developed a technology called Visual Rebuilding, or VR for short.

name: Kurisu
line: Put simply, it enables conversion of video data into nerve impulse signals.

name: Kurisu
line: Used in reverse, it can also convert nerve impulses into video data, or any other kind of electronic data.

name: Kurisu
line: So, if we combine VR technology with my research... do you see where I’m going?

name: Itaru
line: ...No way.

name: Rintaro
line: We can convert memories into data?

name: Kurisu
line: Not just that. Memory transplantation, backups, external storage... all of those things become possible.

name: Rintaro
line: So basically, what you’re saying is that we convert the subject’s memories into video data...

name: Rintaro
line: Use the LHC’s black hole to compress that data into 36 bytes...

name: Rintaro
line: Send that data through the Kerr black hole inside the PhoneWave (name subject to change)...

name: Rintaro
line: And finally, imprint those memories on the subject’s brain in the past.

name: Mayuri
line: What does that mean?

name: Kurisu
line: We can send our memories back in time.

name: Kurisu
line: In order to differentiate it from physical time travel, let’s call it a ’time leap’ for now.

name: Kurisu
line: You don’t go back, just your memories.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s so crazy that nobody’s thought of it before.

name: Kurisu
line: The important thing to remember is that only memories are being transferred.

name: Kurisu
line: Personality and consciousness aren’t included.

name: Rintaro
line: What does that mean? How is it different from what you see in sci-fi novels?

name: Kurisu
line: Time leaping in sci-fi usually sends everything -- consciousness, personality, and memory.

name: Kurisu
line: But in real life, there’s probably too much data, and besides, we only analyzed memories.

name: Kurisu
line: Think of consciousness, personality, and memory as separate things.

name: Kurisu
line: Memories are like the video data stored on your computer.

name: Kurisu
line: And consciousness and personality are like the OS.

name: Itaru
line: But videos can take up way more space than the OS.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s just an example.

name: Kurisu
line: For starters, it’s still not clear where personality and consciousness are located, or how they are constructed.

name: Kurisu
line: So we can’t convert them into data. Or at least, I can’t.

name: Rintaro
line: So we can only send memories. Where does that leave us?

name: Kurisu
line: Your memories aren’t the only thing that define you. Even if you send your memories to the past, it will be the receiving you’s consciousness and personality that process them.

name: Itaru
line: So in Mindorz terms, it’s like copying data from a VISTA computer to a Min95 computer?

name: Kurisu
line: Data created with the latest OS might not work on an older OS. It might cause errors.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, if you sent your current memories to yourself in elementary school, the gap between your memories and your body could have serious consequences.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, is it correct to assume that we’ll be targeting ourselves in the past?

name: Kurisu
line: Just like with D-Mail, we’re using cellphones as the transfer medium.

name: Kurisu
line: To be precise, you can only leap into your own body, and only if you had a cellphone at the time of reception.

name: Kurisu
line: If you try sending memories to someone else... umm, how do I put this... there’s a danger that the electrical signals might be rejected.

name: Itaru
line: Wouldn’t want to jump into someone else’s body. I mean, unless it’s the body of a cute girl. Uhehe!

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t ’uhehe’ me, you idiot!

name: Kurisu
line: If it just bounces off, that’s fine, but I’m worried incompatible memory data might do serious damage to the recipient’s psyche.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know what might happen. No one’s done it before, after all.

name: Kurisu
line: There are two things I do know. One, you definitely cannot go back before you were born; and two, you won’t exist in two places at once.

name: Kurisu
line: That means you don’t have to worry about causing a paradox. You can’t kill your parents before you were born.

name: Rintaro
line: So the phones act like black and white holes...

name: Rintaro
line: Heh... heh heh heh... MUHAHAHA!

name: Rintaro
line: It’s me. Everything is falling into place. The plan can now proceed to the final stage. I’m talking about Operation Verthandi, obviously.

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. Christina had me fooled. I never knew she was capable of this. It must have been the choice of Steins Gate that sent her here.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t worry. I have everything under control. Nothing can stop us now. El Psy Kongroo.

name: Rintaro
line: Were you listening? Good. Commence preparations for Operation Verthandi!

name: Kurisu
line: First, explain what that is!

name: Rintaro
line: We’re going to build your time leap machine, Christina. And you’d better not say it can’t be done! Not after showing me the way!

name: Kurisu
line: Well, this is Akihabara. I should be able to find the parts I need.

name: Rintaro
line: Then it’s decided. I’m placing you in charge of this operation. Whatever you need, ask, and it shall be yours.

name: Rintaro
line: Together, we shall complete the first time leap machine in human history!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing?

name: Kurisu
line: Thinking about the time leap machine.

name: Kurisu
line: I know we can make it, but I’m wondering what will happen if we actually use it.

name: Rintaro
line: Ah.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re thinking too hard. Finish the machine, then worry about it.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re so pompous.

name: Kurisu
line: Hey, Okabe...

name: Kurisu
line: Can I talk to you about something completely unrelated?

name: Rintaro
line: I’d rather talk about something related.

name: Kurisu
line: You told me before that I could ask you anything. Remember?

name: Kurisu
line: I think... my father hates me.

name: Rintaro
line: Very well. Speak!

name: Kurisu
line: Heh... you really are pompous.

name: Rintaro
line: I assume it was your father on the phone the other day?

name: Kurisu
line: ...Yeah.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t remember the last time he had a kind word for me.

name: Kurisu
line: Even when we were living together, before I went to America, he acted like I wasn’t there. We’re supposed to be family, aren’t we?

name: Rintaro
line: And you? How did you treat your father?

name: Kurisu
line: I was daddy’s little girl growing up. You practically had to drag me away from him.

name: Kurisu
line: My father’s a physicist. Even as a child, I loved to hear him talk about science. I couldn’t understand a word of it, but I always begged him to explain.

name: Kurisu
line: I wanted to understand his work, so I started studying physics. I must have been five.

name: Kurisu
line: Thanks to that, I always got perfect grades in math. I ignored all the other subjects, though, so my grades were a little skewed.

name: Kurisu
line: I even read my father’s papers. I was a little girl trying to comprehend theoretical physics, but I gave it everything I had. I needed to understand.

name: Kurisu
line: By sixth grade, I had learned enough that I could discuss my father’s theories with him.

name: Kurisu
line: I was so happy that I could talk to my father on his level, you know? We used to argue all night long.

name: Kurisu
line: And then I started winning those arguments. All of them.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. I can definitely see how that would make him hate you.

name: Kurisu
line: You really think that’s why?

name: Rintaro
line: I’m absolutely certain that’s why.

name: Kurisu
line: I guess he did have a lot of pride.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, one day, he suddenly stopped talking to me altogether.

name: Kurisu
line: Then he started fighting with my mom, and finally he stopped coming home.

name: Kurisu
line: I really loved my dad, so it was a big shock. I felt it was my fault things turned out that way. I couldn’t go to school, I was so depressed.

name: Kurisu
line: And then Mom recommended I study abroad.

name: Rintaro
line: You were just too talented for your own good.

name: Rintaro
line: So, how do you feel about your father now?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know...

name: Rintaro
line: He’s in Japan, right? Have you seen him at all?

name: Kurisu
line: No... he doesn’t want to see me.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s what we were talking about on the phone. I asked if we could meet, but he told me to stay away from him.

name: Kurisu
line: Even if we did meet, I wouldn’t know what to say...

name: Kurisu
line: I tried to talk to him before I left, you know? I tried so hard, but he just ignored me.

name: Kurisu
line: It hurts. Whenever I think about going to see him, I remember those times. I worry he’ll ignore me again, and then I can’t do anything.

name: Kurisu
line: Sniff...

name: Rintaro
line: Are you crying?

name: Kurisu
line: J-just a little, okay?

name: Rintaro
line: You want to reconcile with your father. Correct?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know...

name: Rintaro
line: If you didn’t, then you wouldn’t have confided in me. And you wouldn’t be crying, would you?

name: Kurisu
line: True...

name: Rintaro
line: Just be straight with him. Say ’I love you, Dad. Let’s make up.’

name: Kurisu
line: I think that’s a little out of character for me.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s your father. Stop acting like a weak little girl.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m not acting like a little girl!

name: Rintaro
line: Yes, you are. You’ll never reconcile with him like that.

name: Rintaro
line: You need to speak from the heart, give it to him straight.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s the only way to get your message across. You can’t sugarcoat it.

name: Rintaro
line: If that doesn’t work, nothing will. Then you’ll just have to hope that time heals the rift between you.

name: Kurisu
line: And how long will that take?

name: Rintaro
line: How should I know? I’m only a year older than you, remember?

name: Rintaro
line: How long has it been since you went to America?

name: Kurisu
line: Umm... seven years.

name: Rintaro
line: If nothing has changed in seven years, then maybe it will take twice that much time.

name: Kurisu
line: I... guess you’re right.

name: Rintaro
line: Well? When are you going to see him?

name: Kurisu
line: ...Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: I assume it’ll be during summer break. Make sure you let me know ahead of time.

name: Kurisu
line: Wha-wha-wha-what are you talking about!?

name: Rintaro
line: I might have plans. I’ll need to shift my schedule around.

name: Kurisu
line: Hold on a second! Don’t tell me you plan on coming along!?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course I do. You are my assistant, and I will do whatever it takes to ensure that you are in peak mental condition for the experiment.

name: Kurisu
line: Ok, you’ve had your fun. I’m in no mood for--

name: Rintaro
line: I’m being completely serious.

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll go anywhere you want -- anywhere in Japan. I’d go anywhere in the world, but I don’t have a passport or money.

name: Kurisu
line: Okabe...

name: Rintaro
line: You’re afraid you won’t know what to say, right?

name: Kurisu
line: Yeah...

name: Rintaro
line: Then that settles it. I am a master of conversation. You will have nothing to fear with Hououin Kyouma at your side!

name: Kurisu
line: ...pfft!

name: Rintaro
line: Why are you laughing!?

name: Kurisu
line: You couldn’t hold a normal conversation if your life depended on it.

name: Rintaro
line: Ah...

name: Kurisu
line: But... thanks anyway. I definitely didn’t expect you to offer to come...

name: Kurisu
line: N-not that I’m happy about it or anything!

name: Kurisu
line: I hate how you act like a nice guy sometimes! It’s confusing!

name: Kurisu
line: Um, Okabe? That offer... I can take you up on it, right?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course.

name: Kurisu
line: Then, once we’re done upgrading the PhoneWave...

name: Kurisu
line: I want you to come with me.

name: Rintaro
line: As you wish. Where is your father, anyway?

name: Kurisu
line: Aomori.

name: Rintaro
line: Aomori!?

name: Kurisu
line: That’s where he lives now.

name: Kurisu
line: What? You’re not going to back out, are you? You already promised. I’m taking you whether you like it or not, okay!?

name: Rintaro
line: ...A-Aomori it is!

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri? You’re not going home?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, I was thinking about what Okarin and Chris-chan were talking about earlier.

name: Mayuri
line: I was trying to figure out what the things you said meant, but it was all so complicated. I didn’t get any of it. Ehehe...

name: Mayuri
line: The only thing I get is that something amazing is gonna happen!

name: Rintaro
line: Indeed. The world is about to change, and we shall be the ones to lead humanity into the future.

name: Mayuri
line: You’re shining, Okarin.

name: Rintaro
line: Shining? What does that mean?

name: Mayuri
line: You’re shining. Chris-chan too. Like two bright stars in the sky.

name: Rintaro
line: That must be my aura of madness you’re sensing. Muhahaha!

name: Mayuri
line: You know, it’s been ten days since Chris-chan joined us. Can I tell you how I’ve been feeling?

name: Mayuri
line: Since Chris-chan became a lab mem, it feels like things have really started to happen, like we’re a real lab now, you know?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. I must admit, her knowledge has been a great asset.

name: Rintaro
line: Of course, the girl genius would never have joined us if not for the cunning of Hououin Kyouma!

name: Mayuri
line: That’s why you’re shining so bright now, Okarin.

name: Mayuri
line: Chris-chan is really a big help to you, I know...

name: Mayuri
line: But I can’t do anything to help...

name: Mayuri
line: I wish I were smart too... then maybe I could help.

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri...

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri. Aren’t you going to look at the stars?

name: Mayuri
line: Back when the lab just started -- before Daru-kun joined -- it was like this a lot, wasn’t it? All quiet, just the two of us.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, it was.

name: Mayuri
line: Can Mayushii stay here? Is it really okay?

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t be ridiculous.

name: Rintaro
line: All you need to do is stay.

name: Mayuri
line: Just... stay?

name: Rintaro
line: Without you, the lab would be a much less friendly place.

name: Rintaro
line: You see how Kurisu and I argue. We can be pretty stubborn, and sometimes we don’t know when to stop.

name: Rintaro
line: But when it starts to get out of hand, Mayuri, you’re always there with some ditzy, irrelevant comment to break the tension.

name: Mayuri
line: Um... are you praising me?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course I am.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t worry about a thing. Just know that you, too, are part of my plan. Muhahaha!

name: Mayuri
line: Okay. Thanks, Okarin♪

name: Mayuri
line: I’m starving! I’ll warm up some canned oden. You want some too?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah. Heat it up.

name: Mayuri
line: Coming right up!

name: Rintaro
line: I’m begging you, stick with me. If you get lost in this labyrinth of technology, you’ll never escape. Not with your sense of direction.

name: Mayuri
line: Okey-dokey! I’ll be careful.

name: Mayuri
line: Um, by the way. How is time leaping different from time travel?

name: Rintaro
line: Time travel means your whole body travels through time. The time leap will only send your memories to the past. It’s simple.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh...

name: Mayuri
line: Does that mean you can do things with time leaps that you can’t do with D-Mails?

name: Rintaro
line: D-Mails can only send instructions to the past. The past may change, or it may not. The results are unpredictable, and depend on the recipient.

name: Rintaro
line: And when the past does change, the worldline is reconfigured. Everyone loses their old memories.

name: Rintaro
line: With a time leap, on the other hand, you can give your past self not just instructions, but all of the memories you have right now... or at least, that’s the idea.

name: Mayuri
line: Ummm, so I could send the costume I’m making back to last week? I would love to have another week to prepare for ComiMa.

name: Rintaro
line: That might be possible with time travel, but not with time leaping.

name: Rintaro
line: Say you had a test last week. Now that you know the answers, you could send that knowledge to yourself and ace the test. But you couldn’t go back and hand yourself a cheat sheet.

name: Mayuri
line: So Mayushii’s mind goes into Mayushii one week ago?

name: Rintaro
line: Exactly.

name: Mayuri
line: You can’t bring stuff, but you can bring your memories... I get it.

name: Mayuri
line: But, then what about Mayushii one week ago? Where do her memories go?

name: Rintaro
line: I assume they get overwritten.

name: Mayuri
line: She disappears?

name: Rintaro
line: Your memories right now include your memories from back then. So even if she does disappear, you don’t really lose anything.

name: Rintaro
line: I guess you could say you’re just adding your memories from one week in the future.

name: Mayuri
line: Then, if Mayushii’s memories leap into the Mayushii one week ago, what happens to Mayushii now?

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii’s memories jump to the past, but my body’s still here, right? What happens to me when my memories go bye-bye?

name: Rintaro
line: You become an empty shell... no... that can’t be right. That wouldn’t make sense.

name: Rintaro
line: My assistant’s device merely records your memory data... in other words, it’s just a backup. Your original memories are still inside you.

name: Rintaro
line: Your body shouldn’t become an empty shell, and your consciousness shouldn’t leap, either.

name: Rintaro
line: Actually, won’t you become a new Mayuri, one who received memories from the future one week ago?

name: Mayuri
line: Then, does the Mayushii who had the normal memories before the time leap get erased by the Mayushii who repeated the week with extra memories?

name: Rintaro
line: That’s right. She’s erased. In other words, you relive the week. You can do things the same, or you could do something completely different.

name: Rintaro
line: And you’ll keep your old memories of the week that disappeared.

name: Mayuri
line: Then, does that mean...

name: Mayuri
line: So I redo the week, okay... but what if I decide to go to Ikebukuro with my friends instead of coming to the lab today?

name: Mayuri
line: What happens to the Mayushii talking with Okarin now?

name: Rintaro
line: The present would change to match the past, and this conversation would never happen.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh... and you wouldn’t notice the difference, Okarin?

name: Rintaro
line: Right. No one would notice.

name: Mayuri
line: That would be kinda sad...

name: Rintaro
line: For who? Me?

name: Mayuri
line: No. For Mayushii.

name: Mayuri
line: Maybe that’s why Chris-chan doesn’t want to change the past.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh! I just thought of something. Can you time leap into the future?

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe, but there wouldn’t be a point.

name: Rintaro
line: The whole point of our time leap machine is to affect past events. We don’t need to worry about the future.

name: Rintaro
line: Besides, you’re less likely to reach the future than you are the past.

name: Rintaro
line: And that’s because the future is inherently unpredictable.

name: Rintaro
line: For example, do you think you’ll have the same phone number for all eternity?

name: Mayuri
line: How should I know? Ehehe.

name: Rintaro
line: Exactly my point.

name: Rintaro
line: And remember, pagers became obsolete with the advent of cellphones. Similarly, our phones may be replaced by some other device in the future.

name: Mayuri
line: Oh... I guess I can’t go back to grade school, can I? I didn’t have a phone back then.

name: Rintaro
line: You want to go back to your elementary school days?

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh, I know exactly how you feel. If you repeat elementary school with the knowledge you have now, you’ll get top grades and have an easy time bending children to your will.

name: Mayuri
line: Yeah, and I thought maybe I could see Grandma again.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I see. I’m afraid that’s not possible.

name: Mayuri
line: Yeah... It’s too bad, but I guess I don’t really need to see her.

name: Mayuri
line: I still remember her words, her smile, and her wrinkly hand patting my head.

name: Mayuri
line: So even if I don’t see her again, I’m okay.

name: Mayuri
line: What I really want is to see little Okarin again! Ehehe!

name: Rintaro
line: Heh. Back then, I was already a scientist without equal, a titan towering above the other children.

name: Rintaro
line: You can hardly be blamed for desiring to meet the child prodigy who would one day be feared as the great mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma.

name: Mayuri
line: I don’t want to meet Hououin Whatshisface. I want to meet Okarin!

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, there’s no point. You haven’t matured at all since that time, so nothing would change if you went back to elementary school anyway.

name: Mayuri
line: Hey! That’s not true. Mayushii’s all grown up now.

name: Rintaro
line: The only thing that’s grown is how much you eat.

name: Mayuri
line: That’s not true! Mayushii’s a real woman now.

name: Mayuri
line: Besides, I think Okarin’s the one who hasn’t changed since then.

name: Rintaro
line: Isn’t that what I said? I was already a genius mad scientist when you met me! MUHAHAHA!

name: Rintaro
line: By the way, Mayuri. Have you not been working recently?

name: Mayuri
line: Working? You mean at Lemoine?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, ComiMa’s coming up, so I’m taking a few days off.

name: Mayuri
line: I’ve got costumes to make!

name: Rintaro
line: How many costumes are you making this year?

name: Mayuri
line: Three. One for Kaede-chan, one for Fubuki-chan, and then there’s one for Luka-chan.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah... it’s Moeka-san.

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, Finger! Why the long face, eh?

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Moeka-san. What are you doing here?

name: Rintaro
line: Hey, are you listening? If you have a problem, the insane mad scientist, Hououin Kyouma, will gladly assist!

name: Rintaro
line: But be warned. By the time I’m through, Akiba will be an ocean of blood... heh heh heh.

name: Rintaro
line: What is it? What’s wrong?

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean, what happened?

name: Rintaro
line: We don’t fully understand it yet. We’re in the middle of upgrading it.

name: Mayuri
line: It’s amazing! This time, we might even be able to time leap.

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t write anything about it. Otherwise we’ll have to expel you from the lab.

name: Rintaro
line: Our hacking of SERN has uncovered a new possibility for the PhoneWave (name subject to change).

name: Rintaro
line: It’s a form of time travel made possible by borrowing SERN’s equipment.

name: Rintaro
line: This discovery will begin a new age of human civilization. No longer will men be slaves to time. Any future you desire can be yours!

name: Rintaro
line: And history will record that we, the Future Gadget Laboratory, changed the world forever!

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Okarin, that was really confusing. You lost Mayushii.

name: Rintaro
line: U-unhand me!

name: Rintaro
line: The time leap is a way to send your memories to the past!

name: Rintaro
line: We found a way to make that possible. Soon we will complete the machine and become the undisputed lords of time!

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Okarin came up with the idea and Chris-chan told us how to do it. Daru-kun’s helping, and Mayushii and Okarin are shopping♪

name: Mayuri
line: Are you okay, Moeka-san? Do you feel sick?

name: Rintaro
line: I can’t be sure. There are still several problems remaining. If they don’t give us too much trouble, I guess we’ll have it done in a week.

name: Rintaro
line: On the other hand, we can’t do anything until they’re solved.

name: Rintaro
line: Everything is the choice of Steins Gate. I have faith there exists a path to success.

name: Rintaro
line: And once the door is opened, the chaos for which I have so longed shall at last descend upon the Earth. Trumpets will sound from the highest heaven, and the final battle, Ragnarok, will begin!

name: Mayuri
line: Who are you fighting, Okarin?

name: Rintaro
line: The Organization, of course. Their rule must end once and for all.

name: Mayuri
line: Wow! Don’t do anything dangerous, okay?

name: Moeka
line: Hehe...

name: Moeka
line: Hehehe...

name: Mayuri
line: What do you think is wrong with Moeka-san?

name: Rintaro
line: Muha, muhahaha, MUHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

name: Mayuri
line: Whaaah? Now Okarin’s acting weird!

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii’s worried...

name: Kurisu
line: Ah...

name: Kurisu
line: H-hey! Think you could knock!?

name: Rintaro
line: This isn’t your room. Besides, I’d have to be a fool to knock. There could be assassins lying in ambush.

name: Kurisu
line: Assassins? Here? Are you stupid?

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, Christina. What were you looking at just now, hmm?

name: Kurisu
line: I was... doing research!

name: Kurisu
line: S-stay back!

name: Kurisu
line: G-got a problem?

name: Rintaro
line: ...pfft!

name: Kurisu
line: Hey! What’s with that ’this is awful, rofl rofl’ laughter!?

name: Rintaro
line: Have no fear, Christina. Or should I call you... @channeler Chris!

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t call me that!

name: Rintaro
line: Heh heh heh, I already knew. That’s right! I realized long ago that you were an @channeler!

name: Rintaro
line: You can’t hide it from me. You reek of @channel corruption!

name: Kurisu
line: How rude! I make sure to apply light perfume every day!

name: Rintaro
line: Fool. That’s not what I meant. I’m talking about the scent of your soul.

name: Kurisu
line: My soul? What’s that supposed to mean? Explain.

name: Rintaro
line: Why? So you can learn how to hide it?

name: Kurisu
line: Sh-shut up! Just explain already.

name: Rintaro
line: There’s nothing to explain. You use @channel memes in conversation. I’d have to be stupid not to notice.

name: Kurisu
line: ...Feels bad, man.

name: Rintaro
line: That’s an @channel meme too.

name: Kurisu
line: Ugh...

name: Rintaro
line: Your soul is tainted with the essence of @channel. You cannot hide it, not in such close proximity to another who uses @channel memes in actual conversation. Your souls resonate.

name: Kurisu
line: That’s it! It’s all Hashida’s fault!

name: Rintaro
line: But it’s cute how you try to hide it, @channeler Chris.

name: Kurisu
line: DON’T CALL ME THAT.

name: Rintaro
line: But I don’t understand. You were raised in America, so how are you so familiar with @channel?

name: Kurisu
line: You can browse @channel from America. Need I say more?

name: Rintaro
line: Ahh, I get it. Living in an English-only environment made you hungry for Japanese. But did you have to resort to @channel?

name: Kurisu
line: Sure, it’s not the friendliest place, but I couldn’t find anywhere that felt more ’Japanese’.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, can I ask a favor?

name: Rintaro
line: What is it?

name: Rintaro
line: If you have something to say, say it.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t tell anyone else about this.

name: Rintaro
line: What difference does it make? Daru’s the most hardcore @channeler who ever lived, and Mayuri’s an otaku too. Even I browse @channel regularly.

name: Rintaro
line: There’s nothing to be ashamed of! Just boldly write ’Hobbies: Browsing @channel’ on your resume!

name: Kurisu
line: Not a chance, you idiot!

name: Rintaro
line: What!? You mean you’d rather post anchors on VIP!?

name: Kurisu
line: Gh, I hate myself for understanding those words!

name: Rintaro
line: Well, whatever. If it will help you focus on the time leap machine, I’ll keep your secret for now. Besides, it’s just a matter of time before you make another mistake and reveal your true colors.

name: Kurisu
line: You don’t have to worry about me. Remember that I represented my entire laboratory when we presented our research, even though there were men twice my age on the project.

name: Kurisu
line: I’m an expert at dealing with people. I’ll have no trouble keeping it a secret.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Nullpo.

name: Kurisu
line: Gah!

name: Mayuri
line: *yawn*...

name: Rintaro
line: Assistant! Explain for us all how the Time Leap Machine works.

name: Kurisu
line: In short, this device converts memories to data and sends them to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s begin with what we all know. By freak coincidence, the PhoneWave is able to produce ring singularities, much like John Titor’s time machine.

name: Kurisu
line: Through the ring singularity, we are able to send up to 36 bytes of data to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: The signal can only be received by phones. While that does limit the range of effect, it also removes an element of uncertainty from the equation.

name: Kurisu
line: Unlike D-Mails, memory data is sent in the form of a phone call, so we will be using a phone number, not an email address, to set the destination.

name: Kurisu
line: The ring singularity is made naked and stable by a device known as a lifter. In our case, that’s the 42-inch CRT downstairs.

name: Kurisu
line: The PhoneWave now has headgear attached.

name: Kurisu
line: This headgear records the nerve impulses in the temporal lobe of the brain -- specifically, the CA3 region of the hippocampus, where memories are stored.

name: Kurisu
line: Then, using VR technology, we encode the nerve impulses into electrical signal data.

name: Itaru
line: It comes out to approximately 3.24 terabytes.

name: Kurisu
line: By the way, we’ll set it up so that the data decodes automatically after a certain amount of time.

name: Kurisu
line: Anybody well versed in programming can do this. I had Hashida make the code.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, next we send the memory data through the net to the LHC in France.

name: Rintaro
line: How long does it take to send 3.24 terabytes of data?

name: Itaru
line: We have 64 direct lines in parallel. So if we send it in 64 parts...

name: Itaru
line: It should upload in about 45 seconds.

name: Kurisu
line: Next, we hijack the LHC, create a mini black hole, and use that black hole’s supergravity to compress the data into 36 bytes.

name: Rintaro
line: Will the compression take long?

name: Itaru
line: It’s practically instantaneous. 23 milliseconds or thereabouts. We’re using a black hole, after all.

name: Kurisu
line: By the way, the compression only holds in the immediate vicinity of the black hole. Once the data leaves that area, it will begin to decompress on its own.

name: Kurisu
line: This, too, takes 23 milliseconds.

name: Itaru
line: It has to make it back to the X68000 and into the PhoneWave within that window.

name: Itaru
line: It’s only 36 bytes. Shouldn’t be a problem.

name: Rintaro
line: Continue, Christina.

name: Kurisu
line: While the data is being compressed, we use the PhoneWave to generate a Kerr ring singularity. When the electron discharge phenomenon occurs, we take the 36-byte data, patch it in...

name: Kurisu
line: And send it to the past.

name: Kurisu
line: This part is just like a D-Mail.

name: Kurisu
line: The data travels to the specified time, where it arrives at the recipient’s phone.

name: Kurisu
line: By now, 23 milliseconds should have passed, so the data will be fully decompressed.

name: Kurisu
line: Next, the decoding program runs, converting the data back into nerve impulse signals.

name: Kurisu
line: These signals are discharged from from the phone’s earpiece at approximately 0.02 amperes, a pretty weak charge.

name: Kurisu
line: If the recipient has the phone to his ear, they should go straight into his brain.

name: Rintaro
line: Assuming he answers his phone.

name: Kurisu
line: If he doesn’t, the transfer fails. Fortunately, we lose nothing but that copy of the memory data.

name: Rintaro
line: Why a phone call instead of an email?

name: Kurisu
line: Because we need the recipient to put the phone to his ear. Otherwise the signals won’t reach his temporal lobe.

name: Kurisu
line: In this area you have the frontal lobe and temporal lobe of the brain. As I explained before, the hippocampus, where memories are stored, is inside the temporal lobe.

name: Kurisu
line: The phone sends out electrical impulses that pass through the temporal lobe and into the hippocampus, overwriting the recipient’s memories.

name: Kurisu
line: At the same time, the phone sends impulses that stimulate the frontal lobe as well. This is important.

name: Kurisu
line: Remember that the frontal lobe is responsible for sending retrieval signals to the temporal lobe. This is how you remember things.

name: Kurisu
line: By stimulating the frontal lobe, we force it to send retrieval signals keyed to the new memory data.

name: Kurisu
line: Thus, the recipient recalls all of those memories as if they were his own.

name: Kurisu
line: Which, of course, they are, or will be in the future.

name: Kurisu
line: This happens in less than a second.

name: Kurisu
line: Now the recipient has the same memories as the sender. The time leap is complete.

name: Kurisu
line: If the data came from one week in the future, the recipient will ’remember’ that week as if he experienced it firsthand.

name: Kurisu
line: We need to be aware that consciousness and personality aren’t transferred. Both of those depend on the recipient.

name: Itaru
line: Explain it with boobs.

name: Kurisu
line: B-boobs!?

name: Rintaro
line: Let’s say we send your memories to you in grade school.

name: Rintaro
line: Right now, you’re some kind of omnisexual pervert who thinks inanimate objects are hot. But in elementary school, you were still an innocent child.

name: Itaru

name: Kurisu

name: Kurisu
