line: Target B in custody. Requesting pickup.

name: Rintaro
line: Aaaaahhhhhh!!

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin!

name: Mayuri
line: Ah!

name: Kurisu
line: Stop, Okabe! What are you doing!?

name: Kurisu
line: Are you trying to break the machine?

name: Kurisu
line: You don’t have to break it, Okabe.

name: Kurisu
line: We already decided not to experiment. Remember?

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, put the chair down.

name: Kurisu
line: You look pale. What’s wrong?

name: Kurisu
line: Are you listening?

name: Kurisu
line: W-wait!

name: Kurisu
line: Hey. Don’t you think you’re a little old to be sitting on the ground in public?

name: Kurisu
line: So this is where you went. I’ve been looking for you.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Christina.

name: Kurisu
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: What time is it now?

name: Kurisu
line: Hey. If you have time to sit around, then you can help me with the shopping.

name: Kurisu
line: Well? Are you going to come along or not?

name: Rintaro
line: Kurisu.

name: Kurisu
line: ...That’s the first time you’ve said my name properly.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Help me.

name: Rintaro
line: Help me...

name: Kurisu
line: Tell me what happened.

name: Kurisu
line: I know you used the Time Leap Machine.

name: Rintaro
line: ...What?

name: Kurisu
line: You get a phone call, and suddenly you’re like a different person.

name: Kurisu
line: It was obvious.

name: Rintaro
line: I came from three hours in the future.

name: Kurisu
line: What happened?

name: Rintaro
line: They... killed Mayuri.

name: Rintaro
line: ...It’s all my fault.

name: Rintaro
line: I shouldn’t have told Daru to hack SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: I shouldn’t have asked you to build a time machine.

name: Rintaro
line: I shouldn’t have made Moeka a lab mem.

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri’s death... is all my fault.

name: Kurisu
line: If you know that Mayuri’s going to die, then what are you doing wasting time here?

name: Rintaro
line: ...I just don’t get it anymore.

name: Kurisu
line: What don’t you get?

name: Rintaro
line: How to save Mayuri.

name: Kurisu
line: Based on what you said, I guess the chronology protection conjecture is true.

name: Rintaro
line: No matter what I do, Mayuri dies.

name: Kurisu
line: And that’s why you keep time leaping...

name: Kurisu
line: There’s no guarantee that the machine is safe, you know.

name: Kurisu
line: Even if the machine works perfectly, repeated use may have serious side effects.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, you may become disconnected from causality itself.

name: Kurisu
line: You need to understand the risks if you’re going to continue.

name: Rintaro
line: Disconnected from causality, meaning?

name: Kurisu
line: It happens all the time in sci-fi. You’ll become trapped in a closed time loop, never aging, never dying, but doomed to repeat the same day for all eternity.

name: Kurisu
line: Worst case, you may cease to exist entirely.

name: Kurisu
line: Every trace of your existence will vanish. Nobody will remember you, because your life will have never happened.

name: Kurisu
line: Leaping through time is that dangerous.

name: Rintaro
line: ’Humans are temporal beings.’

name: Kurisu
line: Heidegger. I was thinking of that quote too.

name: Rintaro
line: I heard it from you first.

name: Kurisu
line: When?

name: Rintaro
line: This isn’t the first time I’ve leaped.

name: Kurisu
line: Right. Of course.

name: Kurisu
line: If what you said is true, then I want to save Mayuri too.

name: Kurisu
line: But as the co-creator of the Time Leap Machine, I can’t recommend its continued use.

name: Kurisu
line: Will you listen to my advice?

name: Rintaro
line: I need your help.

name: Rintaro
line: I have to save Mayuri! I can’t do it alone, but together, we might have a chance. I want... I need to believe that!

name: Rintaro
line: Please, lend me your strength.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re such a stubborn fool.

name: Kurisu
line: What you’ve been through... I’m surprised it hasn’t broken you already.

name: Kurisu
line: I’ll help.

name: Kurisu
line: Mayuri’s my friend, and a fellow lab mem.

name: Kurisu
line: And besides... I don’t want to see you in such pain.

name: Rintaro
line: I’m sorry.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t apologize.

name: Kurisu
line: Remember when I told you about my father? You really helped me out back then.

name: Kurisu
line: Now it’s my turn to return the favor.

name: Kurisu
line: I want to be your strength.

name: Kurisu
line: Besides, you still have to come with me to Aomori.

name: Kurisu
line: I know you’re going to leap no matter what I say. You are a mad scientist, after all, and mad scientists play by their own rules.

name: Kurisu
line: Hey. Aren’t you supposed to go ’muhahahaha’ or something?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah...

name: Kurisu
line: Why do I even try?

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, I’m not doing this for you, okay?

name: Kurisu
line: I’m doing it for Mayuri.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah, of course.

name: Kurisu
line: That, and I think you’ll make a good test subject.

name: Rintaro
line: Now you’re talking like SERN.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s completely different.

name: Rintaro
line: How so?

name: Kurisu
line: I only experiment on you.

name: Kurisu
line: Besides, mad scientists experiment on themselves all the time, don’t they?

name: Rintaro
line: I guess...

name: Kurisu
line: I-it’s just a joke. Don’t take it so seriously.

name: Kurisu
line: There’s not much time. I think you should have a clear plan before trying to change the future again.

name: Rintaro
line: Meaning?

name: Kurisu
line: Leap to an even earlier time.

name: Kurisu
line: Then explain the situation to me again.

name: Kurisu
line: Let’s go.

name: Kurisu
line: I understand why you can’t tell Mayuri, but why can’t you tell Hashida?

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll tell him when it’s necessary.

name: Kurisu
line: They’ll throw you in the slammer for breaking and entering.

name: Rintaro
line: In a few seconds, it won’t have happened.

name: Kurisu
line: I see. That’s how it looks from your perspective.

name: Kurisu
line: What does it look like from my perspective? What happens here after you leap?

name: Rintaro
line: ...You’ll know soon enough.

name: Rintaro
line: What’s wrong?

name: Kurisu
line: It’s nothing. I was just thinking.

name: Rintaro
line: Maybe it works like a D-Mail.

name: Kurisu
line: That would make things easier, though I kind of hope you’re wrong.

name: Rintaro
line: Because you can’t collect data if you can’t record the change?

name: Kurisu
line: Exactly.

name: Kurisu
line: I set the destination to five hours ago. You should arrive around 1:40 PM.

name: Kurisu
line: I completed the Time Leap Machine just after 2. Do you remember?

name: Kurisu
line: Nobody likes a man who can’t remember dates.

name: Kurisu
line: Be thankful that I make a habit of checking the time. I have a pretty good idea what happened when.

name: Kurisu
line: Listen, Okabe. If you’re going to keep using the Time Leap Machine, there’s one thing you must remember.

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t let go of your phone. Ever. It’s your lifeline. Your destination marker.

name: Kurisu
line: As long as you keep it with you, you can leap to any time you want.

name: Kurisu
line: But if you lose your phone... if someone else gets ahold of it...

name: Kurisu
line: If it breaks, or the battery dies...

name: Kurisu
line: The time leap will fail.

name: Kurisu
line: Once again, never let go of your phone.

name: Rintaro
line: Got it.

name: Kurisu
line: After you leap back to this afternoon, just sit tight and don’t do anything until I complete the Time Leap Machine.

name: Kurisu
line: If you accidentally prevent me from completing the machine, it will likely wreak havoc with the timeline.

name: Kurisu
line: As soon as I finish, declare that we will not experiment. Then send everyone home.

name: Kurisu
line: Ask me to stay. Tell me the truth. If you say you came from the future, I’ll probably believe you.

name: Rintaro
line: How do you know?

name: Kurisu
line: Who knows me better than myself?

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t forget. It was my mad skillz that turned the PhoneWave into a time leap machine.

name: Kurisu
line: When you told me about your time leap, I took it as proof that my theories were right. I was happy it succeeded. I really was. I didn’t doubt it was true for a second.

name: Kurisu
line: Just to be safe, I should probably give you a passphrase.

name: Kurisu
line: What I want the most right now is my own fork.

name: Rintaro
line: ...What?

name: Kurisu
line: It doesn’t mean anything, okay!?

name: Rintaro
line: You want your own fork?

name: Kurisu
line: I already have my own spoon... wait, that doesn’t matter!

name: Kurisu
line: Everything’s ready! Now get out of here!

name: Kurisu
line: Be careful. And remember...

name: Kurisu
line: I’m always on your side.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin, Okarin! Can you come here?

name: Mayuri
line: Can you hold this for me? Spread it out like ’fwapp!’

name: Itaru
line: Mayu-shi, say ’fwapp’ again.

name: Mayuri
line: Fwapp!

name: Itaru
line: I got a fwapp!

name: Kurisu
line: Stop it, perv.

name: Mayuri
line: Hmm...

name: Mayuri
line: Okay! Thanks.

name: Mayuri
line: All done♪

name: Mayuri
line: I finished before Chris-chan! We were racing.

name: Kurisu
line: You win, Mayuri. Congratulations.

name: Kurisu
line: But I’m finished too.

name: Kurisu
line: Complete.

name: Rintaro
line: We’re not experimenting.

name: Kurisu
line: Eh!?

name: Kurisu
line: I just finished and you’re already shutting it down? What I have been doing these past three days?

name: Rintaro
line: Time leaping presents a host of problems. I want to consider them all carefully.

name: Kurisu
line: H-huh. That’s... an unusually respectable opinion, coming from you.

name: Mayuri
line: Problems? I thought it was done?

name: Rintaro
line: I’ll explain later. Everyone’s tired, so let’s go home.

name: Itaru
line: We’re not going to have a party to celebrate?

name: Rintaro
line: We’ll do that another day.

name: Kurisu
line: What?

name: Rintaro
line: Are you upset?

name: Kurisu
line: ...Yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: I came from five hours in the future.

name: Kurisu
line: Is that supposed to be funny?

name: Rintaro
line: D-don’t glare like that! This isn’t right! You’re supposed to believe me!

name: Kurisu
line: What made you think I’d believe something like that!?

name: Rintaro
line: You told me so! Five hours from now, okay!?

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t be ridiculous. I would never make such a baseless projection.

name: Rintaro
line: When I told you about my time leap, you said, ’I took it as proof that my theories were right. I didn’t doubt it was true for a second.’

name: Rintaro
line: ’Don’t forget. It was my mad skillz that turned the PhoneWave into a time leap machine.’

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t talk like that!

name: Rintaro
line: What you want most right now is your own fork!

name: Kurisu
line: Wha--

name: Rintaro
line: You already have your own spoon, apparently.

name: Kurisu
line: S-she said that? I’m gonna kill myself five hours from now...

name: Kurisu
line: It feels like someone peeked into my heart. And that someone is Okabe, of all people.

name: Kurisu
line: But I think I believe you. Tell me the details.

name: Kurisu
line: I see... If what you say is true, then we have a serious problem.

name: Kurisu
line: Future me said that the chronology protection conjecture holds, but I don’t think that’s quite right.

name: Kurisu
line: That conjecture says that according to quantum theory, time travel is impossible due to the danger of disrupting causality.

name: Kurisu
line: But when you time leap, there’s no chance of a time paradox occurring.

name: Rintaro
line: So I was right.

name: Rintaro
line: The universe itself is censoring me, correcting any changes I try to make.

name: Kurisu
line: If that’s true, then time leaping can’t save Mayuri. Nothing you do will change the result.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I can’t accept that.

name: Kurisu
line: Neither can I. The world is trying to kill Mayuri? As I scientist, I refuse to believe such nonsense.

name: Rintaro
line: What about the many-worlds interpretation? I just need to observe the world where Mayuri doesn’t die.

name: Kurisu
line: The many-worlds interpretation... That might have something to do with how Mayuri’s means of death keeps changing.

name: Kurisu
line: But it’s supposed to be impossible for parallel worlds to observe each other. Why are you different?

name: Rintaro
line: Because of my esper power, Reading Steiner.

name: Kurisu
line: This is no time for your chuunibyou nonsense.

name: Rintaro
line: ...There’s no other explanation.

name: Kurisu
line: You’ve mentioned that Reading Steiner thing before. Were you actually serious?

name: Rintaro
line: Why would I make up something like that?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know, but I don’t want to rely on something that may not even exist.

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, you can’t control which possibilities you observe. Even if the many-worlds interpretation holds true, it’s unreasonable to expect that you’ll ever find a world where Mayuri doesn’t die.

name: Rintaro
line: Wait. We’re not getting anywhere. Instead of analyzing what I’ve done, let’s think about what we can do.

name: Kurisu
line: Time leaping won’t change the result. I just said that.

name: Rintaro
line: Then what do we do!?

name: Kurisu
line: Calm down.

name: Rintaro
line: How can I calm down!? Do you know how many times I’ve seen Mayuri die!?

name: Rintaro
line: Covered in blood! Gasping for breath! The light fading from her eyes! Again... and again... and again...

name: Rintaro
line: And all I could do... was watch!

name: Kurisu
line: Getting emotional won’t solve anything.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re only calm because you weren’t there!

name: Kurisu
line: ...True. I don’t know what happens five hours from now. To be honest, it doesn’t feel real at all.

name: Kurisu
line: But it’s not like I don’t believe you.

name: Kurisu
line: You have to stay strong, Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Sorry.

name: Rintaro
line: What I don’t understand is how the cause can change but the effect can stay the same.

name: Rintaro
line: It’s like causality itself is broken.

name: Kurisu
line: Maybe Kiryu Moeka shooting her isn’t the real cause of her death. Maybe it’s something larger and less obvious.

name: Kurisu
line: For example, maybe she dies because we invented a time machine, or because SERN discovered our hacking.

name: Kurisu
line: If that’s the cause, then it doesn’t really matter how she dies. Causality remains intact.

name: Rintaro
line: Can that theory explain why Nae pushed her in front of a train?

name: Kurisu
line: Oh, right... hmm...

name: Kurisu
line: Anyway, the principle of causality is absolute. Deny that, and you deny all of physics.

name: Kurisu
line: There must be a distinct cause for Mayuri’s death.

name: Rintaro
line: So if we figure out what it is, then maybe we can save her.

name: Kurisu
line: Not necessarily.

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean?

name: Kurisu
line: The problem is when the causal event occurred.

name: Kurisu
line: If it happened too far in the past... then there’s nothing we can do.

name: Rintaro
line: But I can travel to any time I had a cell phone, can’t I!?

name: Kurisu
line: No. It’s still theoretical, but I believe that one leap with our machine has a maximum range of 48 hours.

name: Rintaro
line: Why didn’t you tell me that before!?

name: Kurisu
line: Before what? I just finished the Time Leap Machine, remember?

name: Rintaro
line: Future you didn’t say anything about it either.

name: Kurisu
line: Oh, so that’s what you mean. Maybe she just didn’t have the chance.

name: Rintaro
line: So how come I can only leap 48 hours?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t know. Even I don’t understand everything that’s going on inside that thing.

name: Kurisu
line: But you can do consecutive leaps. That is, as long as the Time Leap Machine exists. For example, if the Time Leap Machine remains functional for ten straight years, you could leap back to this moment ten years from now.

name: Kurisu
line: Of course, it would take a total of 1825 leaps, so I don’t recommend it. Still, it’s theoretically possible.

name: Rintaro
line: Then what’s the problem?

name: Kurisu
line: Weren’t you listening? I said, as long as the Time Leap Machine exists.

name: Kurisu
line: When was the machine completed?

name: Kurisu
line: Exactly. An hour ago. August 13th, 2010. 2:00 PM, or thereabouts.

name: Kurisu
line: It didn’t exist before then.

name: Kurisu
line: It’s impossible to use the machine before 2 PM today.

name: Rintaro
line: So what you’re saying is...

name: Rintaro
line: I can’t go back farther than 2 PM on the 11th!?

name: Kurisu
line: Most likely.

name: Rintaro
line: Can’t you improve it!?

name: Kurisu
line: Eventually, maybe, but certainly not now.

name: Kurisu
line: I’d need a real laboratory with real equipment. It would be expensive, which means we’d need sponsors.

name: Kurisu
line: And if we go looking, I’m pretty sure SERN would crush us.

name: Kurisu
line: I’d say that’s proven by the fact that neither you nor I have leapt here from the far future yet.

name: Rintaro
line: We can’t do anything!?

name: Rintaro
line: Even with the Time Leap Machine, we can’t stop SERN from killing Mayuri five hours from now!?

name: Rintaro
line: ...Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: Hey!

name: Kurisu
line: Hey! Where are you going!?

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha! I need to talk to you!

name: Suzuha
line: ...I’m sorry. It’s all my fault.

name: Rintaro
line: ...What?

name: Suzuha
line: All because I acted like a spoiled child.

name: Suzuha
line: This time, I’m going.

name: Suzuha
line: Bye.

name: Rintaro
line: Hey! Suzuha! Wait!

name: Rintaro
line: Wha...

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha? Or could it be Moeka!?

name: Rintaro
line: So it is her!

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha!!

name: Suzuha
line: Okabe Rintaro...

name: Suzuha
line: Ow!!

name: Rintaro
line: What are you doing!?

name: Suzuha
line: ...It’s not working.

name: Rintaro
line: You know how to use that thing?

name: Suzuha
line: It’s not working...

name: Rintaro
line: Answer me, Amane Suzuha.

name: Rintaro
line: This is a time machine, isn’t it?

name: Rintaro
line: Are you a time traveler?

name: Suzuha
line: John Titor.

name: Rintaro
line: What do you mean, you’re John Titor?

name: Suzuha
line: ...Exactly what it sounds like.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m the John Titor who’s been posting on @channel.

name: Rintaro
line: ...I thought he was a guy.

name: Suzuha
line: I fooled you? Guess my camouflage worked, then.

name: Rintaro
line: Who are you hiding from?

name: Suzuha
line: ...SERN.

name: Rintaro
line: Those stories you posted... were they...

name: Suzuha
line: True? Mostly. A few exceptions.

name: Rintaro
line: So you came from 2036, and that satellite... that’s your time machine.

name: Suzuha
line: I was hoping you wouldn’t find out, but my time machine went and broke on me.

name: Suzuha
line: I really screwed up, huh?

name: Rintaro
line: I thought Titor’s time machine was loaded on a Chevy.

name: Suzuha
line: Chevy? That’s a car, right? Where’d you hear that?

name: Rintaro
line: The Titor in 2000 said so.

name: Suzuha
line: That might be me on a different worldline.

name: Suzuha
line: At least, I haven’t been to 2000. I came straight here from 2036.

name: Rintaro
line: What do you know?

name: Rintaro
line: You overheard my conversation with Kurisu, right? Why did you run to the time machine? What were you trying to do?

name: Suzuha
line: I thought it was my fault.

name: Rintaro
line: What?

name: Suzuha
line: Because I neglected my mission, SERN was able to put their plan in motion.

name: Suzuha
line: ...Is it true!?

name: Suzuha
line: Is it true that SERN kills Shiina Mayuri?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s true. I time leaped from five hours in the future.

name: Suzuha
line: Time leaped...

name: Suzuha
line: So you guys completed your time machine...

name: Rintaro
line: I need answers! What do you mean it’s your fault!?

name: Suzuha
line: I’ll tell you everything.

name: Suzuha
line: I think you need to know. You... and Makise Kurisu.

name: Suzuha
line: ...Thanks.

name: Mayuri
line: Welcome back, Okarin! Oh! Suzu-san’s with you too♪

name: Mayuri
line: I really thought we should celebrate the birth of Super PhoneWave-chan!

name: Mayuri
line: So Daru-kun and I went shopping♪

name: Kurisu
line: W-what do we do?

name: Rintaro
line: Make absolutely sure Mayuri doesn’t find out.

name: Itaru
line: What are you guys whispering about?

name: Kurisu
line: Um...

name: Rintaro
line: How many times do I have to say it? No party!

name: Mayuri
line: Come on, Okarin. That’s no fun!

name: Rintaro
line: It’s not about fun.

name: Mayuri
line: Suzu-san? Are you feeling okay?

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha, Christina, and I have important matters to discuss. That’s why I asked you to leave for the day.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii wants to hear too!

name: Itaru
line: Um, I think he’s serious.

name: Mayuri
line: But Suzu-san looks sad... Mayushii’s worried...

name: Suzuha
line: ...Sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: I want Shiina Mayuri and Hashida Itaru to stay. This concerns them too.

name: Itaru
line: A girl from the future? That’s awesome! Can I shake your hand?

name: Rintaro
line: We’re not playing around here, Daru.

name: Mayuri
line: What year were you born?

name: Mayuri
line: That’s in seven years... You haven’t been born yet, but you’re here. Uh... huh???

name: Rintaro
line: Alright, Suzuha. Let’s hear it.

name: Suzuha
line: Well, the gist is what I posted on @channel.

name: Suzuha
line: I came from future, the year 2036. In my time, the world is a dystopia ruled by SERN. There’s no war, no conflict, but no freedom either.

name: Mayuri
line: Diss-tope-ear?

name: Kurisu
line: A society where every activity is controlled by the government. In a dystopia, you’re not allowed to eat bananas unless today is banana-eating day. If you break that rule, they throw you in jail without a trial.

name: Mayuri
line: That’s terrible! Mayushii loves bananas...

name: Suzuha
line: I’m part of the Resistance fighting to free humanity from SERN’s control.

name: Suzuha
line: I came to the past to change my present.

name: Suzuha
line: From your point of view, I guess I should say the future. To change the future.

name: Mayuri
line: Um, what about finding your father? Was that a lie?

name: Kurisu
line: SERN is a research institution. They don’t have political power. I explained that to John Titor several times online.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Wait, don’t tell me. You’re ’KuriGohan and Kamehameha’!?

name: Kurisu
line: Titor came forward, so it’s only fair that I do too.

name: Rintaro
line: In that case, I’ll come clean too. I was posting under my true name, Hououin Kyou--

name: Kurisu & Suzuha
line: I know.

name: Mayuri
line: Ah, you harmonized♪

name: Suzuha
line: SERN is still a research institution in 2036.

name: Suzuha
line: The world is actually ruled by SERN’s secret backers, the Committee of 300.

name: Rintaro
line: The Committee of 300... They’re real?

name: Suzuha
line: When SERN successfully completed their time machine, they became the sole entity with power over the fourth dimension, Time.

name: Suzuha
line: In just two years, they remade the world to serve their purpose.

name: Suzuha
line: That brings us to you, Makise Kurisu.

name: Suzuha
line: In 2036, you’re apotheosized as the mother of the time machine.

name: Kurisu
line: Apotheosized?

name: Itaru
line: In Japanese, please.

name: Suzuha
line: Apotheosized. As in revered, respected.

name: Kurisu
line: Respected? Huh!? I-I am!?

name: Suzuha
line: In 2010, you pioneer time leap technology. Afterwards, you contribute to the development of SERN’s time machine. That’s what I know about Makise Kurisu.

name: Rintaro
line: Then I must be the father of the time machine, right?

name: Suzuha
line: Okabe Rintaro is a terrorist in 2036. You’re pretty infamous.

name: Rintaro
line: Wha...

name: Kurisu
line: I help SERN build their time machine? I don’t believe it.

name: Kurisu
line: SERN experiments on people against their will. They’re a disgrace to scientists everywhere. I would never collaborate with them.

name: Suzuha
line: But that’s how it is in the future.

name: Kurisu
line: How did the future me explain herself?

name: Suzuha
line: We’ve never met. By 2036, you’re already dead... sorry.

name: Kurisu
line: Well... that’s just great.

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t even make it to fifty?

name: Suzuha
line: In my time, there are two kinds of people: those who live extremely long lives, and those who die young, under suspicious circumstances.

name: Suzuha
line: People who act against SERN are erased.

name: Kurisu
line: T-they erased me?

name: Suzuha
line: ...Maybe you were being used by SERN too. Maybe they took your parents hostage and forced you to work on their time machine.

name: Kurisu
line: No... does that mean Mama’s in danger?

name: Rintaro
line: Rounders.

name: Itaru
line: What’s that?

name: Rintaro
line: SERN’s private army. Or something like that.

name: Suzuha
line: On paper, they’re an independent technology research firm. In reality, they do the dirty work for SERN all over the world.

name: Suzuha
line: So they already exist. I thought they might. In my time, they’re our number one enemy.

name: Itaru
line: D-dirty work? Does that mean like... kidnappings and assassinations?

name: Suzuha
line: In my time, yes. But I don’t think they’ve reached that level in this time yet.

name: Kurisu
line: Amane-san. You said that most of what you posted as John Titor was true, right?

name: Suzuha
line: Right.

name: Kurisu
line: Does that mean you know how the universe works? You claimed that the Everett-Wheeler model -- the many-worlds interpretation -- is correct.

name: Suzuha
line: That was a lie. Camouflage so that SERN wouldn’t target me.

name: Suzuha
line: If I mix one lie into the truth, then the bad apple spoils the barrel.

name: Kurisu
line: So you don’t know.

name: Suzuha
line: I do. By 2036, scientists have successfully modeled the structure of the universe. And it’s not the many-worlds interpretation.

name: Kurisu
line: Really? Tell me!

name: Rintaro
line: Attractor Fields...

name: Suzuha
line: Right. I told you by mail, didn’t I?

name: Kurisu
line: What sort of model is that?

name: Suzuha
line: The universe is made up of worldlines and attractor fields.

name: Suzuha
line: The universe is like this piece of yarn.

name: Suzuha
line: Countless possible worldlines exist side by side, branching out to infinity.

name: Suzuha
line: From a distance, it looks like a single string, but when you look closer, the string is actually made up of individual threads woven together.

name: Suzuha
line: At the end, those threads converge on a single point. The paths are different, but the destination is the same.

name: Kurisu
line: Isn’t that determinism?

name: Suzuha
line: Close. This model is a little looser.

name: Suzuha
line: You could say it cherry-picks from the many-worlds interpretation and the Copenhagen interpretation.

name: Rintaro
line: If the branches all lead to the same place, does that mean there’s only one world in the end?

name: Suzuha
line: Exactly.

name: Suzuha
line: The bundle of worldlines that share a point of convergence is called an attractor field.

name: Suzuha
line: There are also many attractor fields.

name: Suzuha
line: This string is Attractor Field Alpha. The threads are Alpha worldlines.

name: Suzuha
line: Blue is Beta, yellow is Gamma, and white is Delta.

name: Suzuha
line: Each is made up of countless Beta worldlines, Gamma worldlines, or Delta worldlines.

name: Suzuha
line: Attractor fields are superpositioned like this.

name: Suzuha
line: In each attractor field, the worldlines converge on a different result.

name: Suzuha
line: They don’t interact. Each attractor field is independent of the others.

name: Suzuha
line: Of course, they all diverged from a common point somewhere in the past, and they will all converge again at some point in the future, but that takes many hundreds of years.

name: Suzuha
line: You can think of the attractor fields as very long worldlines.

name: Itaru
line: Can you compare it to an eroge? Teach me, oh erotic one.

name: Kurisu
line: T-there’s no erotic one here!

name: Rintaro
line: No, he’s right. It is like an eroge. Each heroine’s route is an attractor field, and the small choices within are the individual worldlines.

name: Rintaro
line: But at the end, they all enter the true route for the grand ending.

name: Itaru
line: The only difference is the length of the common parts. By the way, I’d choose the little sister’s attractor field.

name: Rintaro
line: Whatever.

name: Kurisu
line: You guys are hopeless. Better do something quick.

name: Suzuha
line: Umm, I don’t know what you guys are talking about...

name: Kurisu
line: Just ignore them.

name: Itaru
line: But then, isn’t it impossible to change the future? It always converges in the end, right? No matter what you do, the result is the same.

name: Suzuha
line: We have to escape Attractor Field Alpha.

name: Rintaro
line: Escape?

name: Suzuha
line: In other words, we’re going to jump to a worldline in Attractor Field Beta.

name: Kurisu
line: I thought attractor fields couldn’t interact.

name: Suzuha
line: Attractor fields are normally separate, but if we go to the instant they diverge...

name: Kurisu
line: The instant they diverge... is that now?

name: Suzuha
line: I was taught that a major divergence occurs in 2010.

name: Suzuha
line: This year, an earth-shattering event causes divergence at the attractor field level. The last time such a divergence occurred was in the year 2000, and before that, in 1991.

name: Mayuri
line: Umm, what happened those years?

name: Suzuha
line: Events that changed the face of the world.

name: Mayuri
line: Huh?

name: Rintaro
line: 1991 was the collapse of the Soviet Union, right? But what happened in 2000? 2001 had the 9/11 attacks...

name: Suzuha
line: The Year 2000 Problem.

name: Itaru
line: Y2K? But that was just hype. Nothing happened.

name: Suzuha
line: That’s because the Alpha worldline we’re on represents a world where Y2K didn’t occur.

name: Suzuha
line: And that brings us to 2010.

name: Mayuri
line: Did something big happen this year?

name: Suzuha
line: What else could it be...

name: Suzuha
line: But the creation of humanity’s first time machine?

name: Mayuri
line: Oh yeah! Wow!

name: Kurisu
line: One more question.

name: Kurisu
line: These worldlines aren’t parallel worlds, are they?

name: Suzuha
line: No. Ultimately, they’re just possibilities that exist simultaneously.

name: Kurisu
line: Then how do you observe the differences between worldlines? Wouldn’t you need a god’s eye view to do that?

name: Suzuha
line: Normally. However...

name: Rintaro
line: Reading Steiner!?

name: Suzuha
line: Is that what you call it? Okabe Rintaro, you have the power to observe changes across worldlines. Correct?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah.

name: Suzuha
line: That’s the key.

name: Suzuha
line: Your power is the key to freeing the world from SERN’s rule.

name: Suzuha
line: You have the power of a god.

name: Rintaro
line: My power...

name: Suzuha
line: If you escape Attractor Field Alpha and reach a Beta worldline... then the result will change.

name: Rintaro
line: So there’s hope?

name: Kurisu
line: Wait a second.

name: Kurisu
line: How do we know this is all true? What if Amane-san is just making stuff up?

name: Suzuha
line: What!? I’m not making stuff up!

name: Kurisu
line: Calm down. I’m not trying to pick a fight.

name: Kurisu
line: But I still have questions. One, how do you know about Okabe’s power? Two, how did you know Okabe and I were in Akihabara in 2010?

name: Kurisu
line: Don’t you know a little too much for someone born in 2017?

name: Suzuha
line: ...It was written in Dad’s will.

name: Mayuri
line: What do you mean?

name: Suzuha
line: His will was what made me decide to time travel.

name: Suzuha
line: My dad was one of the founding members of the Resistance. He hid from SERN and researched time travel on his own.

name: Suzuha
line: He wanted to change the future.

name: Suzuha
line: But SERN killed him.

name: Suzuha
line: That’s why I’m here. To fulfill his dream.

name: Kurisu
line: ...I’m sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: Akihabara, 2010. The time machine created here accelerates SERN’s own time machine research.

name: Suzuha
line: We have to stop that from happening in order to guide history in a new direction.

name: Itaru
line: Stop it? How?

name: Rintaro
line: SERN already knows about us.

name: Suzuha
line: Dad believed that the ultimate cause was the very first email you sent with your time machine.

name: Rintaro
line: An email? It wasn’t because they caught us hacking?

name: Itaru
line: Like I said, nobody can catch my hacking.

name: Kurisu
line: Which email are you talking about?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, I know! Wasn’t it the email Okarin sent that said Chris-chan died?

name: Kurisu
line: Oh, that...

name: Suzuha
line: SERN probably intercepted that email and realized what it meant.

name: Rintaro
line: They were already on to us back then?

name: Itaru
line: We really jumped in the deep end, huh...

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii’s good at the breaststroke!

name: Itaru
line: Alright, then do a sexy underwater pose.

name: Rintaro
line: But how did they intercept our email? Hundreds of millions of emails are sent around the world each day.

name: Suzuha
line: SERN uses the Echelon network to collect communications pertaining to time travel research worldwide.

name: Rintaro
line: Echelon!? It really exists!?

name: Suzuha
line: Echelon sees everything. Any transmission that even hints at time travel is filtered and sent to SERN.

name: Suzuha
line: We need to find the record of that email in SERN’s database and delete it.

name: Suzuha
line: If you do that, then SERN will never know you exist. Their time machine won’t be completed in 2034. If we’re lucky, the program may be shut down entirely.

name: Itaru
line: Hmm... there wasn’t any data like that when we hacked SERN’s database.

name: Suzuha
line: The IBN 5100.

name: Itaru
line: Oh!

name: Rintaro
line: Of course! SERN’s IBN 5100 database!

name: Suzuha
line: That’s probably where they store the data from Echelon.

name: Rintaro
line: Dammit, Daru! Why didn’t we use the IBN 5100 earlier!?

name: Itaru
line: Uh... we never had one?

name: Rintaro
line: What are you talking about!? I got one, remember!?

name: Itaru
line: Huh?

name: Suzuha
line: My mission is to make sure you acquire an IBN 5100.

name: Rintaro
line: You have one!?

name: Suzuha
line: I’m going to 1975 to obtain one.

name: Rintaro
line: Alright! We need to move fast. How soon can you leave, Suzuha?

name: Suzuha
line: I was trying to leave when you caught me, but...

name: Rintaro
line: Right... your time machine’s broken.

name: Kurisu
line: Can you fix it?

name: Suzuha
line: No. I just ride it. My dad’s the one who built it.

name: Suzuha
line: I’ve memorized the manual, so I know how it works, but...

name: Kurisu
line: Maybe we can use the Time Leap Machine to go back before Amane-san’s time machine broke.

name: Itaru
line: Wait, you’re going to use the Time Leap Machine? Wasn’t the plan not to experiment?

name: Rintaro
line: We’ll use it if the situation demands. Do you know when it broke, Suzuha?

name: Suzuha
line: No... but it was probably the rain a few days ago. It’s supposed to be airtight, but the inside was all wet when I checked it today.

name: Itaru
line: Maybe it made a hole when you crashed into Radi-Kan?

name: Suzuha
line: That wasn’t a crash. The coordinates were slightly off, so it just appeared there.

name: Suzuha
line: It’s not exactly the most stable machine.

name: Rintaro
line: Anyone remember when it rained?

name: Kurisu
line: The morning of the 10th. Just before dawn.

name: Rintaro
line: Damn! We can’t get there with the Time Leap Machine!

name: Itaru
line: I think we should try to fix it.

name: Mayuri
line: Yeah! It’s a time machine, so we have plenty of time, right?

name: Rintaro
line: You’re all hungry, aren’t you? You should be.

name: Itaru
line: What’s this all of a sudden?

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii’s hungry!

name: Rintaro
line: Mayuri, Daru. I leave the shopping to you. We can come up with a plan while we eat.

name: Mayuri
line: Wow, Okarin! What are we going to do with all this money?

name: Rintaro
line: Buy food. Lots of food. Use it all!

name: Itaru
line: You just calmly hand over a 10,000 yen bill... wow, Okarin, you make it look easy! That’s why we love you! That’s why we admire you!

name: Rintaro
line: Christina. Titor.

name: Suzuha
line: Titor? Is that me?

name: Rintaro
line: Who else?

name: Suzuha
line: Why are you calling me that now?

name: Rintaro
line: Because you’re the one behind Titor’s mask.

name: Suzuha
line: Well, yeah, but...

name: Kurisu
line: Just give up. Okabe rarely calls anyone by their name.

name: Suzuha
line: Oh yeah. He always calls me ’Part-Time Warrior’ for some reason.

name: Rintaro
line: Listen, you two. I’m going to leap to 2 PM on the 11th.

name: Rintaro
line: After Titor explains herself again, we’ll start repairs on the time machine. Our goal is to have it working by this time today.

name: Kurisu
line: Is that the best plan?

name: Rintaro
line: It’s better than trying to fix it when we only have two hours left. If it doesn’t work, I’ll just keep repeating the same two days.

name: Suzuha
line: ...I’m sorry.

name: Rintaro
line: Titor. We’re counting on you to get us an IBN 5100.

name: Rintaro
line: Never forget. I’m not doing this for you, and I’m not doing it for the future. My mission is to save Mayuri.

name: Rintaro
line: Call me self-righteous if you want. However...

name: Rintaro
line: I’m doing this my way.

name: Rintaro
line: Good. Then let’s begin.

name: Kurisu
line: You’re not going to name the operation?

name: Kurisu
line: You couldn’t find a good Norse mythology-themed name?

name: Suzuha
line: Why Norse mythology?

name: Kurisu
line: I don’t think there’s a deep meaning behind it. Chuunibyou patients just love Germanic names for some reason.

name: Suzuha
line: Now that you mention it, most of our operation names in the Resistance have Germanic names too. Whenever I ask, they say it’s tradition.

name: Kurisu
line: So there’s still chuunibyou in 2036...

name: Rintaro
line: Cut the chatter!

name: Itaru
line: Let’s go take a look!

name: Mayuri
line: H-hold on, everyone!

name: Mayuri
line: Um, guys? Aren’t we forgetting something?

name: Itaru
line: Like what?

name: Mayuri
line: What about Suzu-san’s dad?

name: Suzuha
line: ...That doesn’t matter now, does it?

name: Mayuri
line: It does too! I mean, it’ll take time to fix the time machine, won’t it? We should help Suzu-san find her dad in the meantime!

name: Mayuri
line: Right?

name: Rintaro
line: But...

name: Mayuri
line: Don’t be like that, Okarin! You have to keep your promise.

name: Mayuri
line: We promised, remember? We said we’d all look for Suzu-san’s dad.

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah... I remember.

name: Mayuri
line: I know Suzu-san has a mission and stuff, but I think she also came because she really wanted to meet her dad.

name: Mayuri
line: Mayushii wants to make that happen!

name: Suzuha
line: Shiina Mayuri... you’re such a nice girl...

name: Suzuha
line: ...You’re right.

name: Suzuha
line: I thought I could find him if I came to this town.

name: Suzuha
line: I know that he was in Akihabara in 2010.

name: Rintaro
line: So your father’s real!?

name: Suzuha
line: Of course he is! At this age, he’s probably still young and cool.

name: Rintaro
line: His name was Barrel Titor, right?

name: Suzuha
line: Yeah, that’s right.

name: Mayuri
line: Wow, a foreigner?

name: Suzuha
line: No, I’m pretty sure he’s Japanese. Barrel Titor is his codename in the Resistance. I don’t think he’s using it yet.

name: Suzuha
line: I... don’t know his real name.

name: Suzuha
line: Some daughter, huh?

name: Suzuha
line: He died before he could tell me.

name: Rintaro
line: What about your surname, Amane?

name: Suzuha
line: That was my mother’s maiden name.

name: Kurisu
line: So you have no leads?

name: Suzuha
line: Leads... oh, there is one thing.

name: Mayuri
line: A pin?

name: Mayuri
line: There’s something written on it.

name: Suzuha
line: This belonged to my dad.

name: Kurisu
line: A memento...

name: Rintaro
line: Google it, Daru!

name: Suzuha
line: He was here in Akihabara, so I think we can exclude the foreign sites.

name: Itaru
line: Okay, got it.

name: Itaru
line: Nothing!

name: Mayuri
line: But this has to be some kind of hint!

name: Mayuri
line: Okay, all in favor of helping Suzu-san find her dad?

name: Rintaro
line: ...No objections.

name: Mayuri
line: Thanks, Okarin♪ Ehehe!

name: Suzuha
line: Everyone... thank you.

name: Suzuha
line: But I want to be clear that my mission to 1975 comes first. That was my dad’s final wish, after all.

name: Suzuha
line: So if we still haven’t found him by the time repairs are complete, I think we should give up. Is that okay?

name: Mayuri
line: Are you sure?

name: Suzuha
line: If we still haven’t found him by then, it just wasn’t meant to be.

name: Itaru
line: So where do we start?

name: Rintaro
line: The pin is our only hint. We’ll hit every store in Akiba that sells things like this. Maybe someone will know where it came from.

name: Suzuha
line: What kind of stores?

name: Rintaro
line: Akiba is full of niche stores where you can find strange and cool accessories.

name: Rintaro
line: How does it look?

name: Itaru
line: It’s so freaking hot in there.

name: Itaru
line: It’s worse than a sauna. Spend too much time in there and I’ll turn into Daru jerky.

name: Itaru
line: By the way, it’s not gonna fall or anything... right?

name: Suzuha
line: Can it be fixed?

name: Itaru
line: Well, I still don’t know for sure. But there is one thing I noticed just now.

name: Itaru
line: It’s built kind of like the PhoneWave.

name: Rintaro
line: That means there’s a chance, right!?

name: Itaru
line: I said I’m not sure. I need to poke around some more.

name: Rintaro
line: Daru. Super Hacka. Everything depends on your skills now.

name: Rintaro
line: You are the super hacka who will save the world. In 2036, people will worship you instead of Kurisu, the mother of the time machine.

name: Itaru
line: It’s hacker! How many times do I have to tell you!?

name: Rintaro
line: Anyway, you have two days. Do whatever it takes, Daru.

name: Rintaro
line: You’re our only hope.

name: Itaru
line: No promises, man. And why two days?

name: Rintaro
line: Well...

name: Suzuha
line: In two days, the weather conditions will be perfect for creating the ring singularity.

name: Suzuha
line: If we miss that window, we won’t have another chance until next year.

name: Rintaro
line: P-precisely!

name: Itaru
line: Fix it in two days? That’s just nuts.

name: Rintaro
line: But if you do, you’ll earn the right to a date with Faris.

name: Rintaro
line: Can you fix it?

name: Itaru
line: No problem!

name: Kurisu
line: Welcome back.

name: Kurisu
line: From the looks on your faces, I guess you didn’t find anything.

name: Rintaro
line: Where’s Daru?

name: Kurisu
line: He hasn’t come back yet. It’s already dark, so maybe he went straight home?

name: Suzuha
line: I feel bad. There’s no time for this...

name: Rintaro
line: It’s not for you. We’re doing it to save Mayuri.

name: Suzuha
line: ...Yeah.

name: Rintaro
line: Is it SERN!?

name: Kurisu
line: Good morning.

name: Rintaro
line: ...You came to wake me up? Thanks.

name: Kurisu
line: I didn’t do it for you.

name: Suzuha
line: I asked her to wake you up, Okabe Rintaro. There’s something I want to show you.

name: Rintaro
line: ...What’s this?

name: Suzuha
line: A divergence meter. The numbers indicate the divergence value of the current worldline.

name: Suzuha
line: Divergence is measured from my original worldline, which corresponds to zero.

name: Rintaro
line: You made this?

name: Suzuha
line: No. I brought it with me from 2036.

name: Rintaro
line: These are Nixie tubes, right? Whoever made this has taste. I’d happily dub it Future Gadget No. 9.

name: Kurisu
line: How exactly does it work? It shouldn’t be possible to measure changes like that.

name: Suzuha
line: I don’t know either.

name: Rintaro
line: You don’t know!?

name: Suzuha
line: Can you guess who made it?

name: Suzuha
line: You did, Okabe Rintaro.

name: Rintaro
line: Huh?

name: Suzuha
line: You made it, umm... 11 years from now. It apparently works the same way your special power does.

name: Rintaro
line: Huh...

name: Kurisu
line: So this meter lets other people check worldline divergence?

name: Suzuha
line: I wish.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m pretty sure only Okabe Rintaro would notice if the number changed.

name: Kurisu
line: What? Then there’s no point. Make something useful for once, Okabe.

name: Suzuha
line: Only the person who made it knows how it works. Wait 11 years. I’m sure he’ll have figured it out by then.

name: Rintaro
line: Have you met me in the future?

name: Suzuha
line: ...No. Never.

name: Rintaro
line: Oh...

name: Rintaro
line: So, why are you showing me this?

name: Suzuha
line: When the meter reads over 1%, you’ve made it to the Beta worldline.

name: Suzuha
line: Right. Reach 1% divergence... and you’ll save Shiina Mayuri.

name: Suzuha
line: You can have it. No point in me carrying it around. I hope you’ll find a use for it.

name: Rintaro
line: HEY, MASTER. I AM MAD SCIENTIST. SO COOOOL. SONUVABITCH!

name: Master
line: Can I help you?

name: Rintaro
line: Um, I have a question, if you don’t mind.

name: Rintaro
line: Does this look familiar?

name: Rintaro
line: I want to know where it came from. Can you help me find out?

name: Master
line: Ee... remember... remember? Hmmm, sorry, itsa little diff-cult, eh...

name: Master
line: By the way, where’d ya get this thang?

name: Rintaro
line: That’s what I want to know. I’ll compensate you.

name: Master
line: I sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: Okabe Rintaro.

name: Suzuha
line: ’Sup. Want a drink?

name: Rintaro
line: Anything?

name: Suzuha
line: Nope.

name: Suzuha
line: So what was with your English back there?

name: Suzuha
line: It sounded dumb. ’So cooool.’

name: Suzuha
line: Is that standard English in this era?

name: Rintaro
line: Of course not.

name: Suzuha
line: Oh, so it’s an Okabe Rintaro original. There’s no overseas travel in my time, so I wouldn’t know.

name: Rintaro
line: No overseas travel? What, you mean at all?

name: Suzuha
line: Pretty much. Travel permits are hard to get, and they’d never issue one for a vacation. I’d never seen a foreigner before coming to this time.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Maybe this pin is newer than we think. I mean, maybe it hasn’t been made yet.

name: Suzuha
line: Maybe I’m not meant to meet him. I mean, we’ve tried everything and still no sign. It’s just not in the cards, I guess.

name: Rintaro
line: How can you give up? We still have one more day!

name: Suzuha
line: W-why are you getting mad?

name: Rintaro
line: Everyone’s fighting for you. Don’t you get it!?

name: Rintaro
line: Me? I want to prioritize Mayuri over everything else!

name: Rintaro
line: But you’re still a lab mem, a friend! When a friend’s in trouble, you want to help them. That’s how Mayuri felt, and I agree. That’s why I’m searching!

name: Rintaro
line: So how dare you be the first to give up!?

name: Suzuha
line: Y-you don’t have to yell!

name: Rintaro
line: Don’t disappoint me like this!

name: Suzuha
line: I’m sorry. But maybe you should think about how I feel.

name: Rintaro
line: ...You’re right. I shouldn’t have said that.

name: Rintaro
line: ...Alright. What next?

name: Mayuri
line: Tutturu♪ Mayushii here.

name: Rintaro
line: Where are you now?

name: Mayuri

name: Suzuha

name: Suzuha
line: 2036 is peaceful too. People don’t even fight anymore. Did you know that?

name: Suzuha
line: Anyway, people don’t fight. Ever. About anything. All forms of conflict, war included, have vanished -- poof -- without a trace.

name: Suzuha
line: Instead, everyone has dead eyes, like fish.

name: Suzuha
line: No one has ambition. Nobody dreams. They just trudge through their lives without a single complaint.

name: Suzuha
line: Oh sure, people smile. But they never get angry or sad.

name: Suzuha
line: There’s no individuality. Everyone’s a robot.

name: Suzuha
line: You got really mad at me before, remember?

name: Suzuha
line: I was really surprised. But at the same time... I was really happy.

name: Suzuha
line: You’re all so bright and full of life. I envy you.

name: Suzuha
line: Shiina Mayuri, Hashida Itaru... even Makise Kurisu. And of course, you.

name: Suzuha
line: I want to be more like you.

name: Suzuha
line: It’s thanks to all of you that I’m still going strong.

name: Suzuha
line: Being a lab mem, even for just a little while... was great.

name: Suzuha
line: Being with you guys, even for just a little while... was great.

name: Suzuha
line: Change the future, Okabe Rintaro. Make it a world like this one, where people can be free.

name: Rintaro
line: Do you...

name: Suzuha
line: Hm?

name: Rintaro
line: Do you regret spending time with us?

name: Suzuha
line: ...What do you mean?

name: Rintaro
line: Do you regret making new friends here? New memories? Do you wish you had kept your distance?

name: Rintaro
line: You’ve already abandoned one life. Now you have to abandon another.

name: Rintaro
line: In a sense... it’s like you’re killing yourself.

name: Suzuha
line: ...Did Hashida Itaru tell you?

name: Rintaro
line: He’s worried about you.

name: Suzuha
line: Geez. I told him not to tell anybody.

name: Rintaro
line: Well? How do you feel about going to 1975?

name: Suzuha
line: ...It doesn’t matter how I feel.

name: Suzuha
line: I have to go. It’s the path I chose, and it’s what my dad wanted.

name: Rintaro
line: What if we ask you to stay?

name: Suzuha
line: I’ll go anyway.

name: Suzuha
line: One of those guys on @channel asked what right I have to change the future and decide the fate of the human race. He had a point.

name: Suzuha
line: But still... I don’t want the future to turn out like that.

name: Suzuha
line: I want the people in my time to be free like you. Free to laugh and play, fight and argue, get sad and cry.

name: Suzuha
line: If I change the future, then no one will die. Not you, not Shiina Mayuri, and not my dad.

name: Suzuha
line: Maybe I don’t have the right... but I’m going anyway.

name: Rintaro
line: Even if you can never return?

name: Suzuha
line: Aw, come on! The 70s aren’t a bad time, you know? I’ll find friends there just like you guys. We’ll have a blast!

name: Suzuha
line: Thanks, guys... really. I can’t thank you enough.

name: Mayuri
line: Don’t forget about us!

name: Itaru
line: If you want to thank me, then let’s make out.

name: Kurisu
line: Control yourself, perv.

name: Suzuha
line: Oh right. Take this.

name: Suzuha
line: This is for you, Okabe Rintaro. Keep it in the lab, will you? Somewhere out of sight is fine.

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha...

name: Itaru
line: Um... about the pin.

name: Itaru
line: Why don’t we make duplicates for all the lab mems? Make it our symbol, I guess.

name: Mayuri
line: Wow! That’s a great idea!

name: Kurisu
line: How unusually thoughtful of you.

name: Suzuha
line: Ahaha. I... I don’t know what to say.

name: Itaru
line: We already took a picture of it, so keep your pin, Amane-shi. It belonged to your dad, right?

name: Suzuha
line: Yeah... okay.

name: Mayuri
line: Okay everyone! Dahdahdahdah! Mayushii has an important announcement to make!

name: Mayuri
line: Actually... Mayushii found Suzu-san’s dad!

name: Rintaro
line: Huh?

name: Suzuha
line: What!?

name: Itaru
line: Really!?

name: Mayuri
line: Wanna meet him? You do, dontcha? Well, he’s here with us today!

name: Suzuha
line: W-where?

name: Mayuri
line: Allow me to introduce you! Suzu-san’s dad is...

name: Mayuri
line: Drrrrrrrrrrrr...

name: Itaru
line: Is that a drum roll!?

name: Mayuri
line: Tada! Suzu-san’s dad is...

name: Mayuri
line: Daru-kun!

name: Kurisu
line: That joke’s not even logical. It’s impossible for this perv to get married in the first place.

name: Itaru
line: Hey... that kind of hurts.

name: Rintaro
line: I completely agree with Christina. Daru is fated to become a wizard when he turns thirty.

name: Itaru
line: You could be nicer about it, guys... but it’s the truth, so I can’t object.

name: Suzuha
line: Um... you know... my dad wasn’t fat.

name: Mayuri
line: Geez. You’re all so mean to Daru-kun.

name: Itaru
line: Mayu-shi’s the only one to stand up for me. You’re an angel, Mayu-shi. Do you love me?

name: Mayuri
line: Nope.

name: Mayuri
line: Um, Mayushii’s one hundred millon percent sure that Daru-kun is Suzuha’s dad.

name: Kurisu
line: Okay. What’s your proof?

name: Mayuri
line: Um, I was thinking about the letters on Suzu-san’s pin...

name: Mayuri
line: After staring at it really hard, I noticed the 7 in ’7010’ looked a little weird.

name: Mayuri
line: It’s not a 7, it’s a 2. The line fell off the bottom.

name: Suzuha
line: R-really?

name: Suzuha
line: It’s so small, I can’t tell...

name: Mayuri
line: It’s easy to see on the picture we took!

name: Kurisu
line: 2010? But that’s this year!

name: Rintaro
line: Then what do the letters mean?

name: Mayuri
line: That’s easy!

name: Mayuri
line: Okabe, Shiina, Hashida, Makise. And finally, Amane.

name: Itaru
line: Wha...

name: Itaru
line: It’s our initials!?

name: Mayuri
line: So I was thinking, why 2010? And then I remembered it’s the year of the lab mems.

name: Mayuri
line: The Future Gadget Laboratory was founded this year.

name: Suzuha
line: So that’s what it is...

name: Mayuri
line: And you know, Suzu-san has lots of stories about future Okarin and future Chris-chan, but not a single story about Daru-kun, right?

name: Itaru
line: There weren’t any about Mayu-shi either.

name: Mayuri
line: Well, Mayushii’s a lab mem, but I can’t make time machines, and I don’t like fighting. Of course I’m not famous!

name: Mayuri
line: But Daru-kun’s a super hacka and Okarin’s right arm. He even helped Okarin make PhoneWave-chan. So I thought it was strange Suzu-san didn’t know him.

name: Kurisu
line: So you’re saying he used a different name?

name: Mayuri
line: Barrel Titor-san helped Okarin found the Resistance, right?

name: Mayuri
line: And he was in Akiba in 2010.

name: Mayuri
line: And he was able to build his own time machine.

name: Mayuri
line: And he knew about Okarin’s Reading Spaghetti--

name: Rintaro
line: Reading Steiner.

name: Mayuri
line: He knew about it.

name: Mayuri
line: Doesn’t that fit Daru-kun perfectly?

name: Kurisu
line: She’s right.

name: Mayuri
line: Do you remember the day Suzu-san went to meet her father?

name: Mayuri
line: She thought he would be at the time machine offline meet.

name: Mayuri
line: Daru-kun was supposed to be there too, right?

name: Itaru
line: That meet was seriously important to the history of Japanese SciFi. At least I got to sneak in while tailing Amane-shi.

name: Suzuha
line: Dad told me about that meet when I was little. I don’t remember what he said exactly, but I thought I might be able to meet him there.

name: Itaru
line: So if I’d been at the meet, everything would’ve been okay?

name: Suzuha
line: Hmm, I don’t know. I don’t think I’d have picked you out as my dad.

name: Mayuri
line: And then there’s the time machine’s name, FG204 something something... umm, what was it?

name: Suzuha
line: FG204 2nd EDITION ver. 2.31.

name: Rintaro
line: Th-that naming sense... it’s got to be Daru!

name: Mayuri
line: And FG probably stands for Future Gadget.

name: Mayuri
line: Finally, his name. Barrel Titor has to be Daru-kun!

name: Kurisu
line: Come to think of it, last night, Mayuri asked how to say ’barrel’ in Japanese.

name: Mayuri
line: Barrel is ’taru’ in Japanese. Right, Chris-chan?

name: Rintaro
line: Taru... Taru... Daru!?

name: Suzuha
line: It’s a pun!?

name: Mayuri
line: Okay, Suzu-san! Say ’Hashida Itaru’ ten times fast!

name: Suzuha
line: Wh-why?

name: Mayuri
line: Just say it and find out! Ehehe!

name: Suzuha
line: HashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaruHashidaItaru

name: Mayuri
line: Just now, didn’t it sound like ’Ditor’?

name: Kurisu
line: It did.

name: Mayuri
line: Hashidaitaru. Hashi-daita-ru. Hashi-Ditor-ru. Hashi-Titor-ru.

name: Itaru
line: ...For reals?

name: Mayuri
line: For super reals♪

name: Mayuri
line: I think she looks just like her father♪

name: Kurisu
line: That could just be the placebo effect... but now that you mention it, they kinda do look alike.

name: Rintaro
line: Nice work, Mayuri! You’ll make a great detective one day.

name: Mayuri
line: A d-detective? Ehehe! That’s the first time anyone’s said that.

name: Itaru
line: My... d-daughter? Amane-shi is my daughter?

name: Suzuha
line: Dad...

name: Itaru
line: Uh... c-c-could you call me Papa instead?

name: Kurisu
line: For once in your life, don’t be a perv...

name: Suzuha
line: Dad...!

name: Suzuha
line: I came, Dad. I came to see you... in the time machine you built.

name: Itaru
line: Yeah...

name: Suzuha
line: I’m going to finish what you started. I promise.

name: Itaru
line: Yeah...

name: Suzuha
line: Watch over me. Okay?

name: Itaru
line: I’m watching. Of course I am!

name: Itaru
line: B-by the way, was your mother cute? Request petite girl with cute face and big boobs.

name: Suzuha
line: Ahaha. That’s a secret.

name: Suzuha
line: Well! That takes care of everything I wanted to do on this worldline.

name: Suzuha
line: Guess I should be going.

name: Rintaro
line: W-wait! You’re going already? Don’t you have more to say to your father?

name: Suzuha
line: No, I’m fine now. I’m going to get an IBN 5100, just like I promised.

name: Suzuha
line: I’ll bring it to you here in Akihabara. That’s my duty, and I’ll see it through. The rest is up to you.

name: Suzuha
line: Change the future. Please.

name: Suzuha
line: Well, see you in 35 years... though I guess it’ll only be a few hours for you guys. Ahaha!

name: Suzuha
line: Oh, I almost forgot. The time machine gives off terrific ultraviolet rays when it jumps, so make sure not to look directly at it.

name: Rintaro
line: Suzuha...

name: Itaru
line: S-Suzuha!!

name: Itaru
line: I’m sure we’ll meet again!

name: Itaru
line: I’ll do my best until then! I hate myself for not knowing any other way to say it, but I’ll do my best!

name: Itaru
line: I’ll do my best, I promise! So Suzuha, do your best too!

name: Kurisu
line: Haah, whew... whew... no more... running...

name: Itaru
line: Suzuha’s 54 by now, right?

name: Itaru
line: My daughter is 30 years older than me. I don’t know if I want to see that. Feels weird, man.

name: Kurisu
line: You know, it wouldn’t be unusual for her to have grandchildren by that age.

name: Itaru
line: Y-you mean I could have great-grandkids? I don’t know if I’m ready for that, man...

name: Mayuri
line: Just be super nice to them! That’s what grandpas do!

name: Itaru
line: Please, don’t call me grandpa...

name: Tennouji
line: Okabe!

name: Rintaro
line: Oh, it’s you...

name: Tennouji
line: Hey, have you seen my part-timer?

name: Mayuri
line: If you’re looking for Suzu-san, she went 35 years--

name: Kurisu
line: Shaddup, Mayuri!

name: Tennouji
line: You know something? Where’d that girl run off to?

name: Tennouji
line: She took the last couple days off and I don’t know when she’s coming next. She won’t even answer her phone.

name: Rintaro
line: She said she went back to her hometown. She’s probably gone for good.

name: Tennouji
line: What!? You sure?

name: Tennouji
line: That brat. She didn’t say a word to me.

name: Tennouji
line: Well, whatever. I’ve got something for you, Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: ...For me?

name: Rintaro
line: What is this?

name: Tennouji
line: It’s from the lady who used to own this building. She asked me to give it to you on this day.

name: Rintaro
line: Uh... who?

name: Tennouji
line: How did you know Suzu-san anyway?

name: Rintaro
line: Where is she now!?

name: Tennouji
line: Huh? Uh, she passed away ten years ago.

name: Rintaro
line: Passed away!?

name: Rintaro
line: ...How old was she?

name: Tennouji
line: Mid-forties, I think.

name: Rintaro
line: Thank you for taking care of this letter, Mister Braun.

name: Mayuri
line: Eh? Eh? Is it from Suzu-san?

name: Itaru
line: Seriously? Why did he have it?

name: Suzuha
line: Dear Okabe Rintaro,

name: Suzuha
line: It’s me, Amane Suzuha. Hashida Titor’s daughter. It’s been a long time.

name: Suzuha
line: Though for you, I’m sure only a few hours have passed.

name: Suzuha
line: The date is June 13th, the year 2000.

name: Suzuha
line: Meaning I’m writing this ten years before you will read it.

name: Suzuha
line: I’ll get right to the point.

name: Suzuha
line: I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed

name: Suzuha
line: I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed

name: Suzuha
line: The date is June 14th, the year 2000.

name: Suzuha
line: About nine or ten years before you will read this.

name: Suzuha
line: I failed.

name: Suzuha
line: I only remembered who I was one year ago today.

name: Suzuha
line: The day Nostradamus said the King of Terror would come.

name: Suzuha
line: Stupid, stupid, King of Terror. He should have come and burned us all away.

name: Suzuha
line: For 24 years, I forgot who I was.

name: Suzuha
line: All I could remember was my name.

name: Suzuha
line: I finally remembered one year ago.

name: Suzuha
line: The day the King of Terror was supposed to come but didn’t.

name: Suzuha
line: There’s no King of Terror, but I want to die.

name: Suzuha
line: The repairs were incomplete. The time machine malfunctioned. When I arrived in 1975, I couldn’t remember anything.

name: Suzuha
line: They found me lying in the street like a broken doll and took me to a hospital.

name: Suzuha
line: Now I’ve been living on my own for years, but that’s as Hashida Suzu, a normal person who forgot the duty and mission of Amane Suzuha I only remembered last year.

name: Suzuha
line: I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed I failed

name: Suzuha
line: Something went wrong! I don’t know what. The repairs were incomplete. But it’s not Dad’s fault, it’s mine.

name: Suzuha
line: I should have gone straight to 1975. I shouldn’t have stopped in 2010, but I was selfish and now the future is doomed.

name: Suzuha
line: There’s no IBN 5100.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m so sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: For what purpose have I lived to this age?

name: Suzuha
line: I forgot my duty and lived a carefree life instead.

name: Suzuha
line: Now my life has no meaning at all.

name: Suzuha
line: It’s worthless. Worthless. Worthless.

name: Suzuha
line: I wish I hadn’t remembered.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m glad I finally remembered.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m glad I had this chance to say sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: Forgive me. Forgive me. Forgive me, forgive me, forgive me, forgive me!

name: Suzuha
line: My plan failed.

name: Suzuha
line: I spent this whole year asking myself why.

name: Suzuha
line: I finally figured it out.

name: Suzuha
line: If I hadn’t postponed my leap to 1975, this wouldn’t have happened.

name: Suzuha
line: Okabe Rintaro.

name: Suzuha
line: After the offline meet, you stopped me from going to 1975.

name: Suzuha
line: I was really happy, but that’s where it all went wrong.

name: Suzuha
line: I should have left. I shouldn’t have waited. That was my last chance.

name: Suzuha
line: That night, there was a thunderstorm. My time machine was flooded.

name: Suzuha
line: If you can go back to that day, please, please, let me leave.

name: Suzuha
line: Then, I can bring you the IBN 5100.

name: Suzuha
line: I can fulfill my mission.

name: Suzuha
line: Please. That’s all I want.

name: Suzuha
line: I promised Dad.

name: Suzuha
line: This was his dream.

name: Suzuha
line: I want to change the future.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m sorry.

name: Suzuha
line: My life was meaningless.

name: Rintaro
line: Daru... didn’t you fix the time machine?

name: Itaru
line: I... I did... I thought I did... but I mean, that was my first time repairing a time machine. I might have missed something.

name: Rintaro
line: Missed something!? Whatever you missed cost your daughter 24 years of her life!

name: Itaru
line: I didn’t do it on purpose!

name: Kurisu
line: Calm down, both of you. Hashida did everything he could. He doesn’t deserve your anger, Okabe.

name: Rintaro
line: How can you be so calm!?

name: Kurisu
line: That’s how I am. Sorry. Now calm down.

name: Rintaro
line: Gh...

name: Rintaro
line: Mister Braun!

name: Tennouji
line: Okabe! Did you hear? That satellite up and disappeared. Everyone’s talking about it.

name: Rintaro
line: Please... I need to know.

name: Tennouji
line: Huh? Know what?

name: Rintaro
line: Hashida Suzu-san... how did she die?

name: Tennouji
line: ...Why do you wanna know that?

name: Rintaro
line: I... don’t know anything about how she died.

name: Rintaro
line: I need to know what her last moments were like. I feel... that it’s my duty to know. To engrave her memory into my heart.

name: Tennouji
line: ...Sounds like you’ve got a reason.

name: Tennouji
line: What I want to know is how you knew her.

name: Rintaro
line: She was... an old acquaintance.

name: Rintaro
line: A very old acquaintance... but I still remember the time I spent with her.

name: Rintaro
line: So please... tell me.

name: Tennouji
line: I don’t like to talk about it... but alright. Listen good, Okabe.

name: Tennouji
line: It was suicide.

name: Tennouji
line: She hung herself at home. I was the one who found her.

name: Tennouji
line: She became unstable about a year before it happened. Before that, she was a nice, cheerful lady.

name: Tennouji
line: This building was hers. She gave me a place to stay.

name: Tennouji
line: She had no relatives, you know. Almost no one came to her funeral. It was a sad thing to see.

name: Tennouji
line: She handed me that letter a week before it happened. Told me to give it to a young man named Okabe Rintaro on this exact date.

name: Tennouji
line: When you moved in upstairs, I thought Suzu-san must’ve seen the future or something.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin, are you okay?

name: Kurisu
line: What are you doing, Okabe!?

name: Rintaro
line: We can’t just leave it like this! I have to do something!

name: Kurisu
line: Okabe...

name: Mayuri
line: But Okarin, are you sure?

name: Rintaro
line: Kurisu. You’re good at remembering dates, aren’t you?

name: Kurisu
line: Huh? Well, sure...

name: Rintaro
line: When did we throw that party for Suzuha?

name: Kurisu
line: Four days ago. August 9th.

name: Mayuri
line: You’re sending a D-Mail, Okarin? But won’t that make everything disappear?

name: Mayuri
line: Are you sure!?

name: Mayuri
line: Our memories with Suzu-san will disappear! Is that really okay?

name: Suzuha
line: Being with you guys, even for just a little while... was great.

name: Suzuha
line: I’m going to finish what you started, Dad. I promise.

name: Suzuha
line: Well, see you in 35 years... though I guess it’ll only be a few hours for you guys. Ahaha!

name: Suzuha
line: Change the future. Please.

name: Kurisu
line: Do you have a plan?

name: Kurisu
line: ...see? You’re shaking. We’ve only been at it for two days and you’re already exhausted.

name: Kurisu
line: We still have plenty of time to find the pin. You don’t have to be in such a hurry.

name: Kurisu
line: If you collapse, what then? I won’t be worried about you, but Mayuri sure will.

name: Kurisu
line: Take care of yourself. Got it?

name: Rintaro
line: Yeah... got it.

name: Mayuri
line: The weather’s so nice!

name: Itaru
line: Whew, hee, why did I have to come along?

name: Kurisu
line: Same... here... haah, whew... the wind’s... too strong...

name: Mayuri
line: You’re a little chubby, Daru-kun. I think you need to exercise more!

name: Itaru
line: Fat neckbeard master race...

name: Suzuha
line: What a view!

name: Suzuha
line: I thought this trip would be a waste of time at first, but I guess people need to take a break once in a while!

name: Kurisu
line: I’d rather... be working... on the time leap machine...

name: Itaru
line: This... just proves... that I belong... indoors...

name: Mayuri
line: You two are all worn out! Ehehe!

name: Suzuha
line: Come on, guys! Stamina is the key to survival!

name: Itaru
line: W-water! Where’s a vending machine!? I could kill for a glass of water!

name: Rintaro
line: Sorry, but there’s no convenience store until we cross another bridge after this one. Tough it out.

name: Itaru
line: Y-you serious? I can’t, it’s impossible...

name: Mayuri
line: Wow, Okarin. You really know the area. Have you been here before?

name: Rintaro
line: ...Yeah. Many times.

name: Rintaro
line: Big Sight’s straight ahead. It shouldn’t take more than 10 minutes to get there.

name: Itaru
line: Let’s take a break first...

name: Rintaro
line: It’s not safe there. Come on.

name: Itaru
line: Let me rest!

name: Rintaro
line: I said it’s not safe.

name: Itaru
line: Okay, okay!

name: Itaru
line: Th-that was close!

name: Itaru
line: You saved me, Okarin...

name: Mayuri
line: You know, that was almost like Okarin saw the future!

name: Kurisu
line: You got a D-Mail, didn’t you?

name: Itaru
line: Holy Land, I have returned!

name: Mayuri
line: Wow... I’ve never seen it this empty...

name: Kurisu
line: Look at all that space. It’s hard to believe they fill this whole area during ComiMa.

name: Mayuri
line: Hey! Mayushii’s hungry!

name: Itaru
line: Isn’t there a restaurant nearby? Let’s take a break.

name: Kurisu
line: I can’t believe we have to bike all the way back. What a nightmare...

name: Rintaro
line: What’s wrong, Suzuha?

name: Suzuha
line: I’m excited to see Big Sight in real life.

name: Suzuha
line: It’s gone by 2036, you know.

name: Suzuha
line: They cleared it to make way for bigger, better convention centers. Tokyo’s full of them in my time. They even moved the Dome out there.

name: Suzuha
line: Hashida Itaru called it the Holy Land. Is that how you see it in this time?

name: Suzuha
line: So this is where they have ComiMa... I’ve heard of it. Hundreds of thousands of people come, right? Mom said that’s where she met my dad.

name: Rintaro
line: Ahh, so your mother was a fujoshi.

name: Suzuha
line: I’ve always wanted to see this place. Thank you, Okabe Rintaro.

name: Suzuha
line: I feel... closer to my dad now.

name: Mayuri
line: Okarin! Suzu-san! Come on, come on!

name: Suzuha

name: Tennouji

name: Rintaro

name: Tennouji

name: Tennouji

name: Tennouji

name: Tennouji
line: She was kinda mysterious. She seemed to know exactly how things were gonna happen, like a prophet.

name: Tennouji

name: Tennouji
